loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites L. is from the village of General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. She is 34 years old and married. To make a living, Marites raises pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert K. is forty-six years old and married. His wife is a farmer and they have three children between sixteen years old and four years old.  They hope to give their children good education to the university level.

Robert's business is located at Thika road, in Nairobi, opposite a busy street where there are many upcoming business premises. He has been selling glass, window panes, paints and other items to the people in and around Nairobi for the last seven years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is transportating the glass, which is very delicate and is prone to breakages.

He works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 50,000 KES to buy more tinted glass, wire glass and mirrors to meet the demand of his customers as well as grow his business. He hopes to open other branches in other towns in future and he sees himself becoming a businessman. He describes himself as hardworking, goal oriented and determined.

loans.use: To buy tinted glass, wire glass and mirrors.

loans.name: Guluisun's Group

texts.en: Guluisun S. is the leader of the group. She is 53 and married. Her spouse earns his living by doing odd jobs. The family has two children. The elder daughter is a student, while the son is a schoolboy. The main source of the family’s income comes from their own grocery shop. All family members are drawn into this kind of business. This decision had been accepted five years ago after Guluisun's sister advised them to open a shop. Out of the profits, they have managed to make house repairs, to give an education to the daughter and to obtain a car. The loan's purpose is to expand the assortment of inventory with soft drinks, juice and detergents. In the future, the family is planning to give a proper upbringing to the children and to widen the shop. Shada E., 51, is divorced. Her only child, a son, works as a driver. Shada herself makes her bread by selling sunflower seeds, chewing gum, and cigarettes in the center of Kant. She gets some help from her son and his wife. Out of the profits, she has managed to purchase household appliances and to give an education to her grandchildren. The loan's purpose is to buy several kilograms of sunflower seeds and different sorts of cigarettes. In the future, Shada is planning to buy a new house. Janylkan J. is the treasurer of the group. She is 54 and a widow. She has three children: Both daughters are married, while the son raises money by working as a builder in Kant city and as a security guard in the medical institute. The main source of income she gets is from trading as Janylkan sells sunflower seeds, cigarettes, chewing gum, cookies and so on. Moreover, she breeds cattle and is paid a pension. Due to these activities, she has managed to arrange her son’s wedding and to make house renovations. The loan's purpose is to purchase a calf for fattening. In the future, she is planning to obtain a car and to build or purchase a new house. Galya M., 54, is married. The couple is already pensioners, but still the family raises money by farming. Fifteen years ago, Galya’s husband was a herder. His cattle business was started from one cow. Since that, they have bred cattle. Besides this, Galya earns additional income by working as a seamstress. The loan's purpose is to purchase a calf for to increase cattle stock. In the future, the family is planning to arrange their daughter’s wedding, to buy a car and to give a proper upbringing to the grandchildren. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase convenience goods

loans.name: Prosperos

texts.es:
el sr. Prosperos H. es una persona emprendedora y muy dedicado a su trabajo, Prosperos se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno.
Prosperos es padre de 4 hijos los cuales los tiene en la escuela de la comunidad en donde viven.
Prosperos sale a las 5 de la mañana para comprar ganado y luego se lo llegan a comprar a su casa.
su tiempo libre lo dedica a visitar la iglesia de la comunidad.  
el prestamo lo utilizara para comprar mas ganado y asi tener mas ganancias.
texts.en: Senor Prosperos H. is an enterprising person very dedicated to his work.  Prosperos buys and sells cattle for a living.  He is the father of 4 children, all attending the school in the community where they live.  Prosperos leaves at 5 in the morning to buy cattle, bringing those he bought to his house.  He spends his free time visiting the community church.  He will use this loan to buy additional cattle, thereby earning additional income.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Daniel Alexander

texts.es:
Daniel Alexander  T. T. tiene 18 años. Es soltero vive solo, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar.  No Tiene hijos.

Daniel pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Daniel se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y papa, además trabaja como albañil,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafios como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es culminar con los estudios y ser un buen comerciante.

Le gusta estudiar, hacer deporte y festejar las festejar del carnaval.
texts.en:
Daniel Alexander T. T. is 18 years old. He is single and lives alone in the Guaranda canton,  province of Bolívar. He has no children.   

Daniel belongs to the Guantucoto bank, located a half an hour from Guaranda. It is a group that is dedictaed to farming and cattle, especially planting corn and potatoes in the sierra and rice on the coast. This bank has 25 members.  

Daniel grows cornand potatoes. He also works as a bricklayer. He makes his purchases in Guaranda and sells in the wholesale market in the same city.  

He is asking for the loan to buy materials to plant corn and potatoes. The support of the loan will help him meet his family's needs. They face challenges such as pests and illnesses in their crops.  His dream is to finish his studies and be a good merchant.  

He likes to study, play sports and celebrate carnaval.

loans.use: Materials to plant corn and potatoes

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 31 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alfredo de 32 años y sus 4  queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El cultivo de cacao, café y coca es la actividad que realiza diariamente Rebeca; con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, lo cual ha generado que sus productos sean de muy buena calidad y muy bien apreciados en la ciudad de San Francisco, que es donde los comercializa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar su siembra, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para que pueda ampliar su siembra. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y café, asimismo comprará sacos de fertilizantes, ya que desea mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a 31 year-old mother who is loving and hard working. She lives in her own house, together with her husband, Alfredo, 32, and her four beloved children, to whom she hopes to offer a better quality of life. Each day, she works cultivating cocoa, coffee, and coca. Through her great efforts, she has achieved good productivity on her lands.  Her products are of a very good quality and are highly valued in the city of San Francisco, where she sells them.  Her favorite thing about her job is caring for her planting. She has been doing this work for 11 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products, as the sacks are very heavy and tire her our.

In the future, she hopes to buy new land so that she can plant more. This is her sixth loan through Microfinanzas Prisma and she intends to be very punctual with her repayments, as she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank, which she is very satisfied with. With the requested three thousand nuevos soles, Rebeca will buy cocoa and coffee seeds, as well as sacks of fertilizer, because she hopes to improve her production.

loans.use: to buy cocoa seeds, coffee seeds, and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has been working as a car and truck electrician for almost 15 years. He also sells electric equipment. In 2007, he opened his own shop. During this time, he has been able to build a good business reputation. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase additional tools. In the future, he hopes to continue the expansion of his business. He expects the coming year to be successful and to further increase his business productivity. His business income is important for supporting his wife and providing better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional tools

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.en:
Yuriy is married. He sells agriculture products in the small markets neighboring his town. Yuriy uses his van to get to the markets and sells the produce right off the van. The net profit is 5,000 Grivnas per month.

Yuriy started this business 10 years ago. His persistence and hard work have helped Yuriy succeed and overcome competition. He has repeat clients who buy food from him every week. So when Yuriy goes to a market, people are waiting for him right there. 

Yuriy would like to borrow 10,000 Grivnas to increase his assortment of products. His business goal is to open a bulk food store, providing for small business owners like him, good quality food they can bring to their clients.

loans.use: To increase his assortment of products

loans.name: Serafi

texts.en:
Serafi M. is 38 years of age and married with five children, ages 1 – 20 years. Serafi owns and operates a business selling fried foods in her community. She has two years of experience in this business. Serafi needs a loan of 2,500 talas to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2006, Serafi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Serafi's 6th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Consuelo; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes.   
             
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Lord of Torrechayoc". The communal bank is located in the district of Urubamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Consuelo. She is 55 years old, she is single and she has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her convenience store business. She sells basic needs products, such as rice, sugar, milk, and pasta. She wants to expand and improve her convenience store business. She requests a loan to purchase products for her store. 

She is very happy to receive a loan and she is committed to the payment terms.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a member of the Neema Githiga group in Faulu Kenya.  He has been farming for three years.  He also works as a mason to get more income.  He is a widower with five children and works hard to provide for his family.  He believes that through Faulu Kenya he will grow his business and become more stable.  He has requested 45,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Rachael has a business of tailoring, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Rachael has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase cloth  for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rachael hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Rachael hopes to own a plot of land.  Rachael is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money for herself.

loans.use: to purchase cloth  for resale

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Yan S., from Phnom Penh, Cambodia,  is a 29-year-old farmer who lives together with her two single children. Yan S. has been doing farming since she was single. She has been married for many years to Kung Nov, 29, a car driver. This couple typically makes around $8.75 in profit each day to ensure that their family has a comfortable life. Yan S. will use her loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to his work place.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to his work place

loans.name: Jill

texts.en: Jill S. is from the village of Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City. She is 35 years old and is married with three school-aged children. To make a living Jill owns and operates a livestock business. The business's main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. Jill has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2011 Jill joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jill is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jill from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock

loans.name: Lucieta

texts.es:
Lucieta nació en la ciudad de Maranura provincia de la Convención - Cusco y tiene 28 años de edad, ella ahora vive en la ciudad de Urubamba, Cusco. Lucieta es profesora y trabajó en el colegio “La Salle” y ahora esta enseñando en el colegio “Nino de Praga”. Ya es un año que enseña en este colegio y le va muy bien.  Lucieta es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que en sus tiempos libres se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos de marca “Avon”  En esta oportunidad Lucieta requiere el préstamo para comprar aumentar el capital de negocio y desea comprar mas cosméticos.  

Lucieta pertenece al banco comunal “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca” de la Asociación Arariwa  y trabaja con sus compañeras del banco comunal desde hace varios años. (La comunidad Cotowincho se encuentra ubicada a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Urubamba donde los socios se reúnen cada treinta días para realizar sus actividades correspondientes.)
texts.en:
Lucieta was born in Maranura, Cusco and is now 28 years old.   She currently lives in Urubamba, Cusco.  She was a teacher at a school called “La Salle” and now teaches at another school called “Nino de Praga.”   She has taught there for a year now and it is going very well.  

Lucieta is a hard-working, enterprising woman.  In her free time she sells Avon cosmetics.  She is requesting the loan as capital to purchase more cosmetics.  Lucieta is a member of the communal bank “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca” of the Arariwa Association and she has worked with her fellow bank members for several years.   The communal bank members meet to discuss all necessary items every 30 days in the community of Cotowincho, which is located 10 minutes from Urubamba.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Las Cuatro Fantasticas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Cuatro Fantásticas está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras; ellas son Gema Suyen P., Javiera O., Teresa Matamoros y Francisca Teresa Ríos. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora P. de 26 años quien se dedica al comercio de ropa.
Ella inicio este negocio por ayuda de sus tías quienes le mandaban ropa para vender y luego ella continúo con el negocio con ayuda de su hermana.
Mientras O. de 20 años vende ropa y zapatos desde hace 3 años e invertirá en mercadería, Matamoros de 27 años comercializa productos Arabela y Ríos de 34 años tiene carritos de hot-dog, chicha y frijoles.
texts.en:
The "Cuatro Fantásticas" group is made of up four hard-working, strong and entrepreneurial women; they are Gema Suyen P., Javiera O., Teresa Matamoros and Francisca Teresa Ríos. The group's coordinator is Mrs P., 26, who is in the clothing business.
She started this business through the aid of her aunts who used to order clothes from her to sell and then she continued in this business with the aid of her sister.
O., 20, has sold clothes and shoes for 3 years and will invest in stock, Matamoros, 27, sells Arabela products, and Ríos, 34, has a van selling hot-dogs, chicha and beans.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock for the summer season.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
La señora María Antonia L. tiene 29 años, vive en unión libre con el señor Juan Salmeron, tiene 2 hijos que estudian la primaria. 
María se dedica  a la venta de perfumes desde hace 3 años es una mujer de carácter alegre que siempre esta sonriéndole a la vida, ella inicio este negocio ya que una amiga la invito a vender productos de Fraiche y es por ello que se animo a comprar al principio compraba poquitos de 10 a 20 perfumes para hacer la prueba a ver si los vendía y el resultado que obtuvo fue satisfactorio ya que vendió todos sus productos y hasta le pedían más, así que ella le hecho todas las ganas para vender cada vez un poco más, ya que con lo poco que gana es una gran ayuda para su familia, sobre todo para sus pequeños que están en la escuela. 
Ella solicitó el préstamo para comprar más perfumes de variados olores ya que como sus clientes han incrementado no cuenta con el capital necesario para surtir sus productos y proveerles a sus clientes pero con el préstamo otorgado podrá comprar todos los productos que necesita. Ella esta feliz con su negocio ya que en el conoce a muchas personas y le da buenos beneficios que la ayudan a solventar sus gastos.
Su meta es poder hacer un local en donde pueda vender sus productos ya que en su población aun no existe una tienda en donde se vendan estos productos y seria una gran oportunidad para ella de salir adelante y darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María Antonia L. is 29 years old.  She lives in a common-law marriage with Juan Salmeron, and has 2 children who are in primary school.  María has dedicated herself to perfume sales for 3 years.  She is a cheerful woman who is always smiling at life.  She started the business when a friend of hers invited her to sell Fraiche products.  At first, she bought a small amount of 10 to 20 perfumes to test if she could sell them.  The result was satisfactory; she sold all her products and there was demand for more.  This encouraged her to sell more each time.  Even the small amount she earns is a tremendous help to her family, especially for the little ones still in school.

She requested this loan to buy a variety of perfumes since, as her clientele has increased, she doesn’t have the necessary capital to supply her business and provide to her customers.  However, with the loan granted, she will be able to buy the products she needs.  She is happy with her business since she knows many people and it helps her greatly to meet the family’s household expenses.  Her goal is to be able to open a locale where she could sell her products as the town she lives in doesn’t have a store that sells them.  It would be a great opportunity for her to get ahead and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: buy a variety of perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Jesus Manuel

texts.es:
Jesús es un cliente de 39 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa en  la parte rural del distrito de Olmos en Lambayeque. Jesús es conocido en la zona por ser una persona alegre, honrada y muy trabajadora.

La actividad a la que Jesús se dedica es la venta de abarrotes y golosinas en un puesto fijo ubicado en los interiores de su hogar. Además de vender abarrotes y golosinas Jesús vende prendas de vestir.

La tienda de Jesús es una de las más surtidas en su localidad  y él espera seguir creciendo en su negocio. Es por eso que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de  2000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de productos para su bodega (abarrotes y golosinas) y esto le permitirá seguir surtiéndola y aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.

La meta de Jesús es tener la tienda más grande de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Jesús is a 39-year-old client who lives with his wife in their own home located in the rural section of the District of Olmos in Lambayeque. He is known in the area for being a cheerful, honest, and hardworking individual.

Jesús sells groceries and candy from an established location inside of his house. In addition to groceries and candy, Jesús sells clothing.

His store is one of the best-stocked in his community and he hopes to continue growing his business. For this reason, Jesús has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to invest in the purchase of products for his store, such as groceries and candy. This will enable him to restock his store and increase his earnings so that he can improve his quality of life.

His goal is to have the largest store in his community.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and candy for his store.

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Rayda tiene 54 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Felipe de 55 años y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Son 16 horas diarias las que Rayda pasa dentro de su tienda, ya que abre a las 6 de la mañana y atiende todo el día hasta aproximadamente a las 10 de la noche. Su bodega es una de las más concurridas de su barrio, ya que sus vecinos saben que ahí siempre encuentran lo que necesitan.
Lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y le gusta mucho su trabajo y más cuando sus clientes la acompañan y conversa con ella. Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es muy respetada por la puntualidad que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor el stock de su tienda.
texts.en:
Rayda, age 54, is a kind, simple woman who lives in her own house with her husband, Felipe, age 55.  She is willing to work very hard and spends 16 hours a day in her store.  She opens at 6:00 a.m. and works all day until 10:00 p.m.  Her store is one of the most popular in the neighborhood since her customers always find what they need there.

She has been in business for a year and enjoys her work, especially when the customers keep her company and engage in conversation.  In the future she would like to see her business grow and provide her with more income.  This is her second loan through MFP and she is committed to working hard to pay it back on time.  Her communal bank is well respected for its promptness.  With the 1,000 PEN loan she plans to buy more products to improve the store's stock.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Rosalinda has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages & biscuits. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Vanancie

texts.en: Vanancie  is 36 years old and the mother of three children who are aged 6 months to 7 years old. Her husband is a driver. Vanancie owns a shop in which she sells several items such as rice, Irish potatoes, cassava flour, beans, biscuits and soap. She has owned the shop for five years and it has enabled her to educate her children and to feed them as well. She needs a loan to buy foodstuffs and make more profits. Vanancie plans to save the profits until she can build her own family house.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del banco comunal Manos Maravillosas, del distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.

Lleva dos años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela R., dinero que le ha servido para pagar los estudios de su hijo mayor (carrera técnica) y que ahora recibe un poco de ayuda de su parte.
Todavía tiene dos hijos pequeños que educar y tiene que seguir trabajando para que sus hijos tengan lo necesario.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, mandará a reparar el motor de su motocar, ya que ha presentado fallas mecánicas y no podía trabajar adecuadamente.
"Gracias a Manuela R. he podido mantener mi negocio y dar estudios a mis hijos".
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Manos Maravillosas” (Marvelous Hands) Communal Bank in Calleria district, Ucayali department. She is 42 years old and a single mother with 4 children.

For 2 years she has been working with loans through Manuela R., money that has served to pay for her eldest son's studies for a technical career. He still receives some help from her, and Juana has 2 other small children to educate. She has to continue working so that her children will have what they need.

With this new loan of 1,500 new sols, Juana will have the motor of her motorcycle-taxi repaired, since it doesn't work adequately and has shown signs of mechanical failure.

Juana says “Thanks to Manuela R. I have been able to maintain my business and offer my children education.”

loans.use: to rebuild the engine on her motorcycle-taxi.

loans.name: Hilda Teofila

texts.es: La Sra. Hilda es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 30,26,25 años de edad,  Hilda ha sabido salir adelante criando y cuidando a sus tres hijos los cuales ya son independientes, la Sra. Hilda se  dedica al comercio como vendedora de ropa, juguetes, accesorios de cocina etc. También vende productos de belleza de las marcas Esika, Lebel, Cyzone que realiza a pedido de sus clientes, viene desarrollándose en esta actividad más de 2 años; la Sra. Hilda tiene grandes deseos de progresar y salir adelante mejorando su calidad de vida, su sueño de Hilda es tener su propia tienda en su casa para poder así mejorar su negocio, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería para poder aumentar sus ventas  en los días de fiestas patrias y así aumentar sus ganancias. La Sra. Hilda está muy agradecida por haberle otorgado el crédito.
texts.en:
Ms. Hilda is a single mother of three children, ages 30, 26 and 25.  She has leaned to get ahead while raising and caring for her children who are now independent.  Her business is selling clothing, toys and kitchen accessories.  She also has been selling Esika, Lebel and Cyzone brand beauty products for over two years.

Hilda has a great desire to progress and get ahead in order to improve her lifestyle.  Her goal is to set up her own shop in her house so she can improve her business.  She plans to use the loan to buy more merchandise so she can increase sales, especially during the national holidays.  Hilda is very grateful for receiving this loan.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to increase sales.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her business. She has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.ru: Саноат проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 38 лет. Замужем. Имеет 5 детей. Ее муж находится на заработках заграницей. Сама Саноат занимается растениеводством. Она выращивает овощи для продажи. В этой области она уже 7 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян.
texts.en: Sanoat lives in the Yavan district.  She is 38 years old, married and has five children.  Her husband is working abroad.  Sanoat is involved in agriculture.  She grows vegetables for sale.  She has been in this business for seven years.  Sanoat is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is a married woman with seven children all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past ten years she has operated a vegetable shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are seasonality and high cost of transportation. She dreams of purchasing a bigger "shamba" (piece of land) to plant more vegetables in future.

With Kshs. 30,000 she wants to purchase a piece of land for growing vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land for growing vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Alma works hard to support her family. She has a scrap iron and plastics business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Alma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy scrap metal and plastic for her recycling business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal and plastic for her recycling business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a forty-year-old single mother of four children, renting a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling bananas and beans for four years, and the business is profitable, as she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Her hardship is high transport charges, and her vision is a food store plus an educated family. Mary needs the loan to buy bananas and palm oil for resale.

loans.use: to buy bananas and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Juan Pablo Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JUAN PABLO II” iniciará su quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Virginia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de perfumes, venta de neumáticos, venta de pescado, venta de medicina tradicional, venta de cremallera de auto, venta de sopas, tienda de barrio, venta de cosméticos.
 
La señora Virginia,  indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de la asesora de crédito. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescado que viene trabajando hace quince años, aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar capital (compra de pescados) que adquirirá en El Alto  y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro, salud y capacitación.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Juan Pablo II" will start their fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner) as part of Centro Collpani. It is formed by eight members and it is directed by a board of directors, which is led by Virginia. The businesses held by the members of the communal bank are diverse and among them are: perfumes sales, tire sales, fish sales, traditional medicine sales, car polish sales, soup sales, community store, and cosmetics sales.

Virginia indicates that it has been two years since she joined Pro Mujer. She joined following an invitation from a credit adviser. Currently she has a fish selling business and she has had the business for fifteen years. She learned the business from her mother.

The loan which she will take is to increase her capital, to purchase fish. She will acquire her products from El Alto and she will resell at the fairs. This form of work will help her generate an income to support her family in whatever possible. She is married and she has eight children.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the savings, health care, and orientation sessions.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Mayra Mercedes

texts.es:
Mayra de 32 años, vive en una suburbana llamada “Suburbio”, es una mujer honrada.
El negocio de ella es la venta de productos naturales, perfumes, cremas, escogió esta actividad porque desde muy pequeña le gusto el comercio.

Su horario de trabajo es lunes a domingos, desde las 10:00pm hasta las 15:00pm.
Su dificultad es la delincuencia, ya que tiene dificultad al entregar el producto.

Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de compra de perfumes, productos naturales, pastillas.
Su sueño es terminar sus estudios, y que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Mayra, age 32, is an honest woman who lives in a suburban area called “Suburbio”. Her business involves selling natural products, perfumes, and crèmes. She chose this activity because she has enjoyed the retail trade since she was a young woman.

Her work schedule is Monday through Sunday, from 10am to 3pm. The difficulty she must face is crime, since it can create challenges when delivering her products.

Mayra is requesting a loan in order to buy perfumes, natural products, and tablets. Her dream is to finish her studies and to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy to buy perfumes, natural products, and tablets.

loans.name: Simana C Group

texts.en:
Margaret is the facilitator of the Simana C group. Margaret and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Margaret takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to grow enough to ensure food security for her family and to have additional maize profits to educate her children. In the recent 2011 season, Margaret had a good maize yield harvesting seven bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Margaret was only able to harvest one bag of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Margaret and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Margaret will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Simana C group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Margaret is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica, de 27 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora. Convive con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo de seis años, vive en su casa propia, son muy unidos y todas las cosas las hacen juntos, todos los días trabajan mucho para así tener más ganancia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. EL trabajo de Jessica, consiste en la venta de abarrotes, tiene una tienda muy concurrida en una calle muy transitada, en su negocio vende de todo, desde lo mas chico hasta lo más grande, desde medicinas hasta sandalias, además verduras, juguetes y otros. Su local esta ubicado en su casa y lleva trabajando seis años ahí, le esta yendo muy bien y siente que las cosas le van bien por que desde antes supo entregar todo de sí para que las cosas le vayan bien. Se siente muy afortunada de tener a su pareja a su lado, ya que el trabaja a diario en una mototaxi y es un aporte muy importante en su hogar. Al inicio, cuando empezó a trabajar con su negocio tenía mucho miedo y temor de empezar algo por sí sola, pero la necesidad y los deseos de superarse le dieron la fuerza suficiente para venderlos. Ahora está muy contenta pues no depende de nadie y dispone de su tiempo como a ella mejor le parece. Tiene metas a corto plazo para consolidar su negocio, es por eso que desea ampliar su local y tener más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Este será el séptimo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos, además se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con sus pagos de cuotas como en los prestamos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería para su bodega ya que le falta implementar con algunas nuevas marcas de bebidas y calidad de arroz y azúcar.
texts.en:
27-year old Jessica is a friendly, hardworking woman. She lives with husband and six-year old son in their own house. They are very close and do everything together. They work hard so as to have more money and improve their standard of living.

Jessica sells groceries in her popular store situated in a busy street. She sells everything, from the smallest to the biggest item, from medicines to sandals, as well as vegetables, toys etc. The store is located in her house and she’s been running it for seven years. All is going well, and Jessica believes this is because she has known for a long time how to run a business. She feels very lucky to have her husband’s support; he drives a taxi and is an important contributor to the household. 

In the beginning Jessica was very fearful about starting a venture on her own, but need and a desire to overcome difficulties gave her the strength necessary to overcome these problems. Now she is very happy because she doesn’t have to answer to anyone and chooses how to best spend her time. Her short-term goal is to put her business on a sound footing by expanding the store and having more products for her customers. 

This will be Jessica’s seventh loan with MFP, and she hopes this will be sufficient for her to meet her goals. She promises once again to make her repayments on time as she has done in the past. With the money she plans to buy merchandise for the store since it lacks certain new brands of soft drinks and quality rice and sugar.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar, and soft drinks

loans.name: Hector De Jesús

texts.es:
Héctor trabaja en su puesto de cafetería hace más de 23 años. Ubicado en uno de los lugares más populares de la ciudad de Medellín, actualmente genera 3 empleos, Héctor vende en su negocio comidas rápidas, refrescos, y comestibles, una cafetería que necesita surtirse mucho mejor ya que tiene gran afluencia de clientes y le hace falta tener más productos, por eso con este crédito espera conseguir muchos más ingresos y generar más empleos. 

Su calidad de vida mejoraría si tuviera mayores ingresos y seguro que con el crédito podrá crecer mucho y seguir adelante con la difícil situación que se le presenta en algunas temporadas del año.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener más empleados y poderles ayudar a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Héctor has worked at a snack bar located in one of the city of Medellín’s most popular spots for over 23 years.  He generates three jobs.  He sells fast food, soft-drinks and foodstuffs.  The snack bar needs to be stocked much better because it has a lot of customers and it needs to have more products.  Because of this, he hopes with this loan to earn more income and generate more jobs.

His quality of life would improve if he had better income and he’s sure that with the loan he’ll be able to grow much more and continue forward with the difficult situation that occurs when football teams are eliminated from tournaments and his snack bar receives far fewer customers than expected.

His greatest dream is to have more employees and to be able to help them get ahead thanks to his snack bar.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his snack bar.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es: Norberto  es  una persona  muy trabajadora,  el cual  se esfuerza por  salir  adelante  día  con día, actualmente  tiene una  tienda  de  abarrotes   la  cual le  a permitido obtener  mayores  ingresos,  el esta  muy contento  por  habernos  encontrados  ya  que  nunca  había  tenido la posibilidad  de  obtener  ayuda   que  le permitiera  invertir  en su negocio, es por ello  que  en esta  ocasión requiere  realizar  la compra  de  mercancía  para   continuar   la  venta  de  productos , ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad de hacer crecer su  negocio brindado  a  sus  clientes  el excelente  servicio que  lo a caracterizado.
texts.en: Norberto is a very hard worker who makes a daily effort to get ahead.  He currently has a grocery store which has allowed him to increase his income.  He is very happy to have found us because he never has had the possibility of obtaining help toward investing in his business.  He would like to buy merchandise to continue selling products and sees that the loan will help expand business while providing enabling him to provide his customers with the excellent service to which they are accustomed.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard decided to start his export business because he recognized a need for cheaper electronics in Venezuela. Being from Venezuela, he knows that the electronics there, such as cell phones and game consoles, are about five times more expensive than in the United States. He buys them wholesale in the US and ships them to distributors in Venezuela to sell at competitive prices. His biggest challenge has been obtaining the capital he needs to continue expanding the business. Richard is proud that he has established this business as a second income for himself. This is Richard’s second loan with Accion USA. He will use it to purchase electronics for the upcoming holiday season, which will help increase sales in Venezuela.

loans.use: To purchase electronics for the upcoming holiday season.

loans.name: Maria Rubiela

texts.es: La señora Maria Rubiela tiene 51 años de edad y se ha visto en la obligación de trabajar desde que su esposo murió y quedo a cargo de sus 3 hijos. Maria Rubiela se dedica principalmente a la venta de ropa para mujer como blusas, pantalones, zapatos, accesorios, entre otros. Siempre ha soñado con establecer un punto de venta para la venta de su mercancía en el municipio de San Rafael al oriente de Antioquia, y lograr que sus ingresos aumenten para poderles brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus 3 hijos. Quiere que sus hijos estudien y por eso trabaja fuertemente todos los días en busca de que sus ventas le generen ingresos que le permitan acudir a buenos institutos de estudio. Maria Rubiela, en la búsqueda del crecimiento de su negocio, requiere de la compra de mercancía que le permita tener mayor variedad para ofrecerle a sus clientes, y de este modo, aumentar su nivel de ventas e ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria Rubiela is 51 years old and has had the obligation of working since her husband died and left her with 3 children. Maria Rubiela works mainly selling clothing for women such as blouses, pants, shoes, accessories, and other things. 

She has always dreamed of establishing her own store to sell her merchandise in the town of San Rafael to the east of Antioquia, to successfully increase her income in order to be able to give a better quality of life to her 3 children.

She wants her children to be educated and this is why she works so hard every day in search of sales, to bring in enough income to allow them to attend good schools.

Maria Rubiela, in search of a way to increase her business, wants to buy merchandise that will permit her to have a better variety to offer her clients so that she can increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es:
El señor Marco tiene 52 años de edad, esta casado y vive con sus hijas y su esposa, Marco se a dedicado por mas de 20 años a la venta de agua en coche en varias comunidades y colonias de San Lorenzo, todos en su hogar trabajan y se ayudan economicamente.
el credito lo utilizara para ajustar el capital total para comprar un automovil, el cual lo utilizara para vender agua.
Su meta es tener sus carros en buen estado para hacer mejor su trabajo y logar mejores ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Marco is 52 years old, married, and lives with his wife and daughters. For over 20 years, Marco has sold water from his vehicle in various communities and neighborhoods of San Lorenzo. Everyone in his home works and helps out economically.

The loan will help build his fund intended for purchasing a new vehicle, which Marco will use to sell water.

Marco's goal is to keep his vehicles in good condition to improve his efforts and achieve better income for his household.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for selling water.

loans.name: Freddy Héctor

texts.es: El cliente vive en Libertad.  Empezó a vender artículos de hogar y como le fue bien, compró ropa y la comercializó en el sector también.  Su trabajo lo realiza solo, de lunes a sabado.  Es casado y su esposa no trabaja por el momento.  No tiene hijos y a futuro planea tener su propio local comercial para incrementar su negocio.  Ahora necestia el préstamo para la compra de ropa de niño, manteles, planchas y otros artículos para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de ropa y artículos de hogar

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old single lady  and a mother of one child who is 14 years. She has been running a small food stall whereby she sells local meals to her customers.She has been in this business for the last two years and gets a monthly income of KES, 25,000.

She has applied for her second loan of KES. 30,000 from Vision fund Kenya which she will the entire loan amount to pay school fees for her child.She paid her previous loan successfully.

The anticipated profits she will plough back into the business.

loans.use: to pay school

loans.name: Gatrida

texts.en: Gatrida is a mother of three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She owns a cocoa garden where she gets cocoa to sell to the clients and also has an additional source of income where she sells fresh foods like tomatoes, onions and cabbages. This helps her to get income to support her family. She is a hard working lady and has future plans of buying more cocoa plantations to make sales and increase her incomes. Gatrida would like to make bigger sales for Christmas hence requesting a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza has a general store where she sells stationary and other office supplies. She learned how to run her store from the experience she gained from helping her godmother at her business. She started off with only pen and paper, but she has been able to grow and include many other products. She is seeking the loan in order to invest in new products that her clients may also want to purchase, like toys and gifts. She will also make changes the physical appearance of her store. She is 41 years old and has 2 children. Thanks to her business she has been able to educate her children and also begin the process of building a home for her family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is seeking the loan in order to invest in new products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah intends to buy good quality maize and bean seeds for planting.

loans.name: Filiberto

texts.en:
Filiberto is very hard-working. He is 46, and is married with 3 children--a 26-year-old son and two daughters ages 18 and 21. Filiberto learned masonry from his father when he was very young and worked to support his family. He has been working on his own for the last 15 years. He is known for good craftsmanship and has many customers. Filiberto is now seeking a $375 loan in order to buy the materials he needs to complete a work order. He promises to repay the loan in 4-8 months. Filiberto truly wants to serve his clients, and with your help he can. Thank you for your generosity.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Filiberto es muy trabajador, tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo de 26 años y dos hijas de 18 y 21 años. Desde pequeño Filiberto conoce el oficio de albañil, que aprendió de su padre, y para ayudar a su familia tuvo que practicar desde temprana edad. Hace 15 años se dedica a esta labor de manera independiente, hace trabajos de muy buena calidad, por lo que ahora cuenta con muchos clientes.

En estos momentos Filiberto tiene proyectos a realizar pero necesita capital para invertir por lo que solicita un préstamo de $375 dólares que destinará a la compra del material que requiere para hacer su trabajo, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Filiberto desea ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, y con tu ayuda esto puede ser posible, muchas gracias por ayudar a quien más lo necesita.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto, his wife, and his young son live in the home of his parents, on Achocalla Street in the Llojeta district of the city of La Paz. He manufactures clothing, and with his first loan from IMPRO he bought a sewing machine with an overlock. His wife began using that machine as well, and they went into the shirt-making business. Today they tailor shirts to order for boys from 10 to 15 years of age.

Their goal is to set up a shop and manufacture shirts in bulk for adults so that they can increase profits. Modesto would use this new loan to buy an industrial machine made by the Recta Company and also to buy fabric wholesale so that they can reduce outlay. His previous loan has been repaid in full.

His payment history makes him an excellent candidate for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Modesto vive en casa de sus padres con su esposa y su hijo pequeño en la calle Achocalla de la zona alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz; se dedica a la costura, y ayudado con el primer crédito otorgado por Impro compro una maquina overlock con la cual su esposa también empezó a coser y vieron la forma de confeccionar camisas. Actualmente ellos producen a pedido camisas de niños de 10 a 15 años de edad. Su objetivo es instalar un taller y poder confeccionar camisas para adultos y hacerlo en más cantidad para poder mejorar sus ingresos. Este nuevo crédito que Modesto solicita será para la compra de un maquina Industrial Recta y tela en cantidad (para rebajar el costo). El préstamo anterior ha sido cancelado en su totalidad. Su antecedente histórico con Impro, lo califica como cliente preferencial y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mrs. Mabel I. is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She has her own store. Mabel learnt her trade through 2 years of training. She started her own business in 2004. She says her business enabled her to assist her children and husband.

She is requesting a loan of $475 to buy more bags, shoes and clothes to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, bags and wrappers for sale

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
Dulce María has had a beauty salon for over a year now. She says, "My business is very important for me because it is the source of income for my family. To be able to keep my business going, I need a certain kind of equipment like hair clippers. This is why I'm requesting a loan of $1,000 for the purchase of beauty equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Dulce Maria tiene un estética desde mas de 1 años. Mi negocio es muy importante para mí ya que es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia. Para poder sacar adelante mi negocio me esta haciendo falta cierto tipo de equipo para la estética como maquinas. Por eso solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls Para la compra de equipo para la estética.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa Maria started on her own, ten years ago, with the hope of bettering herself and earning enough to provide for her everyday needs. She came to our institution two years ago hoping to increase her income, having then 10 loans and demonstrating a consistent record of responsibility and business growth.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Rosa maria incio hace diez años con esfuerzo propio todo con el deseo de superarse para poder sostener sus necesidades personales, con el deseo de incrementar sus ingresos visito nuestra institucion hace dos años teniendo a la fecha 10 creditos en los cuales a demostrado siempre responabilidad y crecimiento en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase various products for resale, including water, soft drinks, fruit, disposible dishes and glasses, etc.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Mrs. Tina is into the sale of drinks and local gin. She is the secretary of her union. She has been in business since 2003. She is 26 years old and married with four children. She needs the loan of $375 to buy more gallons of local gin to sell. She learned the business from her mother for 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of local gin for sale

loans.name: Cledes

texts.es:
In one of the furtherst barrio in the city of Juliaca, lives Señora Cledes and her family. This loving mother, along with her children and husband, live in a small rental house. They wish to own a house and with this in mind they work hard and harmoniously making beautiful and unique garments. Cledes and her loving husband, Andres, started in this artistic industry about 6 years ago. They began by only knitting/sewing hand gloves, scarves and hats from Alpaca wool in small quantities. Now, with a little bit more experience and agility, they are able to make daily about 150 pullovers or sweaters and vests. They sell them at whole prices at the local market in her native city of San Jose and in the city of Desaguadero. The demand is very high due to the good quality and great workmanship. Their only problem is that they don't have enough basic material to satisfy the high demand. Cledes, Andres and her family are requesting your help so that they are able to obtain a loan to purchase more basic material.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

En uno de los barrios más lejanos de la ciudad de Juliaca encontramos a la familia de doña Cledes. Ésta amorosa madre junto a sus hijos y esposo viven en una pequeña casa alquilada, con el anhelo de tener pronto su propio domicilio, con este deseo todos juntos trabajan muy contentos y empeñosos confeccionando hermosas y distintivas prendas de vestir.Cledes y su amoroso esposo Andrés se iniciaron en este bello arte hace seis años, en un principio sólo tejían guantes, chalinas y chullos y en pocas cantidades. Ahora con mucho más experiencia y agilidad logran realizar alrededor de 150 chompas y chalecos diarios para venderlos al por mayor en el mercado San José de su ciudad natal y en la ciudad de Desaguadero.El público al ver que sus chompas están muy bien confeccionadas y con un buen material han duplicado sus pedidos, sin embargo esta familia tiene un problema no cuenta con suficiente materia prima para cumplir con las solicitudes. Cledes, Andrés y su familia acuden en búsqueda de tu ayuda para acopiar el dinero que requieren para la compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima.

loans.use: To purchase more basic material at wholesale

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim C., 29, works as a weaver and makes items such as cotton scarves and silk (a type of long woman’s skirt make of fine silk with gold or silver decorations). On average, she earns around $4 a day of profit. Her husband owns a plot of land growing rice, and at the same time he raises pigs, making approximately $1 a day. This couple has one child. She wishes for a loan from Kiva to purchase silk to braid. The leftover will be used to buy good rice seed, fertilizers, and a water pump to water the field in case of drought.

loans.use: To purchase silk to braid and also to buy good rice seed, fertilizers, and a water pump.

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: E. Ngozi is 27, married, and has 2 children. She is a fashion designer, and she sews in several different styles. Mrs. Ngozi has been a fashion designer since 2000 and she is determined to improve her business. She is requesting a loan of $450 so she can buy more cloth and tailoring materials for the business. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Virgen Del Socavon Group

texts.es:
The “Virgen del Socavón” association has been with the Pro-Mujer family for approximately one year, completing 3 loan cycles. The association is located in the Senkata area of El Alto city. To date there are 20 members and they have demonstrated to be an organized group in repaying their loan payments.

Inside the group the majority are married with children, also all of whom are school-aged. There are a few cases where, because of lack of resources, sadly the children had to abandon their studies in school in order to help their parents in their small businesses and take care of their younger siblings.

There are different businesses within the association such as: selling chickens, carpentry, selling undergarments; but the primary activity is the sewing of athletic suits, which once produced, are sold in the La Paz markets and distributed as ordered to some schools. The Virgen del Socavón association affirms that they need capital in order to buy better quality fabric, thereby enabling their products to be of better quality and gain more customers resulting in more earnings with the sole objective of improving their economic situation and offering their children a better standards of living and an education.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La asociación denominada “Virgen del Socavón ” pertenece a la familia de pro-mujer hace ya un año aproximadamente cumpliendo con 3 ciclos de crédito, esta se encuentra en la zona de Senkata, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con 20 socias activas y han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.

Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, casi todos en edad escolar, existiendo algunos casos que por falta de recursos lastimosamente sus hijos tuvieron que abandonar sus estudios ya que estos deben ayudar a sus padres en sus pequeños negocios y cuidar de sus hermanos menores.

Existen diferentes negocios dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de carne de pollo, la carpintería, venta de ropa intima pero la actividad principal es la costura de prendas deportivas que una vez producidas las venden en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y la distribuyen a pedido en algunos centros educativos. La asociación Virgen del Socavón afirma que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de telas de mejor calidad de esta manera sus productos también tendrían mejor calidad y así obtendrían mayores clientes y por consiguiente mayores ganancias con el único objetivo de mejorar su situación económica de esta manera ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor forma de vida principalmente en su educación.

loans.use: Capital to purchase better quality raw materials

loans.name: Moutawakilou

texts.fr:
Mr. Moutawakilou M. is 40 years old, married , and father of two children. To earn money he runs a general store in Adéta, a town located around 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With his first loan from FECECAV, he would like to purchase drinks, rice, cookies, canned foods, and various other goods to increase the capacity of his business. With this expansion, he can better respond to customer demand and meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur Moutawakilou M. est âgé de 40 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent il opère un marché général à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec son premier crédit de FECECAV, il souhaite acheter les boissons, du riz, les biscuits, les boites de conserves et les autres produits variés pour augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Avec cet agrandissement, il peut mieux répondre aux demandes de ses clients et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Increase the capacity of his business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is a married man, his wife is the co-borrower. This couple has two children, an 18 year old son Gustavo and a 16 year old daughter Veronica. The family has three sources of income: One is Juan's service as a contractor in brick masonry, another is his wife's work making bread and other baked goods and finally they rent a car that offers service as a taxi. Due to an insufficient workforce and the increase in construction work in the city in which Juan lives, he always has work, and his wife is well known for her baked goods and has quite a few clients. The current loan will be destined to the purchase of construction material necessary for the repair of Juan's property such as bricks, cement, work, etc. This is the third loan that Juan has requested from this institution which is why it is known that he has a good record in making the loan payments. It should be noted that at the time the photo was taken Juan wasn't present so the photo was taken of his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan es un señor casado, su esposa es la codeudora y esta pareja cuenta con dos hijos de 18 años (Gustavo) y 16 años (Veronica). La familia tiena tres fuentes de ingreso: Una es que Juan presta sus servicios como contratista albañil, su esposa por otra parte se dedica a la elaboración de pan y otros productos horneados, y por último rentan una movilidad que ofrece sus servcicios como taxi. Debido a la falta de mano de obra y el incremento en las construcciones en la ciudad de residencia de Juan, siempre cuenta con trabajo, por otra parte su esposa es muy conocida por los horneados que realiza y cuenta con bastante clientela. La presente solicitud será destinada a la compra de material de construcción necesaria para la refacción del inmueble de Juan como son ladrillos, cemento, madera y otros. Esta es la tercera solicitud que solicita Juan en nuestra institución por lo que sabemos que tiene un buen cumplimiento en el pago de sus cuotas. Se hace notar que en el momento de la foto no estaba Juan por lo que la misma se tomó a su esposa.

loans.use: Materials for home repairs

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs. Maritza Elizabeth, is 47 years old, is married, and studied until the 5th year of secondary school and did continue to study because she got married. She has 4 children, 3 of which are working, and her last daughter is a student of secondary school level.

To help herself economically, 2 years ago she began to sell chicken in the market and also has a cosmetology business in her home in the District of San Pedro de Lloc, in the Province of Pacasmayo, in the Department of La Libertad. While working in the market she met a lady who received loans from Manuela Ramos, through her invitation she was able to become a member of the “Liberty” Communal Bank.

She began to sell more, and with the first loan of S/. 300.00 she purchased a scale, which she urgently needed because she rented one and that had become very costly. With the loan of S/. 1000.00 that will be repaid within 6 months, she intends to invest in the purchase of chicken, hair dyes, curling products and scissors. The entrepreneur dreams of seeing her daughter become a professional, and she will continue working for her future. In the short-term she would like to buy a television and fix her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maritza Elizabeth, tiene 47 años, está casada, estudió hasta 5to año de secundaria no continuó estudiando porque se casó, tiene 04 hijos, 03 se encuentran trabajando, y su ultima hija es estudiante del nivel secundaria. Para ayudarse económicamente se dedica hace 02 años a vender pollo en el mercadillo y también tiene un negocio de cosmetología en su casa en el Distrito de San Pedro de Lloc en la Provincia de Pacasmayo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Como ella trabaja en el mercado sé conoció con una señora que solicitaba crédito en Manuela Ramos, por invitación de ella ingresa al Banco Comunal “LIBERTAD”, empezó a vender más, y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró 01 balanza, la que necesitaba con urgencia porque al no tenerla la alquilaba y eso le resultaba muy costoso. Con el crédito de S/. 1000.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses tiene pensado invertir en la compra de pollo, tintes, liquido para ondulaciones, tijeras. La empresaria sueña con ver a su hija profesional para lo cual tiene que continuar trabajando además a un corto plazo quiere comprar un televisor y arreglar su casa.

loans.use: Purchase poultry as well as hair dye and other supplies.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of jewelry to re-sell in her community

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mr. Sen S. H., 41, and his wife, Mrs. Pov Chantha, live in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. His wife is on the right in the photo. He is a farmer and his wife is a garment factory worker. They have three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one attends the local school.

Because his field is far from the water source, he uses a pump to get water to his crop. He needs hoses for his pump and is asking for a loan to buy hoses for irrigation.

loans.use: To buy hoses to get water to his crop.

loans.name: Mrs. Thoern Pok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of eleven people is located in Prey Kokir Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Thoeurn P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns 0.5 hectare to cultivate rice on. Her husband, Mr. Tuy Rom, is a construction worker who can make only a small income to support his family. Aside from this activity, he is a breeder who is raising two pigs.

Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets to for breeding in order to improve their living conditions. Mrs. Thoeurn P. is 32 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

All the members in this village bank have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more piglets  for breeding

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Née le 13 avril 1956, madame K. Afiwa est une mère d’une famille de cinq (5) enfants dont le mari est un assistant d’hygiène.  En travaillant à son domicile situé à Agoè, un quartier de Lomé, elle a pour activité la vente du maïs et l’élevage des volailles.  Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2002 et ce travail lui a permit d’aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
Elle a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES et elle a bien remboursé. Avec ce second crédit, elle pourra acheter 15 sacs de maïs et 10 sacs de soja pour vendre et pour nourrir ses volailles.
texts.en:
Born on April 13, 1956, Ms. Afiwa K. is a mother who has a family of five children and a husband who is a health care assistant. Working in her home located in Agoè, a district of Lomé, she sells corn and raises poultry as her line of work. She started this business in 2002. It enables her to help her husband to cover family expenses. She has already benefited from a WAGES loan, which she repaid. With this second loan, she will be able to buy 15 sacks of corn and 10 sacks of soybeans to sell and to feed her fowl.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and soybeans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To get clothing items to restock small business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin city, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells hair extensions, provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more hair extensions, provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions, provisions, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Akoete

texts.fr: Akoete A. est propriétaire d’un dépôt de boissons à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 42 ans, il est marié et père de 4 enfants. Pour accroître la capacité de son commerce, il désire avec ce crédit alimenter son dépôt pour mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle étant donné qu’il fait des livraisons en gros. Cette chance lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akoete A. is the owner of a drinks depot in Lomé, the Togolese capital. He is 42 years old, married, and the father of 4 children. To enlarge the capacity of his business, he would like to use this loan to replenish the inventory of his depot so as to better satisfy the needs of his clientele, since he makes wholesale deliveries. This opportunity will allow him to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: replenish the inventory of his depot

loans.name: M/mpya G Group

texts.en:
Catherine has been a tailor in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tailoring items for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  

Catherine is  25 years old and single. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Amina, Helena, and Josephina. Each woman has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy tailoring supplies

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells cooked foods like yam, rice, beans, etc. She has been running this business for a long time. She is 40 years old and married with three children. She needs the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr.: Carlos; natural de la ciudad de Cusco, vive en la asociación pro vivienda San Antonio I-5 en el distrito de Santiago en la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 45 años de edad el es casado con doña Florentina y tienen 4 hijos de (24, 23, 19, 14) años, el socio tiene una carpintería ubicada en su domicilio, siendo esta su principal actividad, el hace muebles y los acabados los realiza su esposa, ellos trabajan para seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios y así darles una mejor calidad de vida, el socio solicita el préstamo para poder comprar materiales de carpintería y así hacer un número mayor de muebles para vender.

El socio se encuentra muy feliz con el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago respectivo de su préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos was born and raised in Cusco, where he sill lives, in San Antonio I-5, in the neighbourhood of Santiago. He is 45 years old and married to Doña Florentina. Together, they have 4 children, who are 14, 19, 23, and 24 years old. Carlos runs a carpentry business from his home, building furniture that his wife then finishes.They are working so that they can continue to support their children's studies and improve the family's quality of life. This loan will be used to buy material for furniture making so that Carlos can increase his stock. Carlos is very happy with the support he has received from the communal bank and is committed to making his payments responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood and tools

loans.name: Aluka Okech Agnes Group

texts.en:
Mrs. O. Agnes is aged 36 years and married with 4 kids (3 girls and 1 boy) plus 2 orphans who are all in schooling. She has been selling through a boutique for over 8 years. She is using the loan to purchase new clothes and new shoes.

O. Agnes is a hardworking woman whose stock is now big and she is contributing to the paying of school fees with her husband. Her dream is to have more stock than she has now.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes and new shoes

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
The agriculture business takes a great deal of effort, requiring as it does exposure to the sun, the physical exertion of moving animals from one place to another and the hard work of tending to various crops. Nemat Q. has dedicated himself to cattle-raising for 12 years now to support his humble family which so relies on him.

Currently Nemat is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase two calves that he can raise. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him, but also his two children and wife, the family he greatly loves.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. All are currently in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Alice works very hard to support her husband and to provide for the family. Her husband trades in foot wear. She is a trader. She deals in eggs. Alice buys crates of eggs from poultry farms in nearby communities and sells in the market square. She also distributes to retailers. 
She has been in business for over fourteen years and wants a loan buy eggs in bulk so she can increase her stock. Alice is hopeful to be able to afford to send her children to the highest levels in school.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs

loans.name: Anufa Group
