This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15.000.00mt, which she plans to use to buy products to increase her stock of merchandise (soft drinks, beer, juices, meat, rice, etc.) The prior loan was for 15.000.00mt and was used for the same purpose.  

She promises to make her payments on time and in the future she plans to grow her business even more by making improvements to her shop.  She intends to request additional loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (soft drinks, beer, juice, meat, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Jahaira Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jahaira, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 9 y 3 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es obrero.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos  Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener un bazar o una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The “Virgen Del Rosario” communal bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, Montecristi Canton (Portoviejo), known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally.  Most of the residents of this place manufacture tagua [nuts known as vegetable ivory] buttons, are craftspeople or in general commerce.

We met Jahaira, 25, here.  She’s married and has three children who are 10, 9 and 3 years of age.  The two oldest are going to school.  Her husband’s a laborer.

She is a housewife who in order to earn her own resources sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works three days a week selling on credit and collecting weekly or biweekly according to her customers’ wishes.  
What she sells most is perfume and cosmetics.  She’s been in business a year and does very well.

This loan is to buy perfume, cosmetics and underwear.  This is the third cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.  Her dream is to have a clothing store or a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics and underwear.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
Lida nació en la ciudad del Ollantaytambo pero vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos.  

Lida desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella se dedica a  la venta de artesanía en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad donde vive, ella también se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Lida requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo mochilas, maletines y otras cosas más. 
 
Lida se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Lida pertenece al banco comunal “Pinkulluna” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Lida was born in the city of Ollantaytambo and lives in the same city she was born in. She is 42 years old and married, she has four children from this relationship.

Lida carries out her daily and business activities in the city of Ollantaytambo, she sells handicrafts for a living in when on the most popular markets in her city, she also makes handicrafts. She started her business 10 years ago and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  

Lida needs this loan to buy more merchandise, such as bags, suitcases and other things.

Lida is grateful for the opportunity given to her through this channel and is committed to fulfilling her repayments according to the schedule.

Lida belongs to Asociación Arariwa's Communal Bank "Pinkulluna" in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as bags, suitcases and other things.

loans.name: Liliana Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Liliana, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 2 años  de edad, la mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante de pescado.

Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que además se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes pero solo los más conocidos. Trabaja tres días de la semana más que todo por las mañanas ya que aprovecha que una de sus hijos esta en escuela y así puede recorrer sus productos con más tranquilidad, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar en  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco. 
 
Sus deseos son seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
The María Monserrate Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its handicrafts, which are known both nationally and internationally.  It is also the home of the famous Panama hats.

This is where we met Liliana.  She is 27 years old, married, and has two children who are eight and two years old.  The eldest is in school.  Her husband sells fish for a living.

She is a very good mother and housewife who also sells all kinds of clothing for a living.  She sells door-to-door and she also sells from her home, but only to the customers she knows best.  She works three days a week, mainly in the morning to take advantage of the fact that one of her children is in school.  This way she is able to take her products out at her own pace.  She keeps tabs for her customers and charges them every 15 days.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise whenever she needs it.  She has been doing this for four years and it has been going very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.  This is her third cycle with her communal bank and she likes it because of the help she receives from the bank.

Her wishes are to get ahead in her business and in her home life.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: Esperanza De Lourdes

texts.es: Esperanza De Lourdes tiene 47 años, ella trabaja como domestica. Tiene 3 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. Ella solicita este crédito con el fin de comprar materiales de construcción como bloques, cemento arena, zinc, clavos entre otros. Ella ha logrado sobrellevar las dificultades que a diario atraviesa, esto no la desanima a seguir luchando para conseguir su objetivo.
texts.en: Esperanza De Lourdes, 47, works as a cleaner.  She has 3 children, all independent now.  Esperanza is applying for a loan that she will use to buy construction materials: concrete blocks, cement, sand, roofing materials, nails, etc.  She has managed to overcome the challenges that she's faced in the past and nothing that she's faced has stopped her from working toward her goals.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house.

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.es:
Apolinario, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos y nietos, él trabaja la agricultura, esta actividad la aprendió muy joven con sus padres, pero ha sido el medio para subsistir y desarrollar a su familia, no tiene un horario fijo.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de de insumos agrícolas como, abono y los herbicidas, esta compra le ayudara para iniciar en el tiempo correcto dándole a los cultivos el cuido necesario.
Él quiere tener éxito en sus siembras, ya que de los cultivos depende para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Apolinario lives with his wife, two sons, and grandchildren. He is a farmer. He learned how to farm at a very young age with his parents and this work has allowed him to provide for and develop his family. He does not have a set working schedule.

He is requesting the loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer and pesticides. This will allow him to start growing crops in the right season in order to better maintain them.

He wants to be successful with his crops since he depends on them to provide for his family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, él inicio con el negocio porque su esposa le dio el apoyo necesario, aunque él desde que vivía con sus padres comenzó a adquirir experiencia ya que ellos se dedican a este tipo de comercio.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, con la intensión de crecer en la granja y con posibilidad de mejorar ganancias a futuro.
Él quiere tener éxito en su negocio, viviendo con su familia y proveyéndole lo necesario.
texts.en:
Manuel raises pigs; he lives with his wife and three children.  He started the business because his wife gave him the necessary support although he started acquiring experience while still living with his parents since they were also in this type of business.

He’s asking for a loan at present to buy pigs intending to expand his farm in hopes of future improved profits.  He wants to be successful with his business living with his family and providing them with what’s needed.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Savat's Group

texts.en:
Originally for a rural village of the Thmor Koul district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Savat, 51, is married with four children. He and his wife have been raising pigs and selling grocery items for 20 years. 
Savat has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for eight cycles already and he wisely and successfully used the past loans to improve his family’s livelihood. He is now leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy pig feeds for nourishing his pigs. He hopes to earn more income from his current business.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds for nourishing his pigs

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Romela dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en: Hajia Comestics Shop is a popular shop which sells good perfumery products to the city dwellers of Sekondi-Takoradi. The products are moderately priced and attract lots of customers, especially during festive occassions such as this yuletide. Owner Ramatu K. wishes to be given a KIVA loan of $975 to open a second shop. She has a business plan based on the TEACH lending skills she acquired.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
In the town of Santa Catarina, in the state of Nuevo León, Mrs. Ester sells groceries. This has been her only source of income for 36 years. She is married and because of her husband’s age, it is difficult for him to find work. He helps her out in her store, and through this business they have been able to provide for their family and get ahead. It was economic need and a liking for sales that motivated Esther to open her business back when they first moved to their current house.

Esther has dedicated herself completely to her business. In order for it to grow she needs a loan in the amount of $475, which she will use to stock her store with more merchandise and thereby offer more variety to her customers. She needs your help and is sincerely thankful to you for any support you can provide her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Santa Catarina del estado de Nuevo León, doña Esther se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, esto ha representado para ella el único ingreso desde hace ya 36 años, ella es casada y por la edad de su esposo le es muy difícil conseguir un empleo, y él le ayuda en atender el negocio, por medio de este trabajo han podido obtener el sustento para su familia y han podido salir adelante. La necesidad que tenían y el gusto por las ventas hizo que Esther se decidiera a abrir su negocio cuando en aquel tiempo se acababan de cambiar a ese domicilio.

Esther se ha dedicado por completo a su negocio, y para poder hacer crecer su negocio requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que utilizara para surtir su tienda de mercancía y pode ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes. Ella necesita de tu ayuda, y agradece sinceramente cualquier apoyo que puedas darle.

loans.use: To buy merchandise in bulk for her store

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en: Shoira S. started her business with selling men's clothes. Then step-by-step she expanded her trading areas and added national dress materials (delaine). Today she has three trading areas and her current request is for a fourth area. Shoira buys the goods herself, and goes to China, Uzbekistan and Istaravshan. Her daughter always helps her. Shoira says that due to her business, she was able to reconstruct her house, and purchase another flat and vehicle for her husband. Now she would like to save money to purchase a car for herself. Her other plan is to pay for hairdressing courses for her younger daughter.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Candida Concepción

texts.en:
Mrs. Candida Concepción M. is 23 years old and lives with her partner. She has been working in recycling for over 5 years now. She buys and sells recycling materials which she does with the help of a small cart that she pulls herself. Specifically, she generally works with aluminum, cardboard, metals, and plastics. Her partner also works in this trade.

Thanks to her savings in the job, she was recently able to purchase a small terrain where the couple built their house. She has had recent complications with her job due to pregnancy complications where she miscarried. In addition to that, she has been having trouble recently doing her job because it is the rainy season and she works in the outdoors which hinders her efficiency.

They would like to get a loan to build a storage shed where they can keep their recycled materials. Likewise, they would like to purchase a horse to help them in their job. Currently, she only uses a cart which she herself pulls and stresses that her job depends a lot on mobility.

She is a part of a group of 17 women who take a part in the Committee of Enterprising Women in Paraguay.

loans.use: To build a storage shed where she can keep the  recycled materials.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
"I acquire[d] the act of farming from my father and started up mine in the year 1968," says Mr. Stephen A.. He is a native of Ewatto, in the Edo State of Nigeria. He is 49 years old and a married man with 8 children.

Stephen has been with LAPO for 1 year. He needs the loan of $550 to expand his farm and thereby improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more seedling and help with the maintenance of the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his fruit business.

loans.name: Candy

texts.es:
Candy is a young 19-year-old mother. Her partner abandoned her after finding out she was pregnant. Fortunately, she received support from her dear aunt, Margarita. Since then, she immediately began working to cover her expenses and those of her young offspring. For two years now, which is her daughter’s age, she has been selling towels and undergarments for men, women and children in a small stand in the Túpac Amaru market in her hometown of Juliaca.

This hard-working young lady with immense motherly love begins selling her merchandise at 8 in the morning and does so until 9 in the evening, always in the company of her inseparable daughter. Candy’s wish is to increase her capital to continue investing in her merchandise which has been generating good income for her. In order to accomplish her objectives, she would like to obtain this loan and promises to be punctual and responsible with its repayment. Candy and her little daughter are in need of your help.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Candy, es una joven madre de 19 años de edad, su pareja la desamparó cuando se enteró de que estaba embarazada, pero afortunadamente recibió el apoyo de su querida tía Margarita, desde entonces trabajó inmediatamente para solventar sus gastos y la de su pequeño retoño.Desde hace dos años, edad que tiene su pequeña hija se dedica a la vente de toallas y prendas interiores para niños, damas y caballeros, en un pequeño puesto del mercado Túpac Amaru de su ciudad natal, Juliaca.Esta laboriosa muchacha con inmenso amor de madre, empieza a vender su mercadería a las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche, acompañada siempre de su inseparable hija.El deseo de Candy es aumentar su capital para seguir invirtiendo en su mercadería que le está generando buenos ingresos económicos y para cumplir sus objetivos desea obtener un préstamo, así mismo promete ser puntual y responsable con el reembolso.Candy y su pequeña niña requieren tu ayuda.

loans.use: Increase her capital to purchase undergarments in greater amounts.

loans.name: Deyanet

texts.en: Deyanet K. (his father is pictured) raises sheep in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is a 28-year-old man and is married with two children. He has been raising sheep for the last five years and is currently looking for funding in order to increase the size of his herd.

loans.use: To increase the size of his herd.

loans.name: Rafaela Esperanza

texts.es:
Ms. Esperanza R. is a small business owner with a lot of experience in retail sales. She has been selling cosmetics, apparel, perfume, and shoes for men, women, and children for 23 years. She started her small business selling only cosmetics, but ultimately was able to expand her business, offering a new line of products. Her customers are primarily people who work and who order products for personal use. She sells her items from home, and on weekends, she travels to the city of Rivas to sell her merchandise in the markets and plazas there.

This single mother has been able to help her only child, who is now studying, get ahead in life. She decided to build an extra room that she can rent in the front of her home as an additional source of income, thus allowing her to travel less to the inland region. This means she no longer has to leave her child under the care of relatives. With this extra income, she will be able to both cover the household expenses and pay for her child’s education. At this time, she still needs to build a wall and a roof, as well as paint the additional room. With this room, she will be able to pay for all the everyday expenditures that she must tackle on her own.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esperanza es una microempresaria que posee una vasta experiencia en las ventas al menudeo, hace 23 años se dedica a vender cosméticos, ropa, zapatos, perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños. Inició su pequeño negocio vendiendo únicamente cosméticos y fue con el tiempo que se fue expandiendo hasta ofrecer nuevas líneas de productos como hasta ahora ofrece, sus clientas son mayormente personas que trabajan y que le encargan productos para uso personal. Es en su casa de habitación que ofrece sus productos y los fines de semana visita el departamento de Rivas a vender su mercadería en los mercados y plazas de esa ciudad.

Es con su negocio como ha sacado adelante esta madre soltera a su único hijo quien se encuentra estudiando. La señora como otra fuente de ingresos que le permita afrontar los gastos y viajar menos al interior del país dejando a su hijo con parientes que lo cuiden decidió construir un cuarto en la parte delantera de su vivienda para alquilarlo y así poder complementar los gastos básicos de la casa y la educación de su hijo, en estos momentos al cuarto le falta levantarle una pared, cerrar el techo y pintar el cuarto, con esto ella se ayudaría a suplir todos los gastos que ella sola afronta

loans.use: Purchase of metal beams, aluminum sheeting, and paint

loans.name: Boboasis.

texts.ru:
Boboasis B. lives in Yavan. He is 45 years old, is married and has 5 children. He has a high school education and raises livestock that he sells for meat. Boboasis purchases livestock at the city market, feeds the livestock for 40-45 days and then resells it at a profit. He has been in this business for 20 years. This business is the main source of income for his family. In addition, the expansion of the livestock business provides local markets with fresh meat. Boboasis will use his loan to purchase calves. He will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Барпиев Бобоазиз Курбонович проживает вгороде Яван.Возраст 45 года . Женат имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством, откармливает бычков для перепродажи их на мясо. Покупает товар на рынке района, откармливает около 40-45 дней , а затем перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 20 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом.Клиент хочет получить кредит для того чтобы закупить молодых бычков. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Eseosa

texts.en: Eseosa O. is 32 years old, married, and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells lengths of cloth called wrappers that are worn by wrapping them around the body. She has been in business since 2003. Mrs. O. is requesting a loan of $700 to help her buy more wrappers. She is grateful to all who will make the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more wrappers for sale

loans.name: Yluminada

texts.en:
Yluminada is an ambitious entrepreneur who owns and operates a small grocery store in the Hato Nuevo community of San Cristobal. She also prepares breakfast and lunch for people in her community. She explains that her husband is very helpful and attends to the customers at the grocery store when she is busy cooking and selling her delicious Dominican dishes. Yluminada’s businesses pay for her children’s school fees.

She will use the loan to buy rice, flour, vegetable oil, and the like. Yluminada wants to keep working hard for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients used in a catering business and stock for a small grocery store.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Click this link to view Justina's first loan

Justina is a member of the Village Bank Tu Angel Lucy (Your Angel Lucy).

Justina is a widow, 45 years old and has three children. Justina sells special foods and groceries at a stand in the market April 12. The specialty foods are prepared by her. Justina also sells food in the different neighborhoods and towns of the region during times of celebration.

Justina needs a loan of 1000 soles ($US375), money she will invest in the purchase of rice, noodles, aji pepper, cinnamon, cloves, cumin and garlic cloves.

Justina's dreams are to have her own capital, continue saving to build her business, and to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase rice, noodles, aji pepper, cinnamon, cloves, cumin and garlic cloves.

loans.name: Letasia

texts.en:
Letasia T., 35, is married with three children.

She has two years of experience in the barbecue business. She sells to the villagers and public three days per week.

She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD).

SPBD loans are Letasia’s only access to capital, because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to improve her business. Her husband will help her operate the business.

loans.use: Purchase of mutton flaps, chicken franks, sausage, soya, onions, salt, etc.

loans.name: I Wayan Uma Wardana

texts.id:
Everybody dreams of expanding their business, so is Uma Wardana . The furniture business he started a year ago started to go, and has received many orders. Many efforts has been taken, like asking friends to work together, however it did not solve his challenges. The expensive wood raw materials and limited machineries/production tools are the main challenge in this business. Nowadays Uma Wardana .employs 3 carpenters on a daily pay system. On average they are paid Rp35,000/day. (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00). Every day those 3 carpenters could produce about Rp250,000. Not included electricity expense and equipment wear and tear. His products results are quite good, clean and guaranteed quality, since all carpenters work in their expertise, so that his customers increase. Dinari gave Rp10,000,000 additional loan for Uma Wardana, that was used to buy furniture making machinery and other raw materials. With this additional capital, Uma Wardana hopes that his business could increase, and fulfill all orders, so that his income would also increase.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Setiap Orang memiliki cita-cita untuk mengembangkan usaha yang di tekuninya. Begitu juga halnya dengan Uma Wardana .Usaha meubel yang telah dirintisnya sejak setahun belakangan ini kini mulai berjalan dan menerima banyak pesanan Namun karena keterbatasan modal membuat Uma Wardana belum bisa menerima semua pesanan yang masuk. Berbagai upaya telah diusahakan termasuk di antaranya meminta teman untuk bekerjasama, namun belum juga bisa menyelesaikan kesulitan yang dihadapi. Mahalnya bahan baku kayu dan terbatasnya mesin –mesin / alat produksi yang ada, masih menjadi kendala utama dalam usaha ini. Saat ini Uma wardana telah mempekerjakan 3 orang tukang dengan sistem gaji harian . Rata –rata mereka digaji Rp. 35.000.- / hari. Dan dalam sehari ke tiga tukang ini bisa berproduksi rata-rata Rp. 250.000.- Belum termasuk biaya listrik dan penyusutan alat-alat Barang- barang yang di produksinya hasilnya cukup baik, rapi dan kwalitasnya terjamin karena hampir semua tukang yang ada bekerja sesuai bidangnya.sehingga pelanggannya makin hari makin bertambah . Dinari memberi tambahan modal Rp 10.000.000 untuk mengembangkan usaha Umawardana yang olehnya di pergunakan untuk membeli mesin skap / serut dan bahan baku lainnya. Dengan tambahan modal ini Uma Wardana berharap usahanya akan lebih maju dan bisa memenuhi semua order, sehingga hasil yang di perolehpun akan meningkat.

loans.use: To buy furniture tools to support production (Membeli peralatan mebel yang mendukung produksinya)

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: Don Pablo es un hombre trabajador, desde muy joven aprendió albañilería y también trabada como líder comunitario de barrio, su esposa es ama de casa y actualmente habita en el barrio 3-80. Don Pablo inició como ayudante de albañil y ahora trabaja por su propia cuenta ya que a través de los años adquirió experiencia en como desarrollar su trabajo. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para comprar maquinas que le ayuden en su labor cotidiana, como un taladro y una pulidora.
texts.en:
Pablo is a hard-working man. Ever since he was very young her learned brickwork and also worked as a community leader in his neighborhood. He is married to a housewife and currently lives in the 3-80 neighborhood of his city. Pablo started out working as a bricklayer assistant and now works on his own from all the experience he gained through the years in how to develop his business. The current loan he is requesting is for purchasing machines to help with his daily work, such as a power drill and a polishing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a power drill and a polishing machine

loans.name: Hadija Fadhili's Maisha Zhakem Group

texts.en:
Hadija F., age 46, is married with four children (ages 20, 17, 15 and 11). She has been sewing for 20 years and has also been selling food in Mbagala for almost a year. She works from 6am to 3pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $212.

In the past, Hadija has taken out one previous loan with Tujijenge Tanzania and to start her food business. She hopes for a new loan to buy an embroidery machine. Hadija will share this loan with her subgroup members selling food, charcoal, clothes and bananas. The subgroup Maisha Zakhem hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Hadija is first on the right in the front row.

loans.use: To buy embroidery machine

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha S. is 32 years old, has one child, and lives in the Poek village in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. Mrs. Chantha S. breeds pigs and takes care of her house. She and her husband, Mr. Hom Ngon, are farmers. (Mr Hom Ngon is pictured on the left.) They own a plot of land and cultivate rice and vegetables. They face some problems with their fields because of poor soil, and the plantation is not going well. They do not earn much money. Thus, Mrs. Chantha S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the soil and make the crops more productive.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to improve the soil and the productivity of the fields

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Dame D. Akossiwa est née le 21 mars 1976 à Tsévié ville située à 35 km de la capitale du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle a pour activité la vente des pagnes dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis l’année 2001 et maîtrise bien ce métier.
Elle a toujours obtenu des crédits au près de WAGES et se comporte toujours bien dans le remboursement.
Ce Sixième crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 30 pièces de pagne de marque phoénix afin de bien vendre pendant la période des fêtes de fin d’année.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akossiwa D. was born on March 21, 1976 in Tsévié, a town situated 35 km from the capital of Togo. She is married and the mother of 4 children who are all enrolled in school. Her business is selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly patterned African cloth used as clothing, turbans, and to carry babies) in the Agoè neighborhood. She began this business back in 2001 and has a lot of experience in it.

She has been receiving loans through WAGES and has always reimbursed them correctly. This sixth loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 30 lengths of Phoénix brand "pagnes" to be sold during the period of end-of-year festivities.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Erick Antonio

texts.es: El señor Erick Antonio Espinosa C. tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el barrio santa Rosa ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya, junto a su familia, el es soltero, pero tiene a cargo una niña de nueve años que actualmente estudia su primaria, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, él desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de zapatos usados y reparacion es un trabajo que desde horas muy temprana llega a su puesto para poder ofertar sus ventas,  la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento para poder incrementar su negocio ; el solicita el apoyo de nuestra financiera para poder comprar tres pacas de zapatos y poco a poco incrementar su inventario , el sueño de don Erick es llegar a establecer una tienda.
texts.en:
Erick Antonio Espinosa C. is 36 years old and lives in the neighbourhood of Santa Rosa, in the town of Masaya, with his family. He is single, but is responsible for a 9-year old girl who is in elementary school. His plans for his family are to improve his living conditions, for the past 2 years he has been selling used shoes and making shoe repairs, work which starts very early in the day as he opens his stand to begin selling. His greatest obstacle is the lack of financing to build his business. He is requesting the help of our financial institution in order to buy three bales of shoes and slowly build his inventory. Erick's dream is to be able to open a store.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bales of used shoes to increase his inventory

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi A. est une jeune femme de 24 ans, célibataire et sans enfants. Elle commercialise depuis 2 ans les produits génériques dans un quartier très populaire de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Pour  donner plus d’élan à son activité, Ablavi souhaite avec ce crédit réalimenter sa boutique afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. Ce qui lui permettra de gagner plus de fonds.
texts.en:
Ablavi A. is a young single woman of 24; she has no children. She has been selling generic products for two years in a densely populated neighbourhood of Lomé, the capital of Togo. To give her business a boost, Ablavi is asking for this loan to stock her boutique and satisfy her customers' demand. This will allow her to increase her income.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic products for resale

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es: Tatiana es una joven de 25 años, es madre soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres, con su pequeño hijo Carlos de 4 años, a quien desea darle una buena vida y brindarle unos buenos estudios. En el mercado Santa Bárbara (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), se encuentra Tatiana, ella tiene un locutorio donde aprovecha para vender sus flores artificiales, en un pequeño rinconcito vende rosas, claveles, violetas, etc, son flores muy bonitas y aun precio accesible. Ella disfruta de conversar con otras vendedoras y no pierde la oportunidad de venderles una flor para que adornen sus puestos, pero sufre mucho para conseguir las flores, ya que las trae desde Bolivia. Tatiana lleva ya 4 años con este negocio y le esta yendo muy bien, aunque todavía no se siente realizada, ya que desea poner una tienda más grande dedicada solo a la venta de flores artificiales, de esta manera podrá pagar los estudios de su querido hijo. Este es el primer préstamo de Tatiana con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con sus cuotas y espera poder hacerlo, además que no desea traerle problemas a su banco comunal, donde ha sido bien recibida. Con los 400 nuevos soles del préstamo Tatiana planea comprar más flores para surtir mejor su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a 25-year-old young woman. She is a single mother and lives at home with her parents and her little 4-year-old son Carlos. She wishes to give him a good life and offer him a good education. Tatiana can be found at the Santa Bárbara market (an important market in Juliaca). She has a phone center where she also sells her artificial flowers. She sells roses, carnations, violets, etc. in a small corner. They are very pretty flowers and priced reasonably. She enjoys talking with the other sellers and doesn’t miss an opportunity to sell them a flower to decorate their stalls. She suffers a lot in order to get the flowers since she brings them from Bolivia. Tatiana has been in this business for 4 years and it is going very well for her. She still doesn’t feel fulfilled since she would like to open a bigger store just to sell artificial flowers in order to pay for her dear son’s education. This is Tatiana’s first loan with MFP. She knows she has to meet her payments and she hopes to be able to do that. Besides, she doesn’t want to cause problems for her community bank where she was well received. Tatiana plans to buy more flowers with the four hundred nuevos soles from the loan to supply her business better and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Chadulu O Group

texts.en:
Salma has owned a small food-vending store in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 4 years. Every day she works at her business for 6 hours.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Salma is 48 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 18 and 24. She also cares for two additional dependents.

She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members: Amina, Matrona and Zakia. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells foodstuffs. Florence learned this business over 8 months and she has been in this business for the past 6 years. Florence is 42 years old and married with 3 children. Florence needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ayinde

texts.en: Ayinde H. is 32 years old and married with one child. He is a fashion designer. He is requesting the loan amount of 40,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more tailoring materials. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Idalyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Idalyn V. is a 32-year-old married mother of three children and lives at Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband works abroad as a carpenter. She is hooked on to the idea of setting up a little "sari-sari" (variety) store. She thinks her family’s daily needs can be supplied by the income generated from the store. She says it's challenging facing everyday hardships, especially when she is far away from her spouse.

Idalyn has applied for a loan of PHP 8,000 as additional capital for the sari-sari store. In the future, the couple wishes to operate a bigger grocery store. They aspire to support their children’s educational needs until they establish their own careers. Idalyn maintains that all their sacrifices are for their children.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami K. est une femme de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est revendeuse de pagnes à Kpalimé.  Elle souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en louant un agasin et l’approvisionner. Elle compte sur cette chance pour mieux gagner sa vie.
texts.en:
Ami K. is a woman of 39, married and the mother of 2 children. She sells "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) in Kpalimé. She wants to use this loan to grow her business by renting a shop and stocking it. She is counting on this chance to earn her living better.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca C. C. tiene 55 años, vive en el distrito D. la Esperanza, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria  Incompleta, tiene  2 hijos que depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Francisca se dedica a la venta bebidas y golosinas, este negocio se inicio hace 1 años,  su negocio en afueras del complejo deportivo y recreacional D. Bellavista.
Su primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco comunal Bellavista  II, lo invertirá en la compra D. productos como gaseosas y golosinas.
Francisca tiene como sueño tener su bodega mas implementada  para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Francisca C. C. is 55 years old, lives in the district "la Esperanza" ["the Hope"] in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She didn't finish elementary school. She has two children that depend on her financially. Francisca dedicates herself to selling drinks and sweets. She began this business a year ago. Her business is outsiD. the sports and recreation complex in Bellavista. Her first loan of 300 soles that she received from the community bank Bellavista II, she will invest in purchasing products such as soft drinks and sweets. Francisca's dream is to have her grocery store better set up in order to grow as a micro-enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products such as soft drinks and sweets

loans.name: Zulmuhor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Зулхумор- женщина 43 лет , замужем , имеет троих детей. Сама полностью занимается продажей материалов для костюмов и платьев.За товаром она ездит сама в Бишкек раз в месяц.У неё очень разнообразный ассортимент материалов.Её муж помогает ей по продаже товара, во время её отсутствия  замещает её муж. Для увеличения летнего ассортимента она хочет привезти материи из хлопка.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Zulmuhor is a 43 year old woman, married and has three children. She entirely by herself sells materials for costumes and dresses. She travels for the merchandise herself to Bishkek once a month. She has a wide variety of assorted materials. Her husband helps her with the sales when she is away and he substitutes her. To increase the summer assortment she wants to bring cotton fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer fabrics

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Муким, мужчина который кредитуется уже четвёртый год и займ использует для расширения своей столовой. На следующий кредит он хочет закупить мяса, продукты питания , напитки, и одну духовку. На снимке Муким в день мониторинга на месте деятельности в столовой.
texts.en:
Mukim is a man who has been our client for the fourth year already. He uses loans to expand his café. He wants use his next loan to purchase meat, food products, drinks and one oven. The photo shows Mukim on the monitoring day at his place of business in the café.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras committee “Las Amigas” live in the neighborhood of Kennedy in the city of Caacupé. The committee is composed of 18 members, all from the same area, and they are actually in the twelfth cycle of the program Committee of Mujeres Emprendedoras at Foundation Paraguaya. 

They benefit from the training each cycle where they learn themes of integration: self-esteem, savings, and budgets. The institution also benefits from the operative capital that increases to an average daily amount of 860.000 Guaraníes from each member. The money spent by the Fundacion goes directly towards the accompaniment and growth of each business mentioned above. 

All the members are thankful that the Fundacion has given them so much support despite the fact that these women have very little resources and belong to a marginalized group that limits their opportunities.

loans.use: The purchase of goods for a grocery; ingredients and materials for the production of delicacies, chipa (famous Paraguayan bread), meat, and other food; materials for the dressmaking; and wood for carpentry work.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 50 años, su deber como madre es su prioridad dentro D. su casa, ya que la responsabilidad D. criar a sus hijos sola la impulsó a desenvolverse con mayor responsabilidad. Por más D. 20 años se dedica a la confección D. prendas D. vestir, las cuales recibe D. diversas fábricas quienes la visitan en diversas campañas durante el año. Para cubrir todas estas demandas tuvo que adquirir algunas máquinas D. coser, las cuales ahora están muy desgastadas, por lo que tiene proyectado adquirir nuevas con las que pueda trabajar junto a sus hijos, quienes son jóvenes y la ayudan por las noches al regresar D. clases. Esta actividad es muy beneficiosa debido a la cantidad que produce, por lo que quiere seguir creciendo como comerciante, ya que para el futuro desea confeccionar variedad D. ropa y venderla a las diversas tiendas del mercado central D. su ciudad, donD. ya está entablando relaciones y espera pronto tener toda la maquinaria necesaria para lograr su meta. Este es su crédito número 12 con Microfinanzas PRISMA, sus anteriores préstamos también le permitieron mejorar sus ingresos económicos, tanto D. ella como D. sus compañeras con quienes conforma su banco comunal. Por ello, espera seguir progresando dentro D. su grupo mediante un trabajo responsable y comprometido. Los 1000 soles que viene solicitando le permitirán adquirir una máquina D. coser para la elaboración D. los pedidos que tiene por concluir.

loans.use: Compra de una máquina de coser

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes M. is already forty-six years old and is married to Agapito M., a forty-eight years old farmer. They have four siblings whom three are still studying. Their eldest is George, twenty-three years old, who already earned his degree in college and now working as a Philippine National Police. Next to him is Jay-jay, nineteen years old, he is now a graduating graduating college student. Followed him is Jerome, sixteen years old, who just started attending college this school year. Mercedes is praying that all her children will finish their studies someday through their business which they are trying to improve more. 

	Mercedes, along with her husband runs a furniture business. They are helping each other in making and disposing their products. Their children have now growing needs which is the reason why they need to double their effort in producing more products. The couple needs additional revolving capital to finance the needs of their business. She is requesting to borrow a loan of PHP7, 000. They need to purchase more woods so that they will be able to produce more furniture in a short period of time. She hopes that her proposal will be approved because it will be of great help to the success of their business which could also assists the educational needs of their children.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Mirembe's Group

texts.en: N. Mirembe is a 25 year old and a business lady selling first class clothes and shoes from Kiyindi. She is a married lady with three children aged between 8 years to 1 month as she takes care of her late sister’s children. At the start of her business, she was only into selling clothes but included shoes for expansion and more earnings. She is successful because of her loans that increase capital and profitability plus having quality clothes as well as her friendly and good customer care skills. She has a dream of growing much bigger to supply to the rest of the traders as well as building a residential house for them. She is such a hard working lady who needs a loan to help recapitalize her business for a steady supply.

loans.use: Buying more clothes and shoes for business expansion.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is 28 years old and married to Antonio, a farmer.  They live in the village of Addalam Jones, Isabela. Their marriage was blessed with two children: Aron Kate, six years old, and Janel, three years old. The couple works hard for the future of their children. 

Cleofe is a vegetable vendor while her husband is busy cultivating their rice farm, which is their main source of income. She would like to maintain her vegetable farm business so that she has more vegetables to sell. For this, she is requesting a loan from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 4,000. She hopes that business will improve because her family relies on her business income for their daily needs. Cleofe and Antonio said, “that through cooperation of the family members and good relationship of each other they will be able to attain victorious in life”.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: T. Justine est née en 1981 à Gbagla au Bénin. Justine vit depuis douze ans à Katagon Agaégon à proximité de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Justine est mariée à ADANDE Pascal un cultivateur et est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Les deux conjoints supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Justine n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges de la famille, Justine s’est mise depuis dix ans déjà, à vendre du maïs et des plats à Azowlissè et à Takon, deux villages situés à proximité de Porto-Novo. C’est à Kétou, au Sud du Bénin et à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Justine s’approvisionne. Justine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant bénéficié de deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursé. Pour agrandir davantage son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de la clientèle, Justine sollicite à nouveau un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Justine ambitionne accroître son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Justine T. was born in 1981 in Gbagla in Benin. She has been living for twelve years in Katagon Agaégon, near Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is the wife of Pascal Adande, a farmer, and the mother of four children who all attend school. The parents provide together for their family.

Justine never went to school. To help her husband to provide for the family, Justine began ten years ago to sell corn and dishes in Azowlissè and Takon, two villages close to Porto-Novo. Justine gets her supplies in Kétou in southern Benin and in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a known Alidé customer who received already two loans, which she repaid on schedule. Justine came to Alidé and applied for her third loan to boost her business and better meet the demand of her customers. Her ambition is to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and dishes

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina A. is a small business owner. She runs a cosmetics shop in Tabata ward, Dar es Salaam. She is a married woman with two school-age children. Both are in primary school. She has been in her business for one year. She plans to open a big cosmetics shop but capital is a limiting factor. She needs a loan of 800,000 Tanzanian shillings to expand the business.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: A. Elise est née le 11 Février 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Elise est mariée à ADECHI Alim et est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Elise vit avec son enfant et son mari depuis 5 ans au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou. Seul Alim supporte les charges de la famille. Elise n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a quatre ans environs que Elise vend des tissus par le système de distribution. Elise est aussi une coiffeuse qui vend également des mèches. Elise fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. C'est dans l'optique d'agrandir son stock de tissus afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, que Elise sollcite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Elise A. was born on February 11, 1975, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's married to Alim ADECHI and the mother of one school-attending child. For five years, Elise has been living with her child and her husband in the Avotrou neighborhood in Cotonou. She supports the family on her own and she never attended school. For about four years, she's been selling fabrics by the distribution system. Elise is also a hairdresser who sells hair extensions. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international market in Benin. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, who repays her loans without problems. In order to increase her stock of fabric to better meet customer demand, Elise is seeking her fourth loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pieces of fabric

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y dos de sus hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de comida y golosinas en un kiosko instalado en el interior de un colegio nacional de la zona. Todos los días, durante la hora de receso, ofrece diversos platos típicos a los estudiantes, los que son preparados con mucha higiene y salubridad ya que ella es consciente de la confianza que le han brindado los padres de familia y las autoridades del colegio.

La buena sazón y el trato amable con los que Carmen maneja su negocio han hecho que este vaya creciendo por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de golosinas e insumos para la elaboración de comida.

Su más grande anhelo es instalar una bodega en su domicilio. Ella es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada por los que la conocen ya que admiran la responsabilidad con la que realiza su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carmen, 43, lives with her husband and their two children in the Cayaltí district. It is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For one year she has been selling food and sweets in a kiosk, which is inside the national school in the area. Every day during recess she offers various typical dishes to the students. Her food is prepared very hygienically, and it is healthy. She is very aware of the confidence that the parents and the school authorities have in her. Her good seasoning and the kind manner in which Carmen runs her business have made it grow. That is why she is asking Edpyme Alternative, for the first time, for a loan for 1,000 PEN. She plans to buy sweets and supplies to make her food. Her biggest desire is to set up a convenience store in her home. She is a well known woman, and she is held in high esteem by those who know her. They admire the way she runs her business responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets and supplies to make her food

loans.name: Suubi Lyamukama Group 3, Lugazi

texts.en: N. Agnes is a single mother of seven children and divorced from her husband. Her four children are still in school and she also cares for orphans. She is a determined lady with two businesses to manage. She has a poultry farm as well as being a farmer in Kitigoma. Her major challenge is the expensive feed for her chicken. She works hard to be able to make 150,000 a week profits from her transactions. Her advantages are her good customer care skills and the help from loans for business investments. She hopes to become the leading poultry farmer so that she will be able to build rental houses. Agnes needs a loan to be able to buy more chicken feeds for her poultry farm plus pesticides for her farming business.

loans.use: Buying chicken feed and pesticides for her farming business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena de 48 años, tiene  3 hijos; Alex de 23, Elmer de 18 y Cristian de 14 años, con quienes vive en una  acogedora vivienda propia.Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la agricultura siembra  alverja y papa (tubérculo peruano), zanahoria, flores de gladiolos, con la ayuda de sus hijos, además de algunas verduras pequeñas, según sus propias palabras esta actividad le resulta bastante rentable porque le permite pagar los gastos de la casa, pagar la educación de  sus hijos, además de ahorrar ya que en el  futuro tiene planeado  construir una casa en la ciudad y aperturar una tienda de comidas, pues después de la agricultura lo que más le gusta es cocinar platillos típicos de la zona.Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y cuenta que ha notado un progreso económico, además le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal por la responsabilidad que demuestran cada uno de los miembros.Piensa invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de varios sacos de semilla de papa, abono,  fertilizantes y botellas de insecticida para cuidar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Elena is 48 years old and has three children, Alex, 23, Elmer, 18, and Cristian, 14. They live together in their own home. For 12 years, Elena has been working in agriculture. She grows peas, potatoes, carrots, gladiola flowers, and some other small vegetables with the help of her children. She says that this business has been profitable and has allowed her to pay for household expenses and her children’s education, as well as some savings. In the future, Elena would like to build a house in the city and open a restaurant. After agriculture, the thing she likes most is cooking the traditional dishes of the region. This is Elena’s third loan with MFP and she says that she has made economic progress. Also, she likes working with her communal bank because of the responsibility demonstrated by each of the members. This loan will be invested in the purchase of bags of seed potatoes, manure, and fertilizer, and bottles of insecticide for the care of her fields.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed, manure, fertilizer, and insecticides

loans.name: Kagarama Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: Alaisa N. is the leader of her lending group in Ntungamo. A hard-working, focused and determined lady who is the married mother of four children aged 20 to 7 years, all in school, Alaisa has sold second-hand clothes for five years. She is able to make 70,000/= as weekly profits although her business is faced with challenges including the poor seasons, high transport costs and the accidents that occur as traders move from one market to another almost every day. She ensures that she has a variety of clothes for sale and hopes for more business expansion plus the ability to educate her children and accumulate assets. Alaisa needs a loan to be able to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis V. is 51 years old and lives with his wife and a son in Tsakhkunk village, Sevan area.

Sargis is machine-operator and he worked as a mechanization expert for about sixteen years. Now V.’s family is engaged in farming: they have cows, sheep and chickens on their farm and use the profit from their farming activities for their family needs.

Sargis asks for a 600,000 AMD loan to buy a cow and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy a cow and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: Memuna M. sells cloths and cooking utensils at Abura.  Memuna has a senior high education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. Memuna has been selling cloth for some time now. She is responsible supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more plastic bowls, clothing and other items which are highly demanded for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more plastic bowls, clothing  and other items for resale

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  Sabougnouma  sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Dounamakabougou, un des villages de Fana, préfecture de Dioila, deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes  font essentiellement l’achat et la vente de céréales et de condiments alimentaires.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les 5 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe  Sabougnouma sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 1 tonne de céréales sèches (fonio, petit mil, maïs) et une grande quantité  de condiments alimentaires telles les poivres, les oignons, les cubes maggies, les concentrées de tomates, les sels de cuisine, les sounbala.
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur place auprès des producteurs et grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes au marché, au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 12.500FCFA qui sera  utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Sabougnouma group are all married. They average 35 years of age, have an average of four children and live in extended traditional families in Dounamakabougou, one of the villages in Fana, the prefecture of Diolia, the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali. These women primarily buy and sell cereals and condiments. Having repaid five previous loans without problem, the women in the Sabougnouma group are on their sixth group loan, which will be used to buy a ton of dried cereals (fonio, pearl millet, corn) and a large quantity of condiments such as peppers, onions, "Maggi" stock cubes, tomato concentrate, cooking salt and sounbala (a condiment made from "néré" seeds). They get their supplies primarily from local producers and wholesalers, and they sell at the market for cash and on credit, on a retail basis, to a customer base made up of women and men. They envisage making an average monthly profit of 12,500 FCFA each, which will be used to provide for family needs and to invest in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals and condiments

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Selling eggs is a business activity that Grace loves so much. She hopes to expand her business. She loves her business because of the profits that she makes. This is the high season for her business, and she hopes to attract more customers. She has been in this business for one year. She is 48 years old and married with five children. Her husband is a pastor, and he also supports their home. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 70,000 NGN in order to purchase more crates of eggs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs to sell

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is a single woman with one daughter who attends school. She owns a salon and wants to buy cosmetics and a hair dryer, and renovate her space with the ksh. 40,000 loan. Her main challenge is accommodating customers during the high season when it is very busy. She has been in this business for over one year. Previously, she was a student. She rents her home and has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is sending money to her parents to support them.  She joined Yehu because it deals with helping women with small businesses and she is serviced by the Rise and Shine center of the Kisauni branch office.  Some day, Doreen hopes to have a hairdressing school.

loans.use: Cosmetics, hair dryer and renovations to salon

loans.name: Bareaa

texts.en:
Bareaa is a 47-year-old married woman with two children. In 1998, she started running a sewing business. She does handicrafts from her home to earn more income for her family, in addition to being independent with her own business. She is well-known in her region due to her nice and talented work. She creates many different products and also offers repair services. 

For the second time, Bareaa is requesting a loan to buy pearls and a new sewing machine to replace the used one, so that she can faster serve her clients and maintain her good reputation. Her previous loan allowed her to improve her work by purchasing more thread.

loans.use: To buy pearls and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es una madre de familia que tiene 57 años de edad, tiene un hijo a su cargo y vive en el caserío Punto Cuatro del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola de pobladores sencillos, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta minutos de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores desde hace mas de ocho años, ella cría ganado ovino y aves de corral en corrales instalados cerca de su domicilio, cuando estos han alcanzado un nivel correcto de desarrollo, los vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona con regularidad, esta actividad le permite solventar sus gastos familiares y salir adelante por lo que siempre pone mucho cuidado y empeño en la crianza de sus animales.

Beatriz desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas ovejas de modo que pueda terminar de criarlas y percibir mas ganancias al momento de venderlas, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Beatriz es una mujer alegre y entregada a su familia, ella siempre trabaja para sacarlos adelante. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas, por lo que es considerada como una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 57 years old, has one child in her care, and lives in the Punto Cuatro neighborhood of Mochumí. It is an agricultural area populated by humble people, located in the province of Lambayeque and 40 minutes from the city of Chiclavo. Beatriz has had a business raising and selling young animals for over eight years. She raises sheep and poultry birds in pens located close to her house. When the animals have reached the correct level of development, she sells them to businessmen who visit the area regularly. This activity enables Beatriz to remain financially solvent and get ahead, as she always is very careful with the care of her animals. Beatriz would like to enlarge her business with the purchase of more sheep, which will bring more profits. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Beatriz is a cheerful woman, and very dedicated to her family and their well being. In previous dealings with this financial institution, she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making her payments. She is considered an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchas sheep

loans.name: Nuevo Esfuerzo (G 4, 5) Group

texts.en:
Dilenia is the coordinator of her group Nuevo Esfuerzo (The New Effort), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in SemA., a lush rugged peninsula with a blossoming tourism industry, where, nevertheless, running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here as a single mother, in a simple structure with her three children.

Dilenia is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her mobile variety sales business: to purchase clothes, sweets and other products for resale. She will use the profits to further expand and stabilize her business and to buy food, school supplies and medicine for her children. She hopes to better their future though her work. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes, sweets and other products for resale

loans.name: Las Semillitas Group

texts.es:
LAS SEMILLITAS 

Los 9 socios de la Alcancia Comunal LAS SEMILLITAS se reunen mensualmente para cordinar sus pagos, El Sr Juan trabaja en construccion hace 15 años el prestamo recibido lo invertira en la compra de una maquina cortadora de mayolica para realizar sus trabajos con major calidad en los acabados, ademas tiene como objetivo aperturar una ferreteria. El es soltero pero tiene una hija que mantener. Ana tiene una pequeña  bodega hace 8 años, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos, a nuestra socia le gustaria ampliar su bodega  para tener mas ingresos y poder afrontar  los gastos que se generan en su hogar.
Los socios desean ampliar sus negocios así que demuestran ganas de seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
LAS SEMILLITAS ("The Little Seeds") The 9 members of the Las Semillitas ("The Little Seeds") Community Bank meets monthly to coordinate its payments. Juan has worked in construction for 15 years. He will invest the loan in the purchase of a machine to cut ceramics to do his work with better quality finishes. He also wants to open a hardware store. He is single but he has a daughter to support. Ana has had a small store for 8 years. She is married and has two children. She would like to expand her store in order to have more income and to be able to cover her household costs. The members want to expand their businesses and they demonstrate the desire to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of products

loans.name: Gloria Fabiana

texts.es:
Gloria, tiene 55 años, es viuda, tiene dos hijos y pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Vision D. Rumichaca”. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la comunidad D. Rumichaca en la casa del señor Paulino.  
Su actividad económica principal D. Gloria es la venta D. verduras como por ejemplo zanahorias, papas, cebollas, etc. Ella empezó su negocio hace 20 años atrás y su primer crédito fue D. 100 dólares. Gloria participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento D. pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más semillas y abono. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gloria is 55 years old, a widow, and belongs to the “New Vision of Rumichaca” cooperative bank. Members meet every 30 days in the Rumichaca community, at the home of Mr. Paulino. Gloria’s primary economic activity is selling vegetables such as carrots, potatoes, onions, etc. She started in this area of business 20 years ago, and her first loan was for 100 dollars. Gloria participates in the cooperative bank, and things go well for her because she is a responsible and punctual person with regard to her payments. She needs a loan in order to buy more seeds and fertilizer. This member is very grateful for the opportunities given to her via this medium, and also commits to making her installment payments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mr. Sim C., 57, is a villager who lives Phngeas village, Takeo province. He and His wife, Mrs. Nharn Nat, are farmers who own 2-hectares of land to cultivate rice. With the farm, they do not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mr. Sim C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for hire laborer to plow his farm. Aside from farmers, this spouse is also palm sugar house who is able to earn a small income to support their family. This couple does not have any children. His wife is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for hire laborer to plow his farm

loans.name: Agnes Silantoi

texts.en:
Agnes Silantoi O. is 34 years old, married to Moses O., and has four children. She is a farmer who owns her own piece of land, which she has been farming for the last four years.
Agnes learned about Kiva partner, KADET, from a KADET client who was already a registered member in her area of residence. This will be Agnes' second loan, for 20,000 KES, which she is planning to spend on pesticides to spray her growing wheat to prevent it being invaded by pests. She hopes to use the profits from her loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.
Agnes' dream is to practise large-scale farming and attain financial independence. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides for her growing wheat

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred O. is 35 years old and is married to Judith Auma. They have eight children who are all school going children and are under 18 years of age. They live in a rural area called Ngiya.

Wilfred spends some of his time farming.

In the rural area where he lives, they have no electricity. He is applying for a loan to buy “My Sunshine Box,” which will help him to light his home. His children have been using kerosene lamps to read with and they have been straining a lot. He has serviced previous loans and paid them back without any difficulties.

He hopes and waits for the day when electricity will be installed in his rural home.

loans.use: To buy "My Sunshine Box"

loans.name: Rafat

texts.en:
Rafat S. is dedicated to agricultural work and cattle breeding, which is his family's only income. In his family, he has his wife and 2 children. He has been dedicated to this business for several years and, over time, he has gained experience in cultivating crops. 

Today, Rafat has come to AqroInvest Credit Union with the proposition of obtaining a loan to purchase one baby calf and seeds and fertilizer for planting. It is necessary to point out that in order to carry out the first planting you need to purchase the supplies. It is for this reason that Rafat is confident that his loan request will be successfully granted and he will achieve his objective of having a good harvest to improve his economic situation.

loans.use: To purchase one baby calf and seeds and fertilizer for planting.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma G., 64 years old, is one of the pioneer members of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance institution partner in the Philippines. She joined ASHI in 1999 and remains one of many loyal and active member of the institution.

Because of her performance, Norma has been rewarded with many loan benefits that she utilized in her business and in providing education for her two children. Her eldest is now a teacher and the youngest is a graduate of Business Management. She is so proud of her achievements, yet she is dreaming of more.

Norma is applying for another loan of PHP 45,000 as additional capital for her grocery (their primary source of income) and as finance for farm inputs. She will buy additional grocery products for her store, sacks of organic fertilizer for their rice and vegetables plantation and also pay labor for farm cultivation.

Norma hopes to increase her profit and her harvest in farming because she wants to earn more for her plan to establish a much bigger grocery. She also wants to help other people earn income by providing employment on their farm. Since she is getting older she also wants to earn for their health protection to enable them to live a longer life.

Norma is happy to have ASHI and Kiva as support for her capital needs. She hopes and prays that the support continues until she reaches all her dreams in life.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery products and farm inputs

loans.name: Gloria Bella

texts.es:
Gloria Bella M. tiene 41 anos. Es soltera y vive con sus hijos en el Cantón de San Pablo en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos de 22, 18, y 14 anos. 

Gloria es socia del grupo ¨Integracion Microempresarial¨ de San Pablo de Atenas. Son 14 socios en total, la mayoría que se dedican a diferentes actividades como comercio, negocios, y agricultores como fuente de ingreso a sus familias.

Gloria se dedica a criar chancos. Ahora tiene 6 chanchos y va a poner 8 más. Vende sus chancos en las ferias. 

Solicita el credito para ver si aumenta un poco mas su negocio de criar chanchos por poder comprar mas chanchos. Tambien solicita el credito para dar vitamina y comida a sus chanchos, y pagar las cuentas del veterinario. 

Con el apoyo del préstamo le ayudaria tener mas ventas de chanchos, poco a poco aumentando el negocio. Su sueno es darles educación a sus hijos par que sigan adelante. Ahora 2 hijos estan en la universidad y uno estudia en el colegio.

En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar en la casa.
texts.en:
Gloria Bella M., 41, is single and lives with her children in San Pablo canton, Bolívar province.  She has three children who are 22, 18 and 14 years of age.

Gloria is a member of the “Microenterprising Integration” group in San Pablo de Atenas.  It has 14 members who are in a variety of commercial, business and agricultural activities as sources of family income.

Gloria raises pigs.  She currently has six pigs and will add eight more.  She sells her pigs at the livestock fairs.

She is asking for funds to see if her pig raising business can grow a bit; to be able to buy more pigs.  She also is asking for the loan to give vitamins and food to the pigs as well as to pay the veterinary fees.

The loan’s support will help her have more pig sales and gradually increase her business.

Her dream is to provide her children with education so that they can get ahead in life.  Currently, two of the children are enrolled in the university and one is in high school.

She likes to spend her free time at home.

loans.use: To see if her pig raising business can grow a bit; to be able to buy more pigs.

loans.name: La Asuncion De Matahuasi Group
