texts.es:
Mirtha Marisol O. O., Presidenta D. la ALCOM, “La Asunción D. Matahuasi”, con 41 años D. edad, casada con 3 hijos menores D. edad y en edad escolar D. 9, 6 y 2 años respectivamente. 
La actividad principal que realiza desD. hace 6 años es la ganadería, la misma que cuenta con 10 vacas, D. las cuales extrae  leche; dicha leche la venD. a acopiadores D. la zona para la empresa GLORIA. D. los frutos D. esta actividad ha podido adquirir 2 tractores que alquila, teniendo así un ingreso adicional.
Y actualmente el crédito que se le ha otorgado lo utilizara para la siembra D. pasto (alfalfa) para  alimentación D. su ganado.
texts.en: Mirtha Marisol O. O., President of ALCOM, "La Asunción D. Matahuasi," is 41 years old, and married with 3 children of 9, 6, and 2 years old.  For the past 6 years, she has been working in livestock.  She currently has 10 cows, from which she gets milk that she sells to the warehouses in the area for the company, GLORIA.  Her income from this has allowed her to be able to purchase 2 tractors, which she rents and thus provides her with an additional income.  Currently, she is seeking a credit that she would use towards planting alfalfa plants with which to feed her livestock.

loans.use: To purchase alfalfa seeds.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is twenty-nine years old.  He lives with his wife and their two children in the village of Pitipo Fundo Burga, which is located in the district of Mochumi in the province of Lambayeque.  The area is primarily rural and is located forty minutes to the north of the city of Chiclayo.  Alberto lives in the more commercial portion of the village, where small stores and shops congregate.

For the last two years Alberto has run a mototaxi that is modified for carrying large loads.  He provides transport services to his neighbors, moving seed, agricultural products, building supplies and any other cargo.  Alberto also works in a small metal shop where he provides welding, painting and other services in repairing or constructing items to serve the local populace.

Alberto has a good credit history.  He has requested this loan in order to make repairs to his mototaxi which is currently in need of maintenance.  He hopes that the repairs will help to reduce his ongoing expenses and allow his asset to continue generating income for his family.  Alberto dreams of sending his children to school and expanding his businesses.

loans.use: Repairs to his mototaxi

loans.name: Jacquelin

texts.es: La Sra. Jacquelin  de edad de 24 años oriunda del departamento Cochabamba cercado ,vive en el municipio del torno localidad , Santa Rita . Su actividad es la venta de hamburguesas en la zona Localidad de el  torno  cuenta con su negocio desde hace seis años, Su estado civil soltera y no cuenta con ningún hijo por el momento, el destino del crédito  es para la compra de un horno y aumentar capital de trabajo en su negocio,  la Sra. Jacquelin esta muy agradecida con emprender por haber depositado una confianza hacia su persona  gracias a los créditos que nuestra institución le ha otorgado ahora es una joven comerciante emprendedora con muchas ganas de superación.
texts.en:
Jacquelin, who is 24 years old and a native of Cochabamba department and its capital, lives in the  municipality of Santa Rita.  She sells hamburgers in El Torno.  Jacquelin has been able to count on her business for about 6 years.  She is single and has no children as yet.

The loan is to buy an oven and increase her business's working capital.  Jacquelin is very grateful for the confidence that Emprender has in her.  Thanks to the loans our Institution has made available, Jacquelin is now a young enterprising merchant with a great desire to advance.

loans.use: TO BUY AN OVEN FOR HER HAMBURGER STAND

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 35 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Jesús de 37 años y de sus 2 hijos menores de edad; y juntos luchan por salir adelante en busca del progreso. Desde hace 2 años, esta empeñosa mujer se dedica a la venta de pescados frescos, de forma ambulatoria, en un mercado de su zona. Realiza su labor todos los días de la semana, incluso los feriados, desde las 6 de la mañana y se prolonga hasta las 3 de la tarde, además esta muy satisfecha pues obtiene generosas ganancias ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la frescura de sus pescados y los buenos precios que ofrece. También manifiesta que su labor la entretiene bastante porque mientras comercializa, conversa con sus compañeras; y esta actividad le permite estar pendiente de la educación de sus hijos. Lo que no le gusta de su labor es que muchas veces la mercadería no tiene salida rápida y eso afecta la permanencia del producto en buen estado, echándose a perder. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado comprar un puesto en el mercado y vender con mayor estabilidad. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en su negocio. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de algunos implementos que le hacen falta como una nueva balanza para continuar vendiendo este producto no perecible.
texts.en:
María, 35, lives in her own house with her husband, Jesús, 37, and their two minor children.  Together they struggle to get ahead in search of progress.

For the last two years this enterprising woman has been selling fresh fish in an ambulatory fashion in one of her neighborhood’s markets.  She works every day of the week, including feast days, from 6am until 3pm.  She is very satisfied because she earns generous profits because her customers prefer the freshness of her fish and the good prices she offers.

She also states that her work distracts her a lot because while she sells she chats with her fellow workers.  This activity allows her to be watchful of her children’s education.

What she dislikes about her work is that sometimes the product does not sell quickly and this affects it’s staying in good condition, it spoils.

Because she’s an enterprising woman she plans to buy a stand in the market in the future to be able to sell with more stability.

This is her third loan with MFP and she promises to repay punctually in order not to disappoint the people who made this contribution that allows her to stay in business.

María plans to use the funds to buy some tools she needs like a new balance to continue selling this perishable product.

loans.use: To buy a scale.

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es: La señora Armandina R. G. es madre de dos pequeños a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida, en los cambios de estación la casa de no se ambienta al clima; es por ello que quiere comprar un minisplit para mantener la temperatura ambiental ya que en esta región no es un lujo tener este aparato si no es una necesidad es por ello que se apoya en esta institución pensando en el bienestar de la familia.
texts.en: Señora Armandina R. G. is a mother of two small children, to whom she wants to offer the best quality of life.  When seasons change, the house does not adapt to the climate well so she wants to purchase a thermostat to maintain the temperature of her house since in her area it is not a luxury but a necessity to have this item.  As a result, she is supportive of this institution with her family's well being in mind.

loans.use: Purchase a thermostat for her house.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok K. is a 20-year-old man. He earns his living by selling Khmer noodles. For additional income, he is a motor taxi driver (Tok Tok) in and around Phnom Penh City. He currently lives with his elderly mother who is a housewife. Sok K. typically generates an income of approximately $6 per day to support his family's daily expenses. Recently, his existing motorbike broke while driving and it is now an obstacle for him to run his business. Because of that, Sok K. has decided to seek a loan of $600 from Kiva, which he will use to change the broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To change the broken motorcycle

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
el joven Juan Carlos T. tiene 21 años de edad y vive en union libre, no tiene hijos que dependen de el.
Juan tiene un pequeño negocio en casa de la abuela, en el cual junto con su mujer venden frescos, golosinas, churros, manteca, jabon, etc. tiene una pequeña pulperia, ademas sale realizar trabajos de medio tiempo para
ayudarse un poco con la economia de su casa.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio ya que se aproxima la epoca de clases y desea tener surtido para venderle a los niños que van a la escuela.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos T. is 21 years old, has a live-in partner and does not have dependent children. He has a small business in his grandmother's house where, together with his wife, he sells soft drinks, candies, churros, lard, soap, etc. He has a small grocery store. He also does part-time jobs to help with the household economy. 

He will use this loan to purchase merchandise to stock his business since the start of classes is approaching and he wants to have an assortment of merchandise to sell to the schoolchildren.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, churros, water, sugar, candy, juice, lard, oil, beans, rice, bread and cookies.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco Antonio R. H. él es trabajador activo de la empresa de Enacal Carazo desempeñándose como Fontanero  tiene  cuatro    años de trabajar para esta institución es casado  actualmente. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia
texts.en: Francisco Antonio R. Hernandez is an active employee of the Enacal Carazo company, working as a plumber. He has four years working with the company. He is married. He has had two past loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and each was used to purchase construction materials, including sand, cement, rocks, gravel, etc. to expand and improve his home. the loans granted through Ceprodel have helped him a great deal and he has improved his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, and zinc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma W. lives in the Nabukalu neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom go to school. She lives in a home that she rents, with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.
Fatuma sells traditional medicine and herbs. She has been in this business for five years, and works six days a week. The main business challenges she faces are theft and transportation problems. Fatuma sells her products door to door. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO. She wants to use this loan to go and buy local herbs from villages in Masaka District.

loans.use: To buy more local herbs

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en: Arsen H. was born in 1964 and lives in the town of Kapan. He is married and has two children -- a son who is serving in the Armenian army and a daughter who is a student in Yerevan. His wife is not currently employed. For the last 20 years, he has made a living running his own car-repair business. This has allowed him to support his family and pay for the education of his children. He is applying for this loan for 1,000,000 AMD to buy spare parts. This will be his fourth loan from Nor Horizon, and he has repaid the first three on time.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for a car-repair business

loans.name: 05 Dong Hai Group

texts.en:
Mui P. T. (7) is a 74-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. She is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 05-Dong Hai (016-06-05 Dong Hai).

Mui is widowed and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store, selling confectionery products in the local community. Mui has been engaged in this business for over twelve years and earns approximately $120 a month from these activities.

In 2004, Mui joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mui has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,248,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,787,900 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be her 8th loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Mui plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  D. Phuong Anh (48) is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

2.  P. T. Hong Van (47) is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.

3.  N. T. Ngan (16) is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

4.  N. T. phuong (62) is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

5.  T. T. Nga (73) is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Mui P. T. (7) là 74 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Mui là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 05-Dong Hai (016-06-05 Dong Hai).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm bánh kẹo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Mui thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Mui kiếm được khoảng 2500000 VND.  Vào 2004, Mui đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Mui đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4,248,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,787,900 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  D. Phuong Anh (48) là 0 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

2.  P. T. Hong Van (47) là 0 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.

3.  N. T. Ngan (16) là 0 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

4.  N. T. phuong (62) là 0 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

5.  T. T. Nga (73) là 0 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saul nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Capital Arqueológica de América), él tiene 37 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene  seis hijos, él ahora vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público “El Inti”. Ya son cinco años que tiene al servicio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Saul pertenece al banco comunal “Conzume III” de la Asociación Arariwa y ya son varias veces que se presta crédito de la institución pero en esta oportunidad,   Saul requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento del carro y su anhelo es comprar un nuevo carro.
texts.en: Saul was born in the city of Cusco (Archeological Capital of America).  He is 37 years of age and married.  As fruit of this union he has six children.  He now lives in the same city where he was born and is dedicated to offering public transportation in the service he calls “El Inti”.  He already has five years running the service and it goes very well thanks to the dedication that he puts in his work.  Saul belongs to the "Conzume III" communal bank  of the Arariwa Association and has already had several loans with the institution.  At this time Saul requires a loan for the maintenance of his car and his dream is to buy a new car.

loans.use: to maintain his car.

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.es:
Cayetana tiene 49 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eleuterio D. 55 años y su querido hijo Rodrigo D. 14 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. El almacén más lleno del barrio “Hijos D. Grau” del distrito D. Ventanilla, lo tiene Cayetana, quien lleva a su humilD. barrio los productos más necesarios y útiles para sus clientes. Ella administra su tienda hace más D. 10 años, es muy feliz vendiendo sus productos y satisfaciendo la demanda D. sus clientes, lo más difícil D. su trabajo es permanecer todo el día en su negocio sin poder salir, ya que atienD. todo el día y siempre está cuando sus compradores la solicitan.
Para el futuro D. su negocio, desea ampliar su tienda y tener muchos más productos que vender, puesto que su barrio esta creciendo y la mercadería con la que cuenta ya no le alcanzaa. Es el quinto crédito con MFP, su primer crédito lo pago puntualmente y sin problemas, es la socia más activa y solidaria D. su banco comunal, por lo cual es muy querida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que ha solicitado, comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su almacén.
texts.en:
Cayetana is a 49 year old woman who is very kind and hardworking.  She lives in her own home with her husband Eleuterio who is 55 years old, and their son Rodrigo, who is 14 years old.  They want to proviD. him with a better quality of life.  

The best stocked grocery store in the "Hijos D. Grau" neighborhood in Ventanilla belongs to Cayetana, who brings the most necessary and useful products to her customers in her humble neighborhood.  She has owned this store for ten years.  She is very happy selling her products and satisfying her customers needs.  The most difficult part of her work is to stay at the store all day without being able to leave, since she works there all day and is always there when the customers ask for her.  

In the future, she wants to expand her store and sell more products, since her neighborhood is growing and the merchandise that she has already can't meet the demand.  This is her fifth loan with MFP.  She paid her first loan on time and without problems.  She is the most active and supportive member of her community bank, so she is very well liked.  

With the 2000 nuevos soles she has requested, she will purchase more merchandise to improve her store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Lia

texts.es: Lía, de 23 años, es una joven soltera alegre y trabajadora con ganas de triunfar en la vida, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Recorriendo las diversas calles de la ciudad de San Francisco, kimbiri, Santa Rosa y Palmapampa,  Lía realiza su trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y es una vendedora muy convincente y motivadora, razón por el cual sus productos se venden muy rápido y tiene que renovarlos constantemente. Siente que su trabajo es muy rentable, ya que gracias a  ello, puede ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los productos que deben utilizar para su tipo de piel. Lleva 03 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar y tocar las puertas todo el día en busca de clientes. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más productos de belleza, para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos de belleza. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda de cosméticos, donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus cosméticos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, manifiesta que será muy puntual en sus cuotas de pago como en sus anteriores créditos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre. Con los 3,000 mil nuevos soles solicitados, viajará a la ciudad de lima y comprar  en cantidad productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Lía, age 23, is a happy and hardworking young woman with a lot of drive to succeed in life. She lives in her parents' house, and what she wants most of all is to obtain a higher level of income so that she could provide economic stability for her future family. 

Lia makes her living by commercializing cosmetics. She sells her products by going door-to-door in the streets of San Francisco (Peru), Kimbiri, Santa Rosa, and Palmapampa. She is a very convincing and motivated saleswoman, which is why her products sell out fast and she needs to constantly replenish her inventories. This work is quite profitable and allows Lia to help her family with household expenses. What she likes best about her job is advising her clients about which products are appropriate for their specific skin type.

Lia has been in this business for three years and finds that the most challenging aspect of her work is having to knock on doors all day in search of clients. She will use the current loan of 3000 soles to purchase more beauty care products in the city of Lima so that she could offer her customers a wider range of options. With time, Lia hopes to put up her own cosmetics store where she could sell her products in a more comfortable setting. This is her third loan with MFP, and she is committed to repaying it in a timely manner. She is known in her communal bank as a very happy person.

loans.use: to purchase beauty care products

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Isabel pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II” del Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Está casada y tiene 49 años.  Tiene cinco  hijas, cuatro de ellas mayores de edad y con familias independientes, sola la menor de 16 años vive con ella. 

La Sra. Isabel motivada por su vecina hace tres años se inició en el negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas y agua mineral.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/200.00 nuevos soles, con el que compró unos cuantos paquetes  de bebidas, actualmente su clientela ha aumentado y sus ventas son por botellas individuales y por cajas.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00  comprará  gaseosas de diferentes sabores  y tamaños , agua mineral con gas y sin  gas y jugos embasados en paquetes para continuar dando una mejor atención y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.  

Isabel es una mujer luchadora, se siente muy animada a continuar trabajando y ampliar su negocio pero a la  vez crear aperturar una tienda de abarrotes más adelante  es por esta razón que está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Isabel belongs to Las Margaritas II Communal Bank, La Banda district of Chiclayo, province and department of San Martin.  She is 49 years old and married.  She has five daughters, four of them grown with their own families.  Only the youngest (16 years old) lives with her.

Encouraged by her neighbor three years ago, Isabel set up a business to sell carbonated drinks and mineral water.  Her first loan was 200.00 new soles, which she used to buy cartons of drinks.  Her customer base has grown, and sales are now by the bottle or box.

With this 2,000-sol loan, she will buy various sizes and flavors of carbonated drinks, mineral water (carbonated and non-carbonated), and juice packaged in boxes, in order to continue to provide better service to her customers and respond to their needs.

Isabel is a woman who strives to succeed, and she feels enthusiastic at continuing to work and expand her business, but also to set up a general store in the future.  For this reason she is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women such as herself to have the chance to develop in their current environment.

loans.use: she will buy various sizes and flavors of soft drinks, mineral water (carbonated and non-carbonated), and juices.

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
Lila es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Trenzas de Oro” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos (1 independiente).  Solo cuenta con educación primaria.
Junto a su esposo,  se dedica a la compra y venta de animales domésticos como vacuno y ovino.  Desde hace  un año trabaja con el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su primer  préstamo solicitado fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, comprará dos  vacas lecheras, la señora cuenta que las compra y vende en la localidad de Ilave.
Su sueño es seguir adelante con el negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal son las charlas.
texts.en:
Lila is a member of the “Las Trenzas de Oro” (The Golden Braids) communal bank located in Ilave District, El Collao Province, Puno Department.  She’s 42 years old, married and has five children (one independent).  She only completed elementary school.

Together with her husband she buys and sells domestic animals like cattle and sheep.  She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year.  Her first requested loan was for 500 new soles that she used to invest in her animals sales business.  She will use this new, 300 new sol, loan to buy two dairy cows.  She mentions that her purchases and her sales take place in Ilave.

Her dream is to stay in business and that her children become professionals.

What she likes about the communal bank are the talks.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en: Roza works at her city’s local TV station and lives with her parents, who are pensioners, and a brother who is unemployed. She supplements her income by selling milk from a cow she owns and by running her own fruit orchard. She and her family use this income to buy food, but it is not enough for provide them with a reasonable life. That is why Roza is applying for a loan to buy three new cows. This will help her and her family earn additional income and live a better life.

loans.use: to buy three cows.

loans.name: Kdauolu

texts.en:
Kdauolu is 36 years old and lives in the Jacob Town area; she’s married with two children aged 12 and 18. Both live at home and are in school. For the past nine years she has been involved in the sale of oil. Her main challenge is the difficulty of getting the oil from the bush to Monrovia. 

She started this business with a little amount from her friend and she learned this from her mother. What she likes about this business is that she is responsible for herself and is proud of herself. 

Kdauolu has requested this loan to purchase more oil. In the future she would like to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel, se dedica al procesamiento de productos lácteos,  tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 15 años, su apoyo solamente son sus abuelos, Rosibel inicio el negocio por la necesidad de tener ingresos para el hogar, por las mañanas sale a vender de forma ambulante y por las tardes prepara los productos para el próximo día.
Ella necesita un préstamo para comprar leche y aumentar la producción de cuajada, además quiere invertir en cerdos de engorde, esto será una gran ayuda para el negocio, ya que aumentara su producción y también atenderá un nuevo sector como comercializar los cerdos.
Espera mejorar su situación económica, ayudar a su hija en el estudio, poco a poco mejorar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosibel makes dairy products.  She’s 35 years old and a single mother of a 15-year-old girl.  Her only support is her grandparents.  Rosibel started the business because she needed to produce income for the home.  She goes out mornings to sell and spends afternoons making the next day’s products.

She needs a loan to buy milk to increase cheese production.  She also wants to buy piglets to raise.  This will be of great help for her business because she’ll increase production and she’ll also have a new sector: selling pigs.

She hopes to improve her economic situation, to help with her daughter’s education and gradually improve the conditions of her dwelling.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Sourou Donatien

texts.fr: Sourou Donatien est âgé de 43 ans et est marié à Blanche, une marchande. Le couple a huit enfants à charge, dont sept sont les leurs. parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Sourou Donatien et son mari vivent dans la même maison avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Sourou Donatien a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Sourou Donatien a appris l'électronique ; activité qu’il exerce depuis vingt ans et qui lui permet de satisfaire aux exigences de sa clientèle, tout en assurant les diverses charges de sa famille. Sourou Donatien désire agrandir son atelier en s’approvisionnant en matériels électroniques, ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Sourou Donatien s’approvisionne au Nigeria, État voisin du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Sourou Donatien sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité, d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu.
texts.en:
Sourou Donatien is 43 years old. He is married to Blanche, a shopkeeper. They support eight children, of whom seven are their own; some of them are in school.  He and his wife live in the same house with their children. The various family expenses are covered by the couple. 

Sourou Donatien dropped out of secondary school. He has learned about electronics, which is work he has done for twenty years. It enables him to satisfy the requirements of his customers while ensuring that the various family expenses are covered. He would like to expand his workshop by stocking up on electronic supplies and equipment. This will allow him to respond better to customer demand. He gets his supplies from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. 

This is the third time that he has requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of boosting his business and increasing his customer base and his income.

loans.use: to buy electronic parts

loans.name: Wassman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 24 years old, single and lives with two family members who work.

Wassman has been a tailor since 2005; she makes and repairs women’s and men’s clothing. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and a good experience and she is well known in her area.


She decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to purchase a tailoring machine, a generator and to renovate her workshop. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine, a generator and to renovate her workshop.

loans.name: Beg Lu Baax Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Beg Lu Baax qui signifie vouloir le meilleur est créé depuis le 15 décembre 2008, il est composé de 15 femmes qui entretiennent de bonnes relations et qui s'activent dans le petit commerce et l'élevage.


La responsable madame Ndéye Khady est âgée de 42 ans, elle est mariée mère de sept enfants dont deux filles;elle fait de l'aviculture et de l'embouche, elle a une bonne expérience. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en robe bleue.


Elle achéte au marché central de la ville 10 poussins de race bleu hollande pour une rotation, les revend après deux mois dans son quartier et reprend l'opération.


Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter trois béliers à élever pour faire une opération Tabaski et ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus.

Les bénéfices obtenus lui permettent de participer à l'épanouissement de ses enfants sur tous les plans.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Beg Lu Baax (meaning 'to want the best') was created on December 15, 2008. It is composed of fifteen women who keep up good relations and who are active in small-scale commerce and in livestock farming.

The group's official, Ms. Ndéye Khady, is 42 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, including two girls. She raises poultry and fattens livestock. She has good experience. In the photo, she is the one in a blue dress and standing at the right.

At the city's central market, Ms. Ndéye Khady buys 10 chicks of the Bleu Holland species for one rotation. She resells them in her district after two months and then starts the process over again. 

She wishes to use her loan to buy three head of male sheep to raise for the purposes of Tabaski (a sheep festival) and thus to bring in a lot of revenues. 

The profits obtained will enable her to help her children to thrive in all ways.

loans.use: to buy sheep and chicks to raise

loans.name: Brenda De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Brenda, de 42 años de edad, nacida en la ciudad de León, madre de dos hijos uno de 18 años y el otro de 14 años el mayor de sus hijos estudia su primer año en la universidad, estudia la carrera de administración de empresas, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de tomates, cebolla y papas al por mayor y al detalle. Ella inicio en este negocio por la falta de empleo y la necesidad de criar a sus hijos, ella estudio Ingeniería Agrónoma trabajo  8 años es un programa para asistencia técnica del algodón pero después quedo sin empleo y ella necesitaba buscar un medio que le permitiera sacar a su familia adelante y fue de esta manera que comenzó a vender café con leche en el mercado de manera ambulante luego paso al sector de las frutas ya tiene 14 años de vender en el mercado de la terminal de buses de León, y es de esta manera que ella para los estudios a sus hijos.   
Requiere el préstamo para comprar tomate, cebolla, y papas. Con esta inversión tendrá producto para ofrecer y vender. En sus planes futuros quiere comprar un camión para vender en todo león y sus municipios.
texts.en:
Brenda, 42, was born in León.  She’s the mother of two children, an 18-year-old and a 14-year-old.  The oldest is in the first year of university studying Business Administration.  She’s a merchant selling tomatoes, onions and potatoes at wholesale and retail.  She started the business because employment was scarce and she needed to raise her children.  She studied Agronomy and worked for 8 years in a cotton technical assistance program but became unemployed later and she needed to find a way to support her family.  This led her to start off selling coffee with milk at the market and then moved into fruit sales.  She’s now been selling in the León bus terminal market for the last 14 years and this is how she’s earned enough for her children’s education.

She needs the loan to buy tomatoes, onions and potatoes.  With this investment she’ll have product to offer and sell.  In her future plans is the purchase of a truck to sell throughout León and its townships.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Mahmood

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 63 years old, married and has one child who works.
Mahmood has owned a food market selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products since 2003. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 
Mahmood has decided to apply for a loan of $2,500 in order to buy an electric diesel generator and add more foodstuffs to his market. He is aiming to earn more profits so that he is able to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy an electric diesel generator and to add more foodstuffs to his market.

loans.name: Juddy Thura

texts.en: Juddy is a 53 year old married woman. She has 2 children, aged 31 and 35. She describes herself as jovial, successful, honest, and dedicated. She operates a butcher shop and restaurant, and has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located at Bondeni Market in Nakuru. Her biggest challenge is the loss of customers in the restaurant business. She will use her KES 50,000 loan to buy meat, cooking fat and maize flour. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her rental properties, expand her restaurant and educate her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy meat, cooking fat and maize flour.

loans.name: Daan Dolé Diakhao Group

texts.fr: Mme AICHA est chef d'un groupement qui habite dans une ville du Sénégal. Son activité principal est le commerce, elle s'exerce dans ce domaine depuis plus plus de 20 ans. Avec ce crédit elle veut acheté des marchandises comme des nattes, des draps, des tissus pour renforcer son stock de marchandises. Avec les bénéfices qu'elle va gagné, elle veut aider son mari en participant au dépense quotidien de la famille
texts.en: Ms. AICHA is a group leader who lives in a city in Senegal. Her main work involves commerce. She has been operating in this domain for over twenty years. With this loan, she wants to buy some merchandise, such as mats, bed sheets, and fabrics to bolster her stock of merchandise. Using the profits she is going to earn, she wants to help out her husband by taking part in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a fifty-year-old widow with three children. She rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling fresh foods for five years. Her vision is to make a retail shop plus have a better life. Juliet needs the loan facility to buy beans and onions to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena tiene 46 años de edad y vive en la aldea de Baracoa en el departamento de Cortes. Lleva 7 años de casado con su esposo don Mario, lo cual trabaja en una fábrica que exporta bananas. La pareja tiene dos hijos de 19 y 26 años de edad. 

Doña María Elena tiene bastante experiencia como peluquera. La señora ha trabajado casi 12 años en salas de belleza. Teniendo un alto conocimiento de su oficio, estableció su propia sala de belleza en Baracoa. Allí ofrece una cantidad de servicios incluyendo cortes, peinados, tintes, secados, alisados y uñas acrílicas. 

Con dos prestamos anteriores, María Elena remodeló su sala de belleza. Ella notó que la presentación del negocio mejoró bastante y también las ventas. Con el préstamo actual de L21,000, va a abastecer su inventario de productos como tintes, champú y suavizante.  Ella espera que, a pesar de la larga distancia que tiene su negocio del centro de Baracoa, logre crecer su clientela y  que su sala de belleza llegue a ser una de las más conocidas en la área.
texts.en:
María Elena, age 46, lives in the village of Baracoa in the Cortes department.  She has been married to her husband, Mario, for seven years.  He works in a factory that exports bananas.  The pair has two children, ages 19 and 26.

María Elena has plenty of experience as a hairdresser.  She has worked in beauty salons for almost 12 years.  Having a high level of knowledge in her field, she established her own beauty salon in Baracoa.  That is where she offers many services including cuts, hair styling, dyes, blow dries, straighteners, and acrylic nails.

With two previous loans María Elena remodeled her beauty salon.  She noticed that the appearance of the business improved a lot and so did the sales.

With the current loan for 21,000 lempiras she will stock her inventory with products like dyes, shampoo, and conditioner.  She hopes that her business, in spite of being a long way from the center of Baracoa, will manage to get more customers.  She also hopes that her beauty salon will come to be one of the most well-known in the area.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo, and conditioner.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is 33 years old and an enterprising business lady. She is married to Joseph who is employed. They are blessed with three children aged 12, 10 and 8 years, respectively. She has been selling cereals as a primary business and running a retail shop as a secondary business for the past year with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Loise will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for her stock.

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to open a store to supply millers with dry maize.

loans.use: To buy dry maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Julio Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo nació en la  ciudad de Lima y desde hace 8 años que radica en la antigua ciudad del Imperio de los Incas (Cusco). Rodolfo tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Rodolfo desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad del Cusco.   

Rodolfo se dedica a la venta de repuestos y tiene un pequeño local pero es alquilado. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este trabajo y le va muy bien gracias a al empeño que pone sus funciones laborales.

Rodolfo pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Rodolfo requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo muelles, pistones y otras cosas más. 

Rodolfo se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rudolfo was born in the city of Lima and for 8 years he has lived in the old city of the Imperio de los Incas (Cusco). Rodolfo is 52 years old and is married and from this relationship he has three children. Rodolfo Roldolfo has built up his daily economical work in the city of Cusco.

Rodolfo works selling spare parts and he has a little neighborhood shop but he rents it. It has been three years that he has worked in this trade and it is going very well thanks to his commitment and the work he puts into it.

Rodolfo belongs to the the communal bank Nahupacman Purisun of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. Rodolfo is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise such as springs, pistons, and other items.

Rodolfo is grateful for the opportunity given to him through this loan and at the same time he promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as springs, pistons and other things

loans.name: Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
Fransiska, in her late thirties, is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. Working from 7:00 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. daily, she operates a business selling utensils at wholesale prices, earning a good monthly profit.

This will be Fransiska's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Her previous loans, both since repaid, were used to expand her business and pay household expenses, and this one will help purchase an additional stock of utensils. Her dream is to one day own another utensils business in a different area.

Fransiska will share this loan with her loan group "Msakuzi", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other acountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her stock of utensils.

loans.name: Aura Lucrecia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lucrecia, ella tiene  34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 12, 7 y de 3 años, los mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una muy buena esposa y ama de casa que también se dedica a la venta productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva 5 años en su negocio y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes. Ella también le da una parte del crédito a su esposo para que compre materiales para la pesca y pueda realizar una buena faena.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, redes, anzuelos y otros materiales de pesca. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por los beneficios que les da el banco.
 
Su sueño es tener un barco más grande para que su marido realice sus labores de pesca.
texts.en:
The “Virgen Del Mar” communal bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful San Mateo spa in San Mateo, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are well visited year round by national and foreign tourists.  Most of the residents of this area are fishermen and work on other tasks on the sea.

Here we meet Lucrecia.  She’s 34 years old, married and has three children, ages 12, 7, and 3.  The oldest attend school.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She’s a good wife and housekeeper and also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, perfumes, and ladies’ accessories).  She works three days a week, sells on credit and collects every week.  She’s been doing this for five years and her business is doing well.  Perfumes are her best selling item.  She will share some of the loan with her husband so that he can buy fishing supplies so that he can do his work better.

She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, nets, hooks and other fishing items.  She’s been a member of the communal bank since it began and she likes the benefits.  Her dream is to have a bigger boat so that her husband can fish.

loans.use: to buys cosmetics and fishing supplies.

loans.name: La Ceiba (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupos e llama la ceiba y se integra de cinco personas quien cada una  tiene diferentes actividad y se ubica en un lugar pequeño  donde hay un rio muy bonito.

   Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama  Leticia y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  y venta  de pollos  de granja en donde lleva trabajando  seis años y comenta que le va bien  ya  que con ello ha mejorado muchos sus ingresos para  su familia es  casada con el señor Saúl y tiene  cuatro hijos a su responsabilidad.
 
   Su motivo a esta actividad comenzó ya que también quiere tener sus propios ingresos y apoyas a su esposo  con los gastos de su hogar  y así no se vea muy presionado  solo  y decidió la venta de pollos.

 Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad  y el préstamo  que ha solicitado pueda compra r mas pollos y su ventas e mayor  para que sus clientes  compren lo que desean y no se limite en su venta.
 
La personas que integran en el grupo son las  siguientes: Leila Yolanda invertirá el préstamo en la compra  y venta de productos de la marca jafra, la señora Normaida  invertirá en la crianza de pollos para criarlo y después venderlos, Elsi  invertirá en la compra  y venta de pollos y pavos par venderlo de nuevo y la señora Candelaria invertirá en la compra  y venta de quesos.
texts.en:
The “La Ceiba” (the silk-cotton tree) group is comprised of five members who are each engaged in different activities.  They are located in a small region where there is a very pretty river.

Leticia was interviewed and requested the loan to invest in the purchase and sale of chickens.  She has been working on the farm for six years.  She says that the business is going well as it has enabled her to significantly improve her family income.  She is married to Saúl and they have four children under their care. 

She started this business because she wanted to have her own income and help her husband with the household expenses.  She decided to sell chickens so that her husband would not have to bear the financial pressure alone.  What she wants most from this small business and from the loan that she is requesting, is to be able to buy more chickens and increase her sales so that her customers can buy what they want and her sales are not limited.

The group is comprised of the following members: Leila Yolanda, who will invest the loan in the purchase of Jafra brand products for re-sale; Normaida, who will use the loan to raise chickens for later sale; Elsi, who will purchase chickens and turkeys for re-sale; and Candelaria who will purchase cheese for re-sale.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and sell them butchered.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María, vive con dos hijos en casa propia, ella tiene un comedor en su casa donde vende desayunos y almuerzos, todos los días y por las tardes vende pupusas dos días por semana, el negocio lo inicio hace veinte años debido a la necesidad.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar la materia prima de su negocio como: quesillo, chicharrón, harina, repollo, tomates y otros materiales que le servirán para la elaboración de pupusas, teniendo lo necesario podrá obtener mejores ingresos y podrá darles lo que necesitan su familia.
El sueño de María siempre mantener su negocio y poder darles el estudio  a sus hijos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María lives with two children in their own house.  She has a room in her house where she sells breakfast and lunch every day, and two days a week in the evenings sells pupusas (thick, corn tortillas).  She started the business twenty years ago because of the need. The loan will be used to purchase the raw materials of her business such as: cheese, pork, flour, cabbage, tomatoes and other materials that will serve to prepare pupusas.  Having what is needed can earn a better income and she can give her family what they need. María ‘s dream is always to maintain her business, be able to give her children an education and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, pork, flour, cabbage and tomatoes.

loans.name: Dario

texts.es: El señor Darío es una persona responsable y honesta que desde pequeño tuvo su ilusión de tener un negocio donde el pudiera tomar sus propias decisiones. Hace nueve años tuvo la oportunidad de comprar equipos de cómputo para iniciar su negocio de cibercafé que se ubica desde su domicilio. Ofrece internet, música, copias, algunos artículos de oficina y mas. Para Dario es muy importante tener sus equipos en buenas condiciones por lo que quiere comprar otro equipo nuevo que tenga la mejor procesador, de esta manera ofrecerá a su cliente mejor servicio y obtendrá mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Darío is a responsible and honest person who since he was young wished to have a business where he could make his own decisions.  Nine years ago he had the opportunity to buy computer equipment to start his internet cafe business that is located in his home.  He offers Internet, music, copies, some office supplies, and more.  For Darío it is very important to have his equipment in good condition, so he wants to buy new equipment that has the best processor.  In this way he will offer his customers better service and he will have a better income.

loans.use: to buy computer equipment.

loans.name: Sabas Nicolas Amevi

texts.fr: Sabas Nicolas Amevi âgé de 44 ans. Sabas Nicolas Amevi est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Line et est père de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. En plus de ses enfants, Sabas Nicolas Amevi a un autre enfant à sa charge. Sabas Nicolas Amevi vit avec ses enfants et sa femme. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Sabas Nicolas Amevi achète des noix de palme qu'il transforme en huile végétale qu'il revend à son domicile et par la technique de distribution. Sabas Nicolas Amevi vend également du gaz-oil de façon secondaire. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Sabas Nicolas Amevi achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Sabas Nicolas Amevi sollicite pour une première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des noix de palme et du gaz-oil.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Patrick is a hardworking, ambitious and go-getter farmer who is 36 years of age. He hails from Gitugi, a small village in the Thika area of Kenya. He comes from a very humble background, and did not manage to attend college, but that did not kill his spirit to succeed. 

He has actively been involved in farming for the past eight years. Although he has made great strides in farming, he wants to diversify his farming, and is kindly seeking a loan to buy goats. 

Goat farming is one of the profitable agricultural ventures in Kenya, and Patrick, having an entrepreneur's mind, wants to take advantage of that to improve his living conditions. Patrick loves goat farming because goats are not demanding to keep, unlike poultry, which require special care and attention. 

Patrick believes that with the loan his life will permanently change because he will be selling goat meat and dairy goat milk to the ready market that is available. As far as the market of goat products is concerned, demand is greater than supply. Patrick always says to become a successful goat farmer you need three ingredients, and that is getting the right breed, giving the right feed, and proper care.

With the loan, he believes he will become a successful goat farmer and be able to realize his dream of transforming his life. Having been farming for the past 10 years, Patrick finds it very enjoyable to raise goats because he does not spend more money on buying food. Patrick will also sell manure from the goats and use it on his farm, also saving much more money and improving his living conditions. 

Profits from selling goat meat to the local market and goat milk will be used to fully repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old. She is married and has four children.

She has had a motor bike transport and an mpesa services business for 12 years.

She will be using the loan to pay school fees for her children and do shopping for her child who is joining high school next year. She hopes this will help her to educate her children well through university.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to add more float for her mpesa shop and start selling new phones.

She is in her eighth loan cycle and she has borrowed KES 80,000 to be repaid in 12 months.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children and do shopping for her child who is joining high school next year.

loans.name: Kadidiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place en Novembre 2015. Il est composé de  femmes déterminées à changer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Kadidiatou (debout à droite avec une main levée), est l'emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle  s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires (sucre, huile, thé allumette etc).
 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 01 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile raffiné, 01 sac de 50 kg de sucre ; 02 cartons de thé et des allumettes pour le revendre en détails dans son village.

Les bénéfices sont destinés à la participation à la prise en charge de sa famille (habillements, soins médicaux habillement etc.…) et à développer son épargne

loans.use: acheter 01 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile raffiné, 01 sac de 50 kg de sucre ; 02 cartons de thé et des allumettes pour le revendre en détails dans son village.

loans.name: Emelina

texts.en:
My name is Emelina, I have a grocery located in my house in the center of my community. I have had it for years and it gives me income to contribute to my family\'s expenses. Thanks to this business our income has increased and we can pay for the education of my children. Now my baby is at the university studying media. I need to stock my business so that I can offer my customers more variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Emelina, tengo una pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitación en el centro de mi cumunidad, desde hace varios años, la que me genera ingresos para coomtribuir con los gastos de de mi familia, gracias a este negocio nuestros ingresos han aumentando y podemos pagar los gastos de educación mis hijos, actualmente nenemos en educ Media y en la Universidad. Y necesito surtir mi negocio para poder ofrecer a mis clientes mayor variedad de productos.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, lard, soap, chicken, soft drinks, flour, dairy products, bread and candy.

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en:
Rafik breeds calves in a private farm shed. With this business he meets the needs of his family.
He has run this business for 6 years. 
In the beginning of his business he borrowed $400 and bought 2 calves. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a cow.
Rafik is 49, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kurdmahmudlu village. He is married and has a child.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Germania

texts.en:
Germania started her business out of a need to earn more income for her family. She started selling makeup and other cosmetics to the teachers at her son’s school. Before she knew it, she had a full-fledged business selling cosmetics and other accessories to women. She is now seeking a loan that will help her buy her products at larger quantities so she may make more profit.

Germania is 46 and has three children. She lives in a home made out of wood and bamboo. She is hoping that with the extra profit she can fix the roof and walls.

loans.use: to buy her products at larger quantities

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
Aracely is an enterprising and optimistic woman. She is married with two children, 10 and 12 years old. Her husband works as an electrical technician. However, his salary is very low and doesn't cover the family's expenses. Two years ago, facing this financial situation, Aracely decided to start her own business selling cosmetics. Little by little she has grown her business.

At the moment, Aracely is applying for a loan of $375, which she will use to buy merchandise to cover her existing orders and to expand the range of products that she offers her clients. She agrees to repay the loan in 6 months. Aracely and her family very much appreciate the opportunity to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Aracely es una mujer emprendedora y optimista, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 12 años de edad. Su esposo se desempeña como técnico electricista, sin embargo, el salario que obtiene es muy poco y no puede cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, ante esta situación Aracely decidió emprender su negocio con la venta de cosméticos hace dos años, poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos, Aracely está solicitando un crédito por $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene y ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Aracely y su familia te agradecen mucho la oportunidad de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa has been in business for more than six years. Married with two children, the twenty-nine-year-old is the only breadwinner for the family. He also cares for his father’s family.

Musa said “The school fees for my children and my brothers are the biggest expense I incur from the income I get from the business.” He went on saying that he doesn't mind spending so much on education because this is an investment for a better life in the future.

Musa is planning to extend his market to a nearby village and therefore is requesting a loan of US$ 200.

loans.use: Expansion of his business to a nearby village to increase profits for his family

loans.name: María Manuela

texts.es:
María Manuel and her husband had three children, all of whom are married. Despite this, she, at 60 years of age, has to care for one of her grandchildren which has kept her busy trying to make money to offer a better future to her grandson. “We are at a mature age and we must take advantage of our strengths in order to do something useful.”

For this reason María began a paper store that in the beginning sold notebooks, and little by little began to introduce new products that her customers were requesting.

Nevertheless, her products are not well-organized enough to separate one product from others, and because of this she is requesting a loan of $750, which she will repay over a period of 6 months. With this money María wants to buy some glass cases to display her Christmas products, which she’d also like to buy to be able to offer around Christmastime. With your help María and her husband will be able to help their little grandson that needs them.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

María Manuela y su esposo tuvieron 3 hijos de los cuales todos están casados, a pesar de esto ella a sus 60 años tiene que hacerse cargo de uno de sus nietos, lo que los a mantenidos ocupados para sacar dinero para poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su nieto. “Ya que estamos en la edad de la madurez y hay que aprovechar las fuerzas para hacer algo de utilidad”.

Es por esto que María comenzó a hacer una papelería, que en un inicio fue venta de libretas y poco a poco ha ido introduciendo nuevos productos que la gente va pidiendo.

Sin embargo, no tiene un orden adecuado para separar unos productos de otros, y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero María desea comprar unas vitrinas para poner los artículos navideños que también desea comprar para ofrecerlos en esta temporada navideña. Con tu ayuda María y su esposo podrán ayudar a su pequeño nieto que los necesita.

loans.use: Buy merchandise and a little display case

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Emin

texts.en: Emin B. owns a woodworking shop in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 28 years old and mainly makes tables and shelves. He is currently looking for funding so that he can purchase some new tools for his shop that will allow him to do more specialized work more efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his business

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette lives with her husband and seven children in the Mata San Juan community of Santo Domingo. She has been selling men’s and women’s clothing for five years. Jeanette has her stall in the public market, and many people visit her stall every day to purchase her goods. However, Sunday has the most activity and sales because is the principal market day. This entrepreneur has requested a loan to expand her business.

Jeanette is a trustworthy person. About five months ago, she took a loan from our organization and used it wisely. She managed to improve her business and repaid the loan successfully. With this new loan, Jeanette will be able to better help her large and needy family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing in bulk in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria I. is married with 6 children. She is 56 years old. She is from Edo State, Nigeria.

Victoria sells clothes to earn a living. She learnt the trade for 3 years before starting her own business. She needs the loan amount of $600 to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is thirty-six years old and a mother of one child who is currently in school. She has been selling gari (milled and roasted cassava) for the past five years in Mankessim. She buys the gari from Tamale in the Northern part of Ghana.

Sarah wants to use her new loan to buy more bags of gari to prevent price hikes and to reduce her frequent travels to the north. It takes twelve hours to travel to the north.

She is a member of the group called Stewards. Members guarantee for each other, which serves as social collateral in repaying the loan.

In the photograph, Sarah selling gari in the market.

loans.use: To buy more bags of gari.

loans.name: Amina

texts.es:
Mrs Amina is a member of the Shipibas Community Bank, located at Tarapaca Jr., block 5 of the Calleri district, Ucayali Province. She is 21 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a dental technician but his income is not sufficient to support the entire family. Consequently, using the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for approximately $110, Amina began buying and selling dental products. Now she owns a shop selling such products. She gets up at 7 am to prepare breakfast for her husband and children, after which she works in her shop until 8 pm.

With this loan, repayable over four months, she plans to purchase dental equipment and products to add to her shop's product range. Amina is very happy that her business is growing and its sales is increasing, enabling them to provide better education and future for their children.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Amina pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Jr Tarapacá cuadra 5 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 21 años, es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es Técnico Dental, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no le alcanza para su economía familiar, es así que Amina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de compra y venta de materiales dentales. En la actualidad ella cuenta un puesto de venta de materiales dentales, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo luego se dedica a la atención de su negocio hasta las 8 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará equipos y materiales dentales para implementar su negocio. Amina esta muy feliz, su negocio esta creciendo sus ventas aumentan y todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para darles una buena educación y futuro a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase a wider range of products for sale

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Beautiful hand-knit products have become the most important work for Segundina, who with her agile and talented hands creates pretty and warm gloves. After knitting a large quantity, she sells them in bulk on the weekends in the market of San José in the city of Juliaca, Peru. Segundina did not have the opportunity to complete her high school education because of limited resources, and she does not want her dear children to have the same experience. For this reason she works hard and puts forth her best effort in this noble pursuit in order that her children will have better opportunities in the future. Segundina hopes for help from your good heart.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Los bellos trabajos de tejidos a mano se ha convertido en la labor más importante de Segundina, quien con sus ágiles y talentosas manos elabora hermosos y cálidos guantes que luego de tejer en una buena cantidad cada fin de semana los oferta al por mayor en el mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca.Segundina no tuvo la oportunidad de concluir sus estudios secundarios por falta de recursos económicos, y no desea que sus queridos hijos pasen por lo mismo, es por ello que se esfuerza y pone su mayor dedicación en su noble actividad con el fin de que sus hijos en un futuro puedan tener mayores oportunidades.Segundina espera la ayuda de tu buen corazón.

loans.use: To acquire a large quantity of raw material for weaving

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa has a small cafe where she sells coffee, soft drinks and enchiladas. She started selling these products 8 years ago with the money that she had been saving and had at the time. As the years have gone on she has been able to improve her business and change the products that she offers. Maria Teresa is married and has 8 kids, and as she has prepared them for life well they are now all independent. She would like to invest in another source of income and would like to buy construction materials to build a room to rent. She has been an excellent client and has repaid all credits on time and in full.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Teresa tiene un cafetín en el que vende café, refrescos, enchiladas. Hace 8 años empezó con estas ventas, los fondos los adquirió gracias a unos ahorros que en su momento tenía. Con el pasar de los años ha podido mejorar su negocio y diversificar los productos que ofrece. Maria Teresa es casada, tiene 8 hijos, que ya pudo preparlos para la vida, ya ellos son independientes a ella. Quiere invertir en otra fuente de ingreso como lo es la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer una habitación para alquiler, ha sido una exelente clienta, ha pagado todos sus créditos en tiempo y forma.

loans.use: To build a room to rent/Construcción de un cuarto para alquiler

loans.name: Ni Luh Suci Muliani

texts.id:
Ni Luh Suci Muliani and husband, I Ketut Suliana, has been married for almost 17 years, and have 3 orang children. The first named I Putu Elba Antarika is 16 years old, in highschool. Second child I Made Elga Riana, 14 years old, Junior High. And third I Komang Elvira Riantini, 5 years old, kindergarden. Her husband's occupation is working for a private company. To fill in time after finishing housework, Ni Luh Suci is raising 3 piglets for fattening, that she just bought after receiving a losn from DINARI. The price for those 3 pigs were Rp 900,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00), and the rest to build a stall and buying feed. Ni Luh Suci bought mixed feed of wheat shells, concentrate and rice shells. After 6 months old, the 3 pigs will be sold at Rp 3,600,000, at a 6 months expense of Rp 2,600,000 due to high feed cost. Thus 6 months profit would be Rp 1,000,000. Ni Luh Suci is very much helped by this Dianri loan so that it would help in increasing her capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Luh Suci Muliani dan suaminya, I Ketut Suliana, sudah menikah hampir 17 tahun dan memiliki 3 orang anak. Anak yang pertama diberi nama I Putu Elba Antarika umur 16 tahun, SMA. Anak yang kedua I Made Elga Riana, 14 tahun, SMP. Dan anak yang ketiga I Komang Elvira Riantini, 5 tahun, TK. Pekerjaan suaminya sebagai pegawai swasta. Untuk mengisi waktu setelah selesai mengerjakan pekerjaan rumah tangganya Ni Luh Suci memelihara 3 ekor babi penggemukan yang baru dibelinya setelah mendapat pinjaman dari DINARI. Harga 3 ekor babinya Rp. 900.000,- dan sisanya untuk membuat kandang dan membeli pakan. Ni Luh Suci memberi campuran pakan dedak gandum, konsentrat dan dedak padi. Setelah berumur 6 bulan, 3 ekor babinya dijual dengan harga Rp. 3.600.000,- dengan pengeluaran selama 6 bulan Rp 2.600.000,- karena kebutuhan pakan saat ini mahal. Jadi keuntungan bersih yang didapat Rp.1.000.000,- selama 6 bulan. Ni Luh Suci sangat terbantu oleh pinjaman dari dinari sehingga bisa membantu dalam menambah modal usahanya.

loans.use: To buy 3 pigs, building the stall and buying feed (Membeli 3 ekor babi, membuat kandang dan pakannya)

loans.name: Jilma Ninoska

texts.es:
La señora Jilma A. se dedica al negocio de pulpería atendido en su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua. Es una dama que con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado salir adelante y ha beneficiado a su pequeño hijo en edad escolar.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, la pulpería de la señora Jilma requiere de inversión inmediata en los productos y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la adquisición de dichos productos para ofrecerlos en el negocio. Actualmente se ha caracterizado por ser una fiel cliente habiendo cancelado todos sus anteriores créditos satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Ms. Jilma A. runs a local store from her own house, which is located in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur, Managua. She has made a big effort in order to go forward, and this has greatly benefited her school-age son.

Like all developing businesses, Mrs. A.’s business needs immediate investments. In order to acquire the funds that she needs, she has turned to Ceprodel. She wants to obtain a loan that will allow her to acquire the products that she will offer in her business. She is currently considered to be a loyal client, since she has satisfactorily payed off all her previous loans.


Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products to be sold

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Mr. Khom C., 45, and his wife, Mrs. Phal Sok, 44, who live in a small village off of National Road number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 1983 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of their children has full time employment and the other children study in the local school.

Mr. Khom C. has been growing rice and vegetables since he was married, while his wife is a garment factory worker. Currently, Khom wants to create another job of driving a motor taxi to earn extra income for his family, but lacks the money to buy a motorcycle. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike for driving a motor taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for driving a motor taxi.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mr. Leng T. is a villager in Prey Cha Kroav village in Kampong Cham Province. He is 58-year-old and the father of a child who is blacksmith. He is employed as a fish breeder at a large company. His wife, Mrs. Choun Thuch, is a fish breeder. Her business needs more working capital to support production. Thus, Mr. Leng T. requests a loan to buy fish foods to support his wife's business. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy fish food to support his wife's business.

loans.name: Renacer Ingenio Group

texts.es: El grupo “Renacer Ingenio” esta representado por la señora Mónica que se dedica  a la venta D. tenis, existe parentescos familiares entre la señora Mary Lourdes,Marilin y Adelia pero cada una tiene independencia economica por lo que el grupo no tiene mayores contratiempos. Una mayoría D. los socios (as) se dedica al comercio los cuales venden comida, celulares, electrodoméstico, ropa a la confesión D. polleras, chamarras y zapatos. Cada uno es conciente D. la competencia que existe en el mercado D. compra y venta pero los años que tienen D. experiencia en el rubro les permite decir que son capaces D. pagar sus cuentas con puntualidad dy responsabilidad. El financiamiento esta destina a la adquisición D. mercadería para la venta así como a la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas para sus pequeños negocios. Son gente que tiene experiencia en el trabajo con grupos solidarios ya que trabajaron con grupos anteriores, demostrando honestidad y puntualidad en los pagos.
texts.en:
The group “Renacer Ingenio” (“Reborn Ingenuity”) is represented by Mrs. Mónica, who sells tennis shoes. Mrs. Mary Lourdes Marilin and Adelia are relatives, but each one has her own business, so that the group doesn’t have bigger problems. Most of the members are involved in businesses that sell food, cell phones, electric appliances, clothes for confession, including skirts, jackets, and shoes. Each one is conscious of the competition that exists in the market, but the years of experience they have in the field allow them to know that they are capable of paying their repayments punctually and responsibly. The loan will be used to acquire merchandise to sell, such as supplies, materials, and tools for their small businesses. They have experience in working in mutually binding groups since they have worked with groups before. They have demonstrated honesty and punctuality in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing for a small store

loans.name: Martha Imelda

texts.es:
La señora Martha Imelda G. L. es casada y tiene un negocio de venta de ropa el cual lleva 18 años de operación. Pero debido a una operación que tuvo la señora Martha Imelda, ella quedo convaleciente de la cadera y ya no puede atender el negocio, ahora el negocio es atendido por su esposo, el tuvo que dejar su empleo para poder atender a la señora Martha Imelda en su recuperación.
La señora Martha Imelda está solicitando un préstamo para comprar ropa seleccionada para así surtir su negocio y obtener más ingresos los cuales servirán para solventar los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Ms. Martha Imelda G. L. is married and has her own clothing business, which has been in service for 18 years.
