However, because of a surgical procedure she underwent, she has a hip disability and can no longer attend to her business. As a result, her husband now runs the business. He had to leave his job in order to help Martha Imelda with her recovery.

Ms. Martha Imelda is requesting this loan in order to purchase select apparel so that she can restock her business and earn more profits, thus helping her cover the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Don Miguel tiene 53 años de edad, habita en anexo villa libertad entrada principal 6 cuadras al sur ½ c al este, junto a su esposa e hijos,  su negocio es un taller de zapatería que inicio con su papa desde muy joven pues era el trabajo que realizaba. Con esta solicitud de crédito es para comprar materia prima para realizar su trabajo, va a comprar cuero,  suela, y lo necesario para realizar su trabajo de zapatero y poder dar un buen servicio a sus clientes. A corto plazo espera comprar una maquina para confección de zapatos, y poyar a sus hijos que estudien para que sean hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Don Miguel is 53 years old, and lives with his wife and children 6 blocks south and a half block east of the main entrance to Anexo Villa Libertad. He runs a shoe repair business which his father started and which he has worked at since he was very young. This loan application is to buy the raw material (leather, rubber, etc.) necessary to do his job and to provide high-quality services to his customers. In the short term, he hopes to buy a machine to aid him in his work and to support the studies of his sons so that they can grow up to be good men.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials for his business

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Chim S., 38, is married and resides with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She is a good housewife who stays at home doing housework and cooking for her family members. Her husband is a carpenter who makes $10 in revenue every day. This couple also gets support from two children who sell duck eggs.

Mrs. Chim S. would like to ask for a loan to purchase wood for her husband to expand his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase wood to expand carpentry business

loans.name: Caro

texts.en:
Caro I. is 50 years old and married with five children. She sells food stuffs like plantains and yams.

She needs a loan of N30,000 to purchase more food stuffs to sell. Caro says thank you.

loans.use: Purchase more food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Enjo M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Enjo K. from Kyela. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 7 and 8.  Enjo has been running a cosmetics business since 2003. Her business is purchasing and selling cosmetics. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Enjo currently earns about US $80 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US $550 in order to purchase cosmetics in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Enjo thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong B. is 55 years old and a resident of Battambang Province, where she earns a living by working as a domestic cultivator. Beside the farming business, Mrs. B. owns a small store next to her house and uses it to sell types of desserts to neighbors. She is a widowed mother who has eight children, three of whom are single and under her care, while the other five are married and live independently.

Mrs. B. wants her single children to have a suitable business. That is why she has decided to seek a loan as capital to buy grocery items for her children to sell.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her children to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E., married with four children, was educated through Junior High School and has sold groundnuts, yams, beans, pure water and other food supplies at Ola in Cape Coast for the past five years. Her husband is a fisherman. Mary uses her income to take care of her children and is requesting a loan to purchase more food supplies for selling.  Mary plans to put the new profits from her expanded business into her savings account.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma O. owns and operates a sari-sari, or general store, selling daily use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. She is 44 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Tipan, Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental. Emma has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Emma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gulsunoi

texts.ru: Гулсуной Абдувалиева 1963 года рождения , замужем имеет 3 детей.   Несколько лет вышла на пенсию, н сидеть дома не смогла решила заняться бизнесом. Ее сын мясник , его работа сдавать скот на бойню. Она также  продавала сало коровье и  баранье. Таким образом она начала свой бизнес. Позже накопив  небольшой капитал приобрела мясорубку электрическую. Со временем стала  вывозить на рынок и фарш. Сейчас также хочет расширить свой бизнес и ей необходим кредит для покупки большого товара мяса. Для этого она не хочет просить своего сына , а иметь свой капитал.
texts.en:
Born in 1963, Gulsunoi A. is married and has 3 children. She retired several years ago, but because she could not just stay at home, Gulsunoi decided to get involved in business. Her son is a butcher, whose job is to send livestock to a slaughterhouse. Gulsunoi sold beef and lamb tallow and, thus, started her business. Later, she saved enough money to buy an electric meat grinder. With time, Gulsunoi started to bring ground meat to the market. She currently wants to expand her business and needs a loan in order to buy a large quantity of meat. She does not want to ask her son for the product and, instead, wants to have her own capital.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat

loans.name: Floria

texts.en:
Floria B. is 57 years old. She is already an old mother but still strives hard for the best to give her family a good future. She was gifted with two children, named Ginalyn and Roldan. They both have successfully finished their studies through their sacrifices. 

Floria manages a general store business, since she can no longer go to farm to till their farm lot. Instead, she establish a store to further gain income for their daily living and for the future of her children. She is asking for financial support from Kiva, amounting to PHP 20,000, as additional business capital to be able to improve her store and to make it more profitable.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
The people shown in the picture above are Mrs. Yen H. and her husband with their two young children. Yen H. currently stays at home to be responsible for daily housework like, caring for kids, cooking, and cleaning house. It means that all of the family’s daily expense are contributed by her husband who works in construction.

Yen H. hopes to run a new suitable trade as a grocery seller by using her loan to invest more effectively in this business. She proposes to use some amount of loan to repair and decorate her old house.

loans.use: To start a grocery business and to repair her old house

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Being a widow and trying to raise and provide for six children can be a gruelling challenge, but Mrs. Ofelia B., a 60-year-old from Central Leonor Propoer, Brgy. Jonob-jonob Escalante City, Negros Occidental, is determined to provide a better future for her children. She strives very hard to meet all her familial responsibilities.

Mrs. B. originally started a sari-sari, or general store, business 15 years ago, to supplement the income of her husband. It has continued to provide a steady income for the family. More recently, Mrs. B. saw the business potential of setting up a rice-trading business. She started selling rice to the hacienda (sugar plantation) workers on credit. The workers pay her at the end of every week when they receive their weekly pay. The two businesses earn 5,000 PHP per month for her family.

Concerned for the welfare of her neighbors and community, Mrs. B. ran for, and won, a seat in the Baranggay (Village) Council. At present, she has a loan of 19,000 PHP, which is her 13th loan cycle with NWTF-Project Dungganon. It is being used as additional capital for her business, and she also plans to make improvements on her house.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of – not just a few – but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life which can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon!

loans.use: Additional capital for a sari-sari and rice-trading business and for house improvements

loans.name: Maria Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 46 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 4 hijos y estudio primaria incompleta, vive en el sector Lupaca Pamaya. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ovinos. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, ella invertirá este dinero para la compra de ovinos que luego de engordarlos los venderá en la feria de su zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y ayudar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las reuniones, los ahorros y las charlas.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the Manuela de Hoy II Community Bank, which is located in the Camicachi community, Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 46, married, and she has four children. She went to elementary school, but she did not finish. She lives in the Lupaca Pamaya sector. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. She used her initial loan for 500 PEN to buy sheep. She now needs a loan for 500 PEN to buy sheep to fatten. She will then sell them in the regional fair. Her wish is to keep working and to help her children. She likes the meetings, the savings, and the talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Opia

texts.en: Opia M. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and is requesting a loan to stock more maize flour to sell.  Opia is 43 years old and is Widowed.   She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family's settlement BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more maize flour to sell

loans.name: Rokey

texts.en:
Mrs. Rokey K. and her husband, Mr. Mat Sos, live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have eight children: Two of them were married and live outside the family home, two assist their father in the business, one is autistic person and other three are in school.  

Rokey has been selling chicken and duck for over 2 years. She buys them her villagers and transports to sell in Prek Tamak market about 3 kilometers for her house. Mrs. Mat Sos has been a fisherman since he was young. 
By the way, Rokey needs to spend a lot of money to rents the space of the store for selling chicken and duck. It’s difficult for her to manage income to support her family, so she requesting her first loan of 400 USD to purchase her own store for her business and buy fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a store for her selling chicken business and buy fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: B. Bernadette est née en 1964 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Bernadette réside au quartier Zounkpa à Porto-Novo depuis une vingtaine d’année. C’est une veuve qui a à sa charge ses deux enfants tous scolarisés. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par elle seule. Bernadette a arrêté les classes au cours primaire. Il y a huit ans de cela que Bernadette prépare et vend de l’akassa à son domicile. Bernadette vend également des oignons. Bernadette s’approvisionne au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo et également à Cotonou. Bernadette est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui sollicite un autre crédit auprès de l’institution en vue de diversifier son activité et de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
B. Bernadette is born in 1964 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Bernadette has been living in the Zounkpa neighborhood in Porto-Novo for about twenty years. She is a widow who has two children, all in school, at her care. She takes care of the family expenses alone. Bernadette stopped classes in primary school. It's been eight years Bernadette has been making and selling "akassa" at her home. She also sells onions. She gets her supplies at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo and also in Cotonou. Bernadette is an old customer of ALIDe who is requesting another loan from the institution to diversify her business and to better meet the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn, charcoal and baskets of onions

loans.name: Khushbakht

texts.en:
S. Khushbakht is 24 years old. He is married and has two children. Khushbakht has the business of baking “lepeshka”- national bread. Khushbakht is the main breadwinner in the family. He believes that this business is profitable and is not the subject to the seasonality. He wakes early and bakes the lepeshka and bread so that people will have the fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. He purchases all the ingredients, like the flour, salt, yeast at the local market. Now, due to high demands, Khushbakht wants to increase the amount of bread he bakes so that he requests 5000 Somoni. The loan will be spent for purchasing the flour and coal for baking the “lepeshka”. Khushbakht deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing ingredient for national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.es:
La Señora Eustaquia P.  tiene 55 años y está casada con el Señor Faustino G.  por más D. 30 años, La señora se dedica a la producción D. leche y su posterior venta a una empresa que elabora toda clases D. productos lácteos, y su esposo además D. ayudar con la producción D. leche también se dedica a la agricultura y a cultivar la mayoría D. los insumos que utiliza para el ganado lechero, como ser chala, alfa alfa y  maíz.

La señora Eustaquia  vive en la zona D. Machac Marca en Cochabamba,  es una zona bastante alejada D. la ciudad y por lo tanto para ellos es difícil acudir a los bancos en busca D. préstamo por eso fue que el Cidre tuvo la iniciativa D. ir a esta zona y descubrimos que el estado en el que tienen su ganado no es muy bueno y que a la mayoría les falta establos, que en esta época D. lluvia son muy requeridos.Por lo tanto la señora Eustaquia utilizara este crédito para construir un establo y que sus vacas no sufran en la época D. lluvia. 

La señora Eustaquia nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es continuar con la producción D. leche como siempre lo hizo, ver a sus hijos y nietos tener un futuro bueno y que algún día tenga suficiente ganado para dejarles una herencia a sus hijos que les ayuD. en la vida. Que cada vez está más dura en el país.
texts.en:
Eustaquia P., 55, has been married to Faustino G. for over 30 years. She is a dairy farmer and sells the milk to an enterprise that produces all kinds of dairy products. Her husband, asiD. from helping with the milk production, also farms and produces most of the feed, like chala (corn husks and cobs), alfalfa and corn, needed for the dairy cows. Eustaquia lives in the Machac Marca area of Cochabamba. This is an area that is quite far from the city so for them to go to banks in search of financing is very difficult. This is why Cidre took the initiative to go to this area and we discovered that the conditions in which they have their cattle are not very good; most lack stable facilities which in this rainy season is very much needed. Therefore, Eustaquia will use these funds to build a stable so that her cows won't suffer during the rainy season. Eustaquia tells us that her greatest wish is to continue with milk production like she's done to date, to see her children and grandchildren have a better future, and to someday have enough cattle to leave her children an inheritance that will help them in life, which every day is more difficult in the nation.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a stable to house cattle.

loans.name: Damian

texts.es:
el señor Damian L. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos estudian y uno de ellos aprende el oficio de mecanica en su taller.
Su familia es de principios cristianos el trabaja a tiempo completo en su taller de mecanica automotriz.
 
en su negocio repara carros pequeños y grandes, su especialidad es los motores, bombas de inyeccion , cambio de hojas de resorte y calibracion de valvulas.
 
esta solicitando el credito para la compra de un torquimetro, llaves, gatas y un tecle.
texts.en:
Damian L. is 49. He is in a common law marriage, and he has three children. Two of them go to school, and one is learning the job of mechanic in his shop. His family is of Christian principles. He works full time in his automotive mechanic's shop. In his business he repairs small and large cars. His specialties are motors, fuel injection, changing shock absorbers, and valve calibrations. He is asking for the loan to buy a torque gauge, wrenches, jacks, and a grip hoist.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools and accessories for cars

loans.name: Kajekaire Group, Jinja

texts.en:
Lydia Y., the leader of her group in Jinja, is a hard-working lady who has operated a salon business for the past two years. She tends primarily to ladies’ hair although she hopes to open up a men’s section. Because her salon is still small, she is able to make only 30,000/= as weekly profits, but she would like this to increase through additional investment.

Lydia is requesting a loan to buy more hair oils, chemicals, braids, weaves and combs so that her customers will have a greater variety to choose from. Currently employing one person who helps her to attend to her customers’ needs, she plans to hire more staff to offer a greater variety of hair styles and also hopes to develop bridal services.

loans.use: Buying more hair oils, chemicals, braids and weaves for salon expansion.

loans.name: Giachina

texts.es: Giachina tiene  28 años, y cuya familia esta conformada por su esposo y su hijo y juntos viven en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de animales en la principales ferias ganaderas, y más los fines de semana, en donde tiene más ventas. Además obtiene otros ingresos adicionales por parte de sus vecinos quienes le solicitan un animal en venta.  Paralelo a esta actividad, Giachina también se da tiempo a vender comida por las tardes, y mas cuando es temporada de celebración de la comunidad y ofrece a los turistas sus potajes. Es así que administra su tiempo para dedicarle a la ganadería, a su venta de comida y sin olvidar también su hogar. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es percibir los ingresos continuamente y eso le ayuda en el sostenimiento de su hogar. En el futuro tiene planeado comprar un terreno donde pueda poner a sus animales de venta, por le momento alberga su ganado en el establo de su de su madre. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, además esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su ser grupo comunal ya que todos son muy solidarios y cumplidos en las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicitó, lo invertirá en la compra de más animales como ovejas, cerdos y un toro pequeño.
texts.en:
Giachina is 28, and her family is made up of her husband and her son. They live together in a rented house. For 4 years she has been selling animals in the main livestock fairs, mostly in the weekends when she makes more sales. As well she earns other additional income on behalf of her neighbours who ask her to sell an animal. Alongside this activity, Giachina also spends time selling food in the afternoons, and more when it is the community's celebration season and she sells tourists her vegetable soups. So it is in this way that she arranges her time to focus on her livestock and her food sales without also forgetting her home. What she likes best about her work is to continually receive income and this helps her in running her household. In the future she has plans to buy land where she can put her animals for sale, at present she houses her livestock in her mother's barn. This is her third loan with MFP, what's more she is very happy to be a member of her communal group since everyone is very supportive and meets their payments. With the loan she is asking for, she will invest in the purchase of more animals like sheep, pigs and a young bull.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more sheep, pigs and a young bull.

loans.name: Oasis Group

texts.es:
holLa Señora Noemí García M. es originaria y vecina de una pequeña comunidad llamada Tonalá, Municipio de Ayutla de los Libres dentro del Estado de Guerrero, en México. Para llegar a la comunidad hay una desviación en la carretera antes de llegar a la cabecera municipal se toma un camino de 8 km. De terracería poco transitable en época de lluvias.
Tiene 29 años es una persona casada con 3 hijos de 8 años, 4 años y el tercero de 7 meses.
Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de quesos frescos que ella misma elabora con la leche que compra a los pequeños ganaderos de la localidad.
También tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva muy poco tiempo y tiene intenciones de hacer crecer su negocio.
Es una persona casada pero su esposo le aporta muy poco para el gasto ya que se dedica a la agricultura y es mas bien de subsistencia, por eso tiene la necesidad de vender mas productos para incrementar sus ingresos para poder sacar adelante la economía familiar.
Entre sus necesidades están las de comprar una prensadora de quesos para poder diversificar sus productos y poder vender quesos de prensa ya que actualmente solo vende quesos frescos. Y si sigue creciendo en créditos va a poder comprar esa maquinaria con un próximo crédito.
Antes de solicitar crédito con Fundación Realidad estuvo trabajando con una Caja de Ahorros, pero debido al mal servicio se decidió cambiar a Fundación Realidad, para lo cual tuvo que formar un grupo de 12 personas cada quien con sus propias actividades económicas. 
Los nombres de las socias del grupo y sus actividades productivas son los siguientes:

Nombre	Préstamo	     Actividad económica
Areli R. R.	     5,000	Venta de antojitos para comer
Bertoldina C. S.    5,000	Venta de dulces y comida en la escuela
Gumecinda G. M.    5,000	Venta de abarrotes
Elvia R. Matías	     5,000	Venta de frutas y legumbres
Roberto C. C.	     5,000	Venta de dulces
Noemí G. M.	     3,000	Venta de quesos
Lourdes G. C.	     5,000	Elaboración y venta de pan
Irene C. Lozano	     5,000	Venta d eperfumes
Esteban R. M.	     5,000	Venta de abarrotes
Israel R. C.	     5,000	Servicio de transporte de pasajeros
Roberto C. R.    5,000	Venta de productos del campo
Anabel Jijón G.	     5,000	Venta de perfumes
texts.en:
Señora Noemí García M. is from a small community called Tonalá, in the municipality of Ayutla de los Libres, State of Guerrero, Mexico. In order to get to the community, there is a detour off the highway over 8 km. of rough dirt track, barely usable during the rainy season, before arriving at the main town. She is 29, married with 3 children of 8, 4, and 7 months. For the last 3 years she has been selling fresh cheeses that she makes herself with milk that she buys from small dairies in the area. She also has had a grocery shop for a short while, and she would like to enlarge her business. Although she is married, her husband gives her very little towards expenses since he works at subsistence-level agriculture. Therefore she needs to sell more to generate more income to improve the economic situation of her family. Among other necessities is the purchase of a cheese press in order to diversify her products to sell pressed cheeses, since currently she only sells fresh cheese. If she continues to qualify for more credit, she will be able to buy this machine with the next loan. Before requesting a loan through Fundación Realidad, she was working through a savings bank, but because of bad service she decided to change to Fundación Realidad. For this she had to form a group of 12 persons, each with their own economic activity. The names of the members of the group and their business are below: Name, Loan Amount, Business Areli R. R., 5,000, Selling snacks Bertoldina C. S., 5,000, Selling sweets and meals in school Gumecinda G. M., 5,000, Selling groceries Elvia R. Matías, 5,000, Selling fruits and vegetables Roberto C. C., 5,000, Selling candy Noemí G. M., 3,000, Selling cheese Lourdes G. C., 5,000, Baking and selling bread Irene C. Lozano, 5,000, Selling perfumes Esteban R. M., 5,000, Selling groceries Israel R. C., 5,000, Servicing passenger cars Roberto C. R., 5,000, Selling country produce Anabel Jijón G., 5,000, Selling perfumes

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make cheese

loans.name: God Give Group

texts.en: Rose G. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Give. In the photo, Rose is the one holding the sign. She is 45 years old and is married with five children aged 3 to 22 years, with educational levels of kindergarten through university student. She also cares for two siblings and a parent. Rose and her family live in Rock town, Elwa community, and she works in the Elwa market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia's capital. Rose herself was never able to continue her education through college due to lack of financial support from her parents. Rose’s business is the sale of crushed rock for construction. She breaks rocks into pieces and sells it to residents of Elwa that are into construction in Monrovia. She has been running this business for two years and hopes to own a wholesale and retail outlet in the near future. Rose started her business with three hundred Liberian dollars in capital. She faces a problem with the eight to nine-month rainy season because, when it rains, people don’t come out to buy which is not good for business. Rose sells clean and shining rocks in order to encourage her customers to continue buying from her. She needs this loan to purchase additional rock for resale to improve her business. Rose dreams of giving her children the best education and establishing businesses for them. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional rock to sell

loans.name: Pilar Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Pilar S. tiene la edad de 44 años se dedica a la venta de bolsas plásticas en el mercado municipal desde hace 12 años, antes de tener este negocio ella vendía miel de jicote y semilla de jícaro y de esta forma se ganaba la vida, su negocio lo inicio porque su tía la insto a que pusiera esta venta ya que también ella (la tía) se dedica a este mismo negocio. Doña pilar es madre soltera y con 2 hijos a los cuales ella les mantiene sus estudios.
Trabaja con Ceprodel desde el 2006 y se le han otorgado 16 créditos hasta la fecha, los cuales han sido para invertir en el negocio y poder tener un mejor nivel de vida, ya que los créditos han sido de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Pilar S. is 44 years old, and has dedicated herself to selling plastic bags at the local market for 12 years. Before starting this business she earned a living by selling honey and gourd seeds. She started her enterprise at the suggestion of an aunt, who was also in this line of business. Pilar is a single mother with 2 children who she supports in their studies. She has been working with Ceprodel since 2006 and, to date, she has been granted 16 loans that she has invested into her business. This help has allowed her to improve her standard of living, and the loans have been a great help to her.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various sizes of plastic bags.

loans.name: Marie Nicole

texts.en:
Marie Nicole D. is 44 years old and lives in the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She is married and is the mother of six children.

Madame D. has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for thirteen years and has never had problems in paying back her loans. She runs a small shop where she sells mainly vegetables but also a variety of other products.

This loan will be used to buy new vegetables which Madame D. will resell in her shop. The revenues generated by this activity allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Diamadjigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Diamadjigui est composé de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux dans le village de Djoutièbougou, préfecture de Bougouni, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce. 
Avec l’idée d’améliorer leur pouvoir d’achat, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce de céréales. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt elles comptent acheter, 2 tonnes de maïs et 1,5 tonnes de haricot. Les produits sont achetés auprès des fournisseurs du village de Djoutièbougou et  environs pour être revendus ensuite en détail, au comptant ou à crédit sur le marché Bougouni. Leur clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes espèrent obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans l’entretien de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The group Diamadjigui is composed of married women who average 32 years of age and four children each. The women live in nuclear families with their children and husbands in the village of Djoutièbougou, Prefecture of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through business relations. With the idea of improving their purchasing power, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to do business in grains and are now on their ninth group loan. The preceding loans have all been repaid. With this new loan, they intend to buy 2 tonnes of corn and 1½ tonnes of beans. The goods are purchased from supplies in and around the village of Djoutièbougou and are then sold at the Bougouni market. Cash and credit are accepted from their customer base composed of men and women. With this loan, the women hope to obtain a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used to support their children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 33 years old and married with two children who are in school. He runs a retail shop where he sells household goods, cereals and plastics. He has been in this business for five years and has two employees. He also runs a taxi business to earn extra income. He was previously employed as a security guard in a mercury trading company before he started this business. He saves part of his profit with his savings group called Mapema. 

He has requested a loan of kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy rice, sugar and cooking fat for his inventory. He hopes to buy a plot and build his family a house in the future.

loans.use: To add to his stock of rice, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget owns a store where she sells medicines. She is also a trained nurse and she treats her patients when they fall ill. She has been in this business for 9 years. Bridget is a kind and friendly woman. She is 38 and married, with a child. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines  to sell

loans.name: Alton Fernando

texts.es:
El  microempresario: Alton Fernando N. H. tiene 77 años de edad es casado con 10 hijos todos mayores de edad, vive con su esposa y desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a la venta de queso y otros productos lácteos. Este producto lo compra en el departamento de Chontales que es donde se consigue mas barato  y parte lo entrega por encargo y otra parte lo vende en su negocio ubicado en el mercado municipal de esta ciudad de Bluefields.

El señor N. ya fue beneficiado con un primer préstamo el cual utilizo para comprar productos lácteos, este préstamo ya fue cancelado en tiempo y forma desde hace un año aproximadamente.

El microempresario N. tiene un tramo en el mercado municipal de esta ciudad de Bluefields, sin embargo dicho tramo se encuentra en mal estado por lo que ya a sido victima de robos, por tal razón esta solicitando financiamiento para reconstruirlo y poder garantizarle seguridad al mismo.

Necesita comprar los siguientes materiales de construcción: 

Diez bolsas de cemento a US 12.00 dólares cada bolsa, dos unidades de playcem de 2x4 a  US 25.00 dólares cada unidad, dos quintales de varillas de hierro de 3/8 a US 10.00 dólares cada quintal, dos quintales de  varillas de hierro de1/4 a US 10.00 dólares cada quintal, cuatro unidades de playcem de 4/8 a US 16 dólares cada unidad y cuatro metros de arena a US 31.50 cada metro.
texts.en:
Micro-businessman Alton Fernando N. H. is 77 years old, is married, and has 10 adult children. He lives with his wife and for more than 20 years has sold cheese and other dairy products. He buys these products in Chontales Department, which is where they are cheapest. He delivers some that have been pre-ordered and sells some at his business located in the municipal market of the city of Bluefields. Mr. N. has already benefited from a first loan, which he used to buy dairy products. This loan was paid off on time about a year ago. This businessman has a stall in the municipal market of the city of Bluefields; however, the stall is in bad shape, and because of this Mr. N. has been a burglary victim. For this reason, he is applying for a loan to rebuild the stall and guarantee its security. He needs to buy the following construction materials: Ten bags of cement at USD $12 per bag Two units of 2x4 Plycem (a type of cement fiberboard laminate building material) at $25 each Two quintals (a quintal is one hundred pounds) of 3/8 inch iron bars at $10 per quintal Two quintals of 1/4 inch iron bars at $10 per quintal Four units of 4x8 Plycem at $16 each Four meters of sand at $31.50 per meter

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, 2x4 Plycem, 3/8 inch iron bars, 1/4 inch iron bars, 4x8 Plycem and sand

loans.name: Ebenezer 3 Group

texts.en:
Linda is the coordinator of her group Ebenezer, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, an area known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure.

Linda is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her mobile business selling clothing by purchasing pants, t-shirts and dress shirts to sell. She will use the profits to save towards her goal of purchasing a motorcycle to help her transport and sell her goods. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy pants, dress shirts and t-shirts to resell

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama I. sells maize and prepares kenkey and fish with hot pepper sauce in Abura. She has someone helping her sell her kenkey while she is away selling her maize. She has been in this trade for some time now. Mariama has not received any formal education. Her husband is a security man for a company. Her loan will be used to buy additional corn to prepare kenkey to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business. She also wants to establish a kenkey shop.

loans.use: To buy additional corn to prepare kenkey

loans.name: Ateasefotrust Bank Group

texts.en:
Saiba is currently the group leader of “Ateasefo” Trust Bank Group made up of 8 members. Saiba is clearly a loyal person. He is 33 years old and sells bales of used shoes to customers in his community. He is also a teacher. Saiba has been operating his trade for 1 year and he is eager to be taking out this loan. He plans to invest the loan to purchase bales of assorted used shoes for adults and children to meet his customers’ demands. Used shoes are most patronized since brand new ones are expensive for the majority of low income people. 

Saiba is single and the father of three children aged 3-9. He hopes to generate enough profit to be able to improve his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase used shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Mrs. Morn S., age 30, married woman and she is a villager who lives in Angk Prasat village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Bros Tith, are farmers who own 2-hectares of land to cultivate rice. With the farm, Mrs. Morn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for farming laborers to cultivate rice.  Aside from farmers, they are also pig and duck breeders at home. With these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. This couple has three children, one is attending in the local school and the other two, age of 1 and 6 are not yet in school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for farming laborers to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia B. is from the village of Brgy. Abinganan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Julia owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Julia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells her raised animal.

In 2008, Julia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Julia is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Julia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 45-year-old married man and father of five children, two of whom are employed. A resident of Lebanon, he has over 25 years of experience working with spare car parts and car repair. He is the main provider of his family, although his two working children try to help him with a small amount of support. He is requesting $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his inventory and therefore increase his sales. In the future, he plans to open a bigger store to trade and sell spare parts. He told us that he would like to one day open a big center.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support of Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Fadimata

texts.fr:
Fadimata D. est née le 25 Décembre 1977 à Mopti (5ème région administrative du Mali), mariée et mère de 5 enfants, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I Extension, un des  quartiers péripheriques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Issue dans une famille de pêcheur, Fadimata D. est née dans cette activité de pêche et de vente de poissons. Elle achète les poissons fumés à Mopti sur commande auprès de ses parents  pour les revendre au grand marché les jours de foire et le marché de leur localité les jours ouvrables où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des des femmes de ménage et vendeuses de condiments alimentaires) pour la qualité de ses poissons.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle a bénéficié d’un premier prêt qui a été correctement remboursé.  
Elle sollicite ce deuxième prêt, pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter, 15 cartons de poissons fumés de différentes qualités.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 125 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Fadimata D. was born December 25, 1977 in Mopti (fifth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She is married and the mother of five children. She lives with her husband and their children in the Sanoubougou I extension, a neighborhood on the outskirts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). Coming from a family of fishermen, Fadimata was born in the business of fishing and selling fish. She buys smoked fish on order in Mopti, from her parents, for resale at the big market on fair days. On regular workdays, she sells the smoked fish at the local market where she is in high demand by her customers (consisting mostly of housewives and condiment vendors) for the quality of her product. In order to better serve a steadily increasing customer base, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution where she received a first loan that was repaid without incident. She is seeking a second loan to expand her business. She plans to buy 15 cartons of smoked fish of varying grades. She expects to achieve a monthly profit of 125,000 FCFA to be used primarily to increase her working capital, help with the family expenses, and pay the interest on the loan.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy smoked fish

loans.name: Wifred

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Wilfred is a married father of two children aged 4 and 8, both attending school. He is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been farming for eight years and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk, eggs, maize and vegetables at a local market. He is a full-time farmer and depends on the income from his farm to cater for the needs of his family.

Wilfred recently repaid his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 51,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this loan will help improve the livelihood of his family since he will be able to provide them with enough milk for consumption and to pay school fees for his children with the income from the sale of milk.

Wilfred hopes that, in the future, he will be able to acquire four more dairy cows and four dairy goats and become the main milk supplier to the local market. His primary challenges are lack of storage facilities for his milk and the low price of milk.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria reside en vivienda propia en la zona de Alto Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada y tiene una hija en edad escolar; ella es enfermera particular y esta cuidando a una persona de la tercera edad y su esposo es jubilado de la administración publica, con los ingresos que obtienen mantienen a su familia.

El crédito que saco anteriormente fue para la construcción de gradas en su vivienda, es cliente de Impro con 3 créditos. El crédito que ahora solcita será utilizado enla compra de cemento y arena para el piso de una terraza en su casa. La señora se encuentra satisfecha con los créditos que le otorgamos.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito y se la considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own home in the Alto Llojeta zone on the west side of the city of La Paz. She is married and has a daughter who is of school age. Maria  is a private nurse and takes care of a senior citizen. Her husband is retired from public administration. She supports her family with the income that she earns.

Her previous loan was for the construction of steps in her house. She has had three loans from Impro. The loan that she is applying for now will be used to buy cement and sand for the floor of a terrace in her house. She is satisfied with the loans that she has been granted.

Because of her previous history, she is qualified to receive a new loan and is considered a good client.

loans.use: Buy cement and sand to make the floor of a terrace in her house.

loans.name: Marlon Concepcion

texts.es:
Marlon, habitante de colonia Kurinwas, con su esposa y sus dos hijos que tiene 13 años y el menor de 10 años de edad, labora en su pequeña unidad de producción realizando actividades pecuarias con su pequeño inventario ganadero, como  tambien actividades agricolas, siendo sus principales fuentes de ingreso.

Solicita este financiamiento a Afodenic mediante Kiva para invertirlo en compra de ternero de desarrollo, logrando de esta manera aumentar su inventario ganadero y en el transcurso de un año poder vender animales de peso que generen mayores ingresos mejorando la economia del hogar, en su comunidad lo consideran como un hombbre progresivo, trabajador y responsable.

Espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA para poder hacer realidad su sueño, mejorendo sus niveles economicos que le permita vivir en mejores condiciones de vida a anivel familiar .
texts.en:
Marlon lives in the Kurinwas neighborhood with his wife and two children, who are 13 and 10 years old.  He works in his small production unit on livestock work with his small inventory of cattle, and also on agricultural work.  These are his main sources of income.

He is requesting this funding from Afodenic through Kiva to invest in the purchase of a calf to raise.  He will be able in this manner to increase his inventory of cattle and in the course of a year to be able to sell animals of a weight that will earn him better income and improve his household economic situation.  He is considered in his community to be a progressive man, who is hard-working and responsible.

He hopes to benefit from the Kiva fund in order to make his dream come true, improving his economic level which will allow him and his family to live in better living conditions.

loans.use: Buying a calf to raise

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma P. is a married woman who lives in Purok Bayog, Barangay Patiui, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by vegetable farming.  Her husband, Dario P., who is 49 years old, works works with her on the farm and also helps her sell their vegetable harvest.  They have two children who are 16 and  23 years old. 

Elma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $338, raising the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing 28,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy fertilizers for her vegetable farm so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and the education of her children. Elma P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund her vegetable farming operations

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITTY CACHIMAYO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mercedes; tiene 48 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta 6:00 p.m, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche, la socia quiere mejorar la tienda de abarrotes. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes. 

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SR DE COYLLORITTY CACHIMAYO" communal bank.  It is located in the district of Cachimayo which belongs to the Anta Province in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Mercedes is 48 years old, and married with four children.  She alternates her daily activities with a grocery store she runs from 5:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  

She sells basic items such as rice, sugar and milk, but would like to improve her store.  She is requesting a loan to buy more products for the grocery store.

loans.use: To buy grocery store products.

loans.name: Atipiri Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “ATIPIRI” (que en lengua aymara quiere decir "Ganador") es un grupo que inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro focal de Cascada, cuenta con once integrantes, diez mujeres y un varón.  La mesa directiva para este ciclo tiene como presidenta a la señora María Elena,  como tesorera la señora Valeria y como secretaria de actas a la señora Verónica. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: artesanía en mantas, venta de aguayos y tienda, venta de hilado de lana de vicuña, criadero de chanchos y taller de cerrajería, venta de cosméticos, tienda de barrio.

La señora Maria Elena, presidenta de la banca comunal “ATIPIRI” recibe los mejores deseos de su grupo, para realizar un buen papel como presidenta durante este ciclo.  A los treinta y nueve años, ya tiene un hogar consolidado con su pareja y sus cuatro hijos. Con respecto a su negocio  ella  lleva 2 años en los negocios de artesanía en mantas.   Aprendió hace dos años de una amiga, actualmente solicita Bs.2000. para la compra de mercadería.
Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella dice “el crédito”.
texts.en:
The “ATIPIRI” (which in Aymara means “Winner”) communal bank is a group that is starting its first cycle in the Cascada Focal Center.  It has 11 members, 10 women and one man.

The governing board for this cycle has María Elena as President, Valeria as Treasurer and Verónica as Recording Secretary.  The women have different businesses.  Among them are: blanket weaving, aguayo (multicolored woolen cloth) sales, store, vicuña woolens weaving, pig raising, metal shop, cosmetics sales and neighborhood grocery store.

María Elena, President of the “ATIPIRI” communal bank receives her group’s best wishes to carry out the role of President during this cycle.  At the age of 39 she already has a well established home with her partner and four children.  With respect to her business, she has been weaving blankets for two years.  A girl friend trained her two years ago.  She is asking for Bs.2000 to buy merchandise.

When we asked her what she likes best about Pro Mujer she answered “the credit.”

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Álvaro Carrillo Group

texts.es:
El nombre que se le da al siguiente grupo es “Álvaro Carrillo”, es en honor a la calle donde se encuentra ubicado el grupo, también en honor al personaje ilustre de este gran compositor mexicano, originario de la costa chica de Pinotepa Nacional, el grupo esta integrado por un numero de 12 personas, en su totalidad son mujeres, la mujer que representa a este grupo es Antonia Florencia López Martínez, todas las integrantes tienen actividades diferentes con las cuales apoyan a sus familias.
Haremos mención de una integrante del grupo llamada Rosa Elia Jiménez C. de 31 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene a un niño de 4 años de edad llamado Jared quien estudia la educación preescolar (kinder), Rosa Elia se dedica  ala venta de dulces y golosinas de manera ambulante en diferentes puntos de la ciudad, tales como el  parque central, en las afueras de las escuelas públicas y en diferentes puntos de mayor concurrencia, Rosa no tiene estudios apenas si concluyo el cuarto año de primaria, ella es miembro de una familia muy humilde, y viven en un pequeña casa de materiales de laminas de cartón, madera y otros diferentes al concreto, tiene 4 hermanas y su padre se dedica a la elaboración y venta de nieves de sabores, su madre tiene 60 años de edad y también vende dulces. Una de las situaciones mas difíciles  a la que actualmente se enfrentó Rosa es  a la perdida total de su mercancía, ella nos cuenta hace unos días se metieron a robar en su casa y se llevaron toda la mercancía que ella y su familia tenían como inversión de mucho trabajo, al igual que algunas cosas que tenían como patrimonio, dejándolos en la total ruina ella con lagrimas nos narraba su desesperante situación y su tristeza e impotencia no las podía ocultar ante los demás.
Rosa Elia  se integró un grupo de crédito por la gran necesidad de empezar desde cero su negocio ya que su inversión de toda la vida se la arrebataron en unos cuantos minutos, ella va a comprar sus productos que tradicionalmente vende que son paletas de caramelo macizo de diferentes sabores, paletas de cajeta, goma de mascar, frituras de harina de maíz, pulpas de tamarindo, paletas de tamarindo, dulces de menta, palanquetas de cacahuate, cacahuates tostados, maíz para palomitas, salsa de chile para jícamas y gelatinas.
Rosa tiene la gran esperanza de reponerse muy pronto a la perdida de de su patrimonio al igual que recuperar la inversión de la familia, ella desea tener una casa digna donde vivir y que su negocio no tenga que pasar por lo mismo otra vez, ella sueña con ver a su hijo salir adelante y ser una persona de bien y de trabajo , le gustaría darle mas estudios a su niño en un futuro y que pueda hacer crecer su negocio, o incluso empezar otro mas, lo mas anhelado es que su familia salga adelante que no tengan carencias como las de hoy y que sus padres puedan descansar sin la necesidad de salir a la calle a trabajar.
Las integran al grupo “Álvaro Carrillo”  son mujeres sencillas, que su único deseo es  salir adelante cambiar su calidad de vida, ellas creen en los sueños, en las ilusiones de tener un mundo mejor donde no haya tanta pobreza y desigualdad.
Rosa Elia llorando de alegría a la vez de tristeza nos regala una sonrisa sin ocultar su pena, su sonrisa es el mejor agradecimiento que nos puede brindar, le agradece enteramente a fundación realidad y a los que apoyan a kiva por ser tan generosos.
 Estos son los nombres de las mujeres que integran al grupo “Álvaro Carrillo” y su actividad  de cada una de ellas.  

Feliza Antonia  Miguel. – Venta de quesos
Antonia Florencia López Martínez.- Venta de perfumes
Epifania S. Peláez.- tienda de ropa
Griselda Guadalupe González Hernández.- Venta de agua purificada
Alicia B. H..- Venta de refrescos
Pula Zacarías R..- Carpintería
Catalina C. López.- Estética
Martha patricia Barragán R..- Taller de serigrafía
Antonia C. Sánchez.- Venta de dulces
Rosa Elia Jiménez C..- Venta de dulces
Minerva C. R..- Venta de antojitos	
Juana Marisol Jiménez R..- Venta de perfume
texts.en:
The name of the following group, “Álvaro Carrillo”, is in honor of the street where the group is located and also in honor of the illustrious Mexican composer, originally from the coast of Pinotepa Nacional.  The group is composed of 12 people, all women. The woman who leads this group is Antonia Florencia López Martínez.  All of the women have different activities with which they support their families.

We will tell the story of one member of the group, named Rosa Elia Jiménez C.. 31 years old, she is a single mother and has a 4-year-old son named Jared who is in kindergarten.  Rosa Elia dedicates herself to the sale of candy as a street vendor in different parts of the city, such as the central park, outside of public schools and at various intersections.  Rosa did not have formal schooling after having completed 4th grade, she comes from a humble family and lives in a small house made of laminated cardboard, wood, and concrete.  She has 4 sisters and her father is engaged in making and selling flavored ice, while her mother of 60 years also sells sweets.

One of the most difficult situations facing Rosa is the total loss of her inventory: she tells us a few days ago her house was robbed and they took all of her merchandise that she and her family worked so hard for, as well as some of their other investments, leaving them totally ruined.  She described her desperate situation with tears of sadness and frustration that she could not hide.

Rosa Elia joined a credit group out of the extreme necessity to restart her business from scratch after her life savings were stolen in a few minutes.  She will use the loan to purchase the products that she has traditionally sold: hard candy in different flavors, popsicles, caramels, candy made from cajeta syrup, chewing gum, cornmeal fritters, tamarind pulp and candies, mints, peanut brittle, roasted peanuts, popcorn, chile sauce for jicama, and jellies.

Rosa has great hope that she will bounce back very soon and that she will also be able to recuperate her family losses.  She wants to have a dignified house and not to have her business go through that again.  She dreams of seeing her son succeed one day and become a good person who works at a good job.  She would like to give him more schooling in the future and grow the business, or even create another one.  The most important thing for her family going forward is that they do not have gaps in income as today, and that her parents will be able to retire without having to work in the streets.

The members of the “Álvaro Carrillo” group are simple women, whose only desire is to improve their quality of life; they believe in their dreams, in the vision of a better world where there is not so much poverty and insecurity.

Rosa Elia, crying in happiness and sadness at the same time, smiles at us without hiding her pain.  Her smile is the best form gratitude we can provide, thank you to Fundacion Realidad and to those who support Kiva for being so generous.

These are the names of the woman who make up the “Álvaro Carrillo” group and each of their businesses:

Feliza Antonia Miguel – Cheese sales
Antonia Florencia López Martínez – Perfume sales
Epifania S. Peláez – Clothing store
Griselda Guadalupe González Hernández – Purified water sales
Alicia B. H. – Refreshments sales
Pula Zacarías R. – Carpenter
Catalina C. López – Cosmetics
Martha Patricia Barragán R. – Silkscreen workshop
Antonia C. Sánchez – Sweets sales
Rosa Elia Jiménez C. – Sweets sales
Minerva C. R. – Snacks sales	
Juana Marisol Jiménez R. – Perfume sales

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase the products that she has traditionally sold: hard candy in different flavors, popsicles, caramels, candy made from cajeta syrup, chewing gum, cornmeal fritters, tamarind pulp and candies, mints, peanut brittle, roasted peanuts, popcorn, chile sauce for jicama, and jellies.

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
Ten members living in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province are forming this village loan.  They have selected Mrs. Phon K., 55 years old, as the village bank president. The members of this village loan will use their portions of the loan to suppO. their different purposes.

Mrs. Phon K. and her husband, Mr. Yorn Syna, are farmers who own 3.50-hectares of land which they use to cultivate rice and corn for a living. They don't have enough money to grow their crops, so Mrs. Phon K. would like to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, rice seeds and corn seeds to grow crops. 

This farming couple work very hard to suppO. their four children: two are laborers and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, rice seeds and corn seeds

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene 37 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y que disfruta de su actividad como es la elaboración y venta de pan. Sus inicios se dan hace mas de 20 años y fue por su Madre, quien todavía le ayuda en el negocio para la elaboración de sus deliciosos panes. Ella es muy reconocida en su cuadra por ofrecer muy buenos servicios y excelente calidad. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de queso, mantequilla, huevo, harina entre otras cosas. Desea establecerse en un lugar que sea propio.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 37 years old and is a hard-working woman who enjoys making and selling bread.  She started this work over 20 years ago because of her mother who helps her with the business baking delicious bread.

She is well-known on her block because of her good service and excellent quality.  She needs the loan to buy cheese, butter, eggs, and flour, among other things.  One day she hopes to be able to buy her own place for the business.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La Srta. Felicidad vive en la casa de su madre en la  zona de villa obrajes, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de la localidad es joven independiente, soltera es su propio puesto de venta en el mercado, el préstamo lo invertirá para aumentar mercadería comprando verduras por cantidad, es una joven muy trabajadora, ayuda a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, uno de sus deseos es el de continuar sus estudios y poder salir adelante mejorando su calidad de vida de ella y de  toda su familia, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Felicidad lives in the house belonging to her mother, located in the community of Villa Obrajes.  She sells vegetables in the neighborhood market. She is an independent single woman with her own stand in the market. She will use her loan to increase her merchandise with the purchase of vegetables in large quantities. One of her dreams it to continue with her studies in order to improve the quality of her life and that of her entire family. She is thankful to the organization for the support they provide.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, onions and tomatoes by the box.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom go to school. Eseza also takes care of orphans and her mother. She lives in a rented home that has electricity but no running water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

Eseza runs a salon and cosmetics business. She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days out of every week. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Eseza has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Karem Maria

texts.es: La Señora Karem Maria tiene 24 años. Es una joven muy luchadora y tiene un espíritu muy alegre. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella es quien se hace cargo de ofrecerle a su familia lo necesario para su hogar y con la ayuda de la familia logro salir adelante con este pequeño negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, detergente, jabón y golosinas en general. Su deseo es seguir apoyando a sus hijos, ya que ella es madre y padre al mismo tiempo.
texts.en:
Sra. Karem Maria is 24 years old. This young woman is a fighter and has a cheerful spirit. She has managed a store for more than three years. Karem is responsible for providing for her family’s household needs and helping them move forward through her small business.

The loan she requested will be used as operating capital to purchase basic grains, detergents, soaps, and candy. Her wish is to continue supporting her children because she must play the role of both mother and father.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy basic grains, detergents, soaps, and candy

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
Riffat is a resident of Khanewal which is a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. Her house is located in the area of Shanti Nagar where she has been living with her family in a 3-room brick house for more than 10 years. 

Her husband has some cattle at home which he sells, after raising them, for profit. He also sells their milk to the community. He is very good with his customers and offers them good quality milk at reasonable prices. 

Riffat is a very skillful seamstress. She can sew designer and non-designer dresses very easily. She sews for her neighboring clients. She is also a very good housewife and carries out her household responsibilities very well. She has given birth to two sons. Both of them are below 10 years of age and don’t go to school because Riffat is not able to afford their education expenses now.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will utilize the loan in buying buffalo and goats to raise for selling. He has been operating this business for the past eight years and Riffat is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to him. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she proved herself a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Riffat.

loans.use: To buy buffalo and goats to resell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 39 años de edad. Actualmente, Juan vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco Perú) junto con su pareja y sus seis hijos, él es un padre responsable que dedica a la construcción civil, él es albañil y tiene doce años trabajando en la construcción. En esta oportunidad Juan requiere el préstamo para aumentar el dinero para comprar unas herramientas. 

Juan es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Juan was born in the city of Cusco and he is 39 years old. Juan currently lives in the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Peru) with his partner and their six children. He is a responsible father who works in civil construction. He is a mason and has 12 years of experience working in construction. Juan now needs a loan to increase his funds to buy some tools.

Juan is a responsible individual who belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Ana Jarvis III" communal bank in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Las Pagadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Pagadoras lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de la capital de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Johana Núñez M. de 27 años quien es estilista desde hace 4 años. Ella aprendió este oficio con su cuñada la cual tiene un salón y luego se independizo realizando trabajos a domicilio. 

Ella invertirá el crédito en su negocio con el fin de seguir creciendo con ese fin comprara cosméticos, exfoliantes, gel refrescante, pinturas, tintes etc.

Las otras integrantes son Adela Dolores quien vende cosméticos y perfumes actividad en la que invertirá el crédito y Jaqueline del Socorro Anduraly quien comercializa repostería.
texts.en: The Las Pagadoras group is made up of three hardworking and entrepreneurial women from the capital, Managua.  The group coordinator is Johana Núñez M., age 27, who has been a stylist for 4 years.  She learned this trade with her sister-in-law who has a salon, and then she started working independently at her customers' homes.   She will use this loan to continue growing her business.  She will purchase cosmetics, exfoliator, refreshing gel, makeup, etc. The other members of the group are Adela Dolores, who sells cosmetics and perfumes, fore which she will use this loan, and Jaqueline del Socorro Anduraly who sells pastries.

loans.use: to puchase cosmetics, exfoliator, refreshing gel, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Duo Esther Group

texts.es: Duo Esther: este grupo esta conformado por dos señoras las cales se dedican a la elavoracion y venta D. guipiles, Doña Rosa A. quien es la lider D. este duo tiene 34 años tiene 4 hijos es casada ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa tipica,desD. hace barios años en el mercado D. su comunidad ellas nos cuentan que nececitan el credito para la compra D. materia prima ya que en esta epoca sus clentes les hacen barios pedidos ella espera que fape les pueda dar el apoyo que ellas nececitan para agradar mas su venta,el sueño D. ellas es tener un local propio y poder darles educacion a sus hijos para que en un futuro sean unos profecionales.
texts.en: Duo Esther:  This group is composed of two women who are dedicated to making and selling guipiles, a colorful traditional Mayan style of tunic.  Doña Rosa A., who is the leader of the group, is 34 years of age.  She has 4 children and is married.  She has been dedicated to the sale of traditional clothing in the market of her community for several years.  They tell us that they need a loan to buy raw materials, since at this time their clients place various orders. They hope that Fape can give them the support that they need to grow their sales.  Their dream is to have their own sales location and to be able to give their children an education so that in the future they can be professionals.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make guipiles  (colorful, traditional Mayan tunics).

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, capital de Nicaragua el señor Walter trabaja en su centro de labores con el fin de ver cumplida su meta de tener un techo digno donde habitar en conjunto con su familia. Él es un caballero muy esforzado quien ha logrado salir adelante en su desarrollo familiar gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos.

Actualmente está solicitándo un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción como arena, bloque y cemento para construir un cuarto en su casa y así beneficiar a su familia. Está muy optimista esperando que su crédito le sea otorgado para llevar a cabo esta obra. El cuarto le permitirá tener mejores condiciones de seguridad en su casa y así proteger a su familia del invierno. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado para iniciar dicha obra.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, Walter works with the aim of supplying his home and his family with a decent roof. He is a very hard working gentleman who has managed to get ahead and help his family develop thanks to his multiple efforts. 

Currently he is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as sand, concrete blocks and cement to build a room in his house and thus benefit his family. He is very optimistic that this loan will enable him to complete the task. The room will make for better and more secure living conditions and protect his family from winter. He hopes that his loan is approved in order to start the job.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old. Mary Rose is single. To make a living, Mary Rose owns & operates a business planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables to sell. Mary Rose has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mary Rose joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Mary Rose from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
