GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en: Bayram is from Internally Displaced People Settlement in Bilasuvar city. Currently, he dedicates himself to his sheep-breeding business, a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the region. He is going to be a father soon. It’s important to note that Bayram is very conscious of his duty to support his family financially. For this reason, he turned to AqroInvest Credit Union to obtain a loan to purchase more sheep to help him increase his income. With your help, Bayram will be able to make his business succeed and support his family.

loans.use: purchase 5 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz is a hardworking man. He is married and the father of three daughters. He sells household goods such as flashlights, batteries, chargers, toys, office supplies and some food products. Ramiz tries to improve his living condition and expand his business. Ramiz would like to increase his profit and increase the assortment of his goods. He is requesting a loan of 1,200 AZN to purchase an assortment of new goods in order to increase the quantity of his products. Ramiz is taking loan from AqroInvest second time and promises to repay it accurately and on time as he did with the first loan.

loans.use: to purchase more new goods for his store

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario tiene 57 años es un prospero trabajador tiene un taller de planchado y pintura “MAC”  que son las iniciales de su nombre,  el taller lo tiene en su misma casa  esto  le permite no ausentarse y estar con su familia por mucho tiempo el Sr., Mario trabajo para otras personas pero decidió abrirse solo y no se equivoco a pesar que al inicio fue difícil logro consolidarse y  tener mucha clientela, sus clientes confían en el su trabajo le ha permitido velar por su familia , en la actualidad esta por iniciar un nuevo negocio en el rubro de comidas para esto esta ambientando un lugar en su casa para poner su restaurante con su préstamo comprara los  utensilios de cocina y otros enseres en el mes de agosto estará inaugurando su local, sabe que le ira bien por ser un lugar estratégico donde hay mucha fluidez de publico, actualmente es presidente del grupo “MUJERES VIRTUOSAS”  que esta formado por  07 socios.

  * El Sr. Mario esta sentado el ultimo de la derecha.
texts.en:
Mario is 57 years old.  He is a prosperous worker who owns a panel beating and painting workshop called "MAC" (which are the initials of his name).  His workshop is located in his home which allows him to spend a lot of time with his family.  For a long time, Mario worked for other people.  However, he decided to open his own business and this turned out to be a good decision, in spite of the fact that it was difficult at first to consolidate his business and gain a lot of customers.

Mario's customers trust his work and, through his work, he has been able to look after his family.  He is currently about to start a new business preparing food.  He has set up a restaurant in his home and he will use his loan to buy cooking utensils and other equipment.  He will open his new business in the month of August.  He knows that his business will do well because it is located in a strategic position where there are a lot of passersby.

Mario is currently the president of the 'Mujeres Virtuosas' (Virtuous Women) group which has seven members.

* Mario is the man who is sitting on the far right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and equipment

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús es un padre de familia de 45 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mochumí, la cual pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadería.

Jesús desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada,  pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar.

Ha solicitado Jesús un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar aves de corral y su respectivo alimento para seguir engordando a sus animales para ofertarlos a sus clientes, con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Jesús es una persona trabajadora, responsable y con muchas ganas de que su familia se siga superando.
texts.en:
Jesús, 45, is a father living with his wife and children in his own house that only has electricity and is located in a rural part of Mochumí District which belongs to Lambayeque Department.  This zone is noted for farming and for raising livestock.

For several years now Jesús has been raising sheep to sell in a corral in his back yard that’s spacious and apt for this.  He feeds them nutritionally balanced feed, grasses and natural grains so that his animals will reach optimal growth to be sold in the various local markets and to obtain good profits to cover his household's daily  expenses.

Jesús has requested a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy barnyard fowl and their respective feed to continue fattening the animals up to offer to his customers.  Income earned will be used to repay the loan and to improve his family’s quality of life.  Jesús is a hard working, responsible person with a strong desire that his family continues to make progress.

loans.use: to buy barnyard fowl and feed for them.

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio is 51 years old. He is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with 5 grown children. He lives near the sea. Most of the residents' means of livelihood is fishing and Dionesio is one of them. He has been doing this for one year now. He normally receives a monthly income of 3,000 PHP from fishing.

Earlier this year, Dionesio applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase new fishing net for his livelihood. This serves as his first loan taken out from the cooperative. With the new fishing stuff, Dionesio hopes for a good catch and to deal them at reasonable prices. He plans to improve his fishing boat using the possible revenue that he might be receiving from the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing net

loans.name: Mekdad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has two children.

Mekdad has owned a cafeteria since 2006. There he prepares all kind of drinks and foods. He has good experience in this field and has a deep understanding of the local consumer. His cafeteria is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es: La señora María Angélica cuenta su propio negocio de abarrotes desde hace 16 años, denominado “Miscelánea Águilas Aztecas” donde ofrece variedad de producto en general. Angélica demuestra a sus clientes una amabilidad al igual que buena calidad en sus productos que ofrece, lo cual le permite tener mayor número de clientes.  Por tal motivo desea comprar mercancía como lo es refrescos, lácteos, abarrotes, botanas, por que ella sabe que entre mas producto y variedad tenga sus ventas incrementan. Angélica es madre de dos pequeños los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida, el negocio y su esposo que trabaja en maquiladora es la fuente de ingresos que sustenta a la familia.
texts.en: Señora María Angélica has had her own general store for more than 16 years.  It is called, "Miscelánea Águilas Aztecas" (Aztec Eagle General Store), where she offers a variety of general merchandise.  Angélica shows her customers friendship as well as good quality in the products she offers, which lets her have a bigger number of customers.  This is why she wants to buy merchandise like soft drinks, dairy products, groceries, and snacks, because she knows that the more products and variety she has, the more her sales will increase.  Angélica is the mother of 2 small children to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life.  Her business and the money her husband earns from working in an assembly plant are the sources of income that support their family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 33 years old, married, and blessed with two children.  To earn a living, he runs a retail shop. He has operated the business for four years, with one employee.  He has retained his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.  
His desire is to open other outlets of his business in five years.  He has requested 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow and a water tank because he wants to start up dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy a cow and a water tank

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and lives with his wife, his child and one of his family members.

Haydar has owned a blacksmith workshop since 2008. He has more than three years experience in this field, and a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting an 1,800 USD loan in order to purchase an electric diesel generator for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase an electric diesel generator for his workshop

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en: Zachary has been managing a general store for the last three years to make a living. Previously, he was running a boutique. In the next 5 years, he wants to open a supermarket. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, and soap for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to boost his business with his previous loan.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, and soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy floor tiles and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, D. 57 años; es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía D. Pedro, su esposo desD. hace 35 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo cuidan D. 4 D. ellos, todos menores D. edad, juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo D. San pedro D. saño. DesD. que formó su familia, comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, todo ello para el sustento D. su familia. Como mujer del campo, se dedica a la siembra D. maíz y habas en sus propios terrenos agrícolas a diferencia D. los demás agricultores, ella centra sus ventas en diferentes zonas, cuando el precio es bueno, lo venD. en el anexo D. concepción pero si desminuye. Viaja a diferentes zonas, donD. los comerciantes D. alimentos, le paguen mayor precio por sus cosechas. Durante sus viajes, se ingenió para vender a la vez, animales menores y semillas para la germinación D. los diversos alimentos que produce la tierra, todo esto gracias a su disposición en el trabajo. Ahora espera mejorar sus cultivos, ya que observo que depenD. D. la calidad su ganancia. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “san pedro” y este es veinteavo crédito con MFP, donD. se siente contenta D.  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura D. avanzar con su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas. Elena D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. fertilizantes naturales para su próximo sembrío D. maíz.
texts.en:
Elena is 57 years old.  She is a modest woman who lives with her husband of 35 years, Pedro.  Together they have eight children, but they only take care of four of them, all of whom are minors.  They live together in their own home located in the San Pedro D. Saño District.  

Since she started her family, she began to do different kinds of work, all to support her family.  As a country woman, she plants corn and broad beans on her own farmland.  Unlike other farmers, she focuses her sales in different areas.  When the price is good, she sells in the district of Concepción, but when it goes down, she travels to different regions where the food dealers will give her a better price for her produce.  During her travels, she learned to sell young animals and seeds for the various foods the land produces, all thanks to her aptituD. for this work.  Currently, she hopes to improve her crops, as she knows that her earnings depend on their quality.  

She belongs to the San Pedro Solidarity Group and this is her twentieth loan with MFP, where she is happy to know that she has financial support as this gives her the confidence to move forward with her business.  She promises to make her payments on time.  Upon receiving your support, Elena will use the loan money to buy natural fertilizers for her next corn planting.

loans.use: to buy bags of natural fertilizers

loans.name: Naluwa S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Naluwa S.H.G in Western Kenya! Fred is the facilitator of Naluwa S.H.G. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Fred takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Fred had a good maize yield harvesting nine bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Fred was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Fred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Fred will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Naluwa S.H.G will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Don  Martin, 63 años de edad, el es originario de San Isidro municipio de Matagalpa, pero desde hace varios años el vive en León, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores de edad son independientes. El inicio con su negocio de raspados a los 31 años de edad, , con capital propio fue ahorrando de poco en poco hasta logra comprar un triciclo para vender raspados donde cada día sales a las calles de León sonando sus campanas anunciando los sabores de sus raspados ,los preferidos por sus clientes son los de coco, piña, sandia, nancite y dulce de leche regresando a las 6 y7 de la noche de vender y preparándose para la jornada del siguientes día con este humilde pero honrado negocio el ha alimentado a sus hijos antes el se dedicaba a la agricultura. El requiere el préstamo para comprar un triciclo para repartir raspados y comprar miel, leche, azúcar, vainilla, cucharas, vasos desechables que son parte de los materiales que utiliza para hacer y vender su producto. El tiene como meta lograr comprar 2 triciclos mas para vender raspados.
texts.en: Martin is 63 years old. He is originally from San Isidro, in Matagalpa, but he has lived in León for several years. He has three children who are all adults and live independently. Martin started his snow-cone business when he was 31. He used his own capital and saved up gradually so that he could buy a three-wheeled bicycle cart which he uses to sell his snow-cones. Every day, he goes out into the streets of León, ringing his bells, announcing the flavors of his snow-cones. His customers' favorite flavors are coconut, pineapple, watermelon, nancite (a fruit) and dulce de leche (caramel). He returns home at 6.00pm or 7.00pm at night and gets ready for his next day's work. With this humble but honest business, he has managed to feed his children. Before this, he used to work as a farmer. Martin needs this loan to buy a three-wheeled bicycle cart from which to sell his snow-cones. He will also buy honey, milk, sugar, vanilla, spoons and disposable cups, which are some of the materials he uses in making and selling his products. His goal is to manage to buy two further three-wheeled carts for selling snow-cones from.

loans.use: to buy a three-wheeled bicycle cart for selling snow-cones from, and to buy honey, milk, sugar, vanilla, spoons and disposable cups

loans.name: G.s. Chavarria Group

texts.es: Juana del Carmen tiene 47 años de edad, su actividad económica es una pulpería además abrió otra línea de productos en el cual le genera buenos ingresos para el negocio y la familia. Juana del Carmen tiene dos hijos en el cual está todavía a su cargo y están estudiando, ella los ha sacado con mucho esfuerzo a su familia. Lleva en el negocio 17 años de experiencia ya cuenta con clientes fijos que le encargan mercadería y los clientes eventuales, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa. El Préstamo que está solicitando Juana del Carmen es para abastecerse de productos como: granos básicos, aceite, leche, pan, además ella tiene la otra line de productos que requiere comprar como son: Zapatos, ropa, cosméticos, perfumes entre otros.
texts.en: Juana del Carmen is 47 years old. Her business is a small neighborhood store. She has also started selling another line of products, which generates a good income for her business and her family. Juana del Carmen has two children who are still in her care and in school. With great effort, she has helped her family get ahead. She has 17 years of experience with her business, and she has steady customers who order merchandise from her, as well as occasional customers. Her business is located in her home. The loan that Juana del Carmen is requesting is to stock up on products such as staple foods, cooking oil, milk and bread, and she also needs to buy products for her other line of business, such as shoes, clothing, cosmetics, and perfumes.

loans.use: to buy staple foods, cooking oil, milk, bread, and merchandise for her other line of products such as shoes, clothing, cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is from Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old and single.

To make a living, Carmela owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Carmela has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities. 

Crisanta is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. In 2009, Carmela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve/expand her piggery business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria del socorro cuenta con 19 años de edad, es soltera independiente de ella misma cuenta con negoció de ropa y cenas apenas lo inicio hace un año ella dice que esta muy contenta ya que esta saliendo adelante.

Ella invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para la elaboración de la comida como son: queso, chiles, jitomates, crema, tortillas, masa, etc. Y pues también invertirá en la ropa que vende ella espera incrementar el negocio mas porque quiere ampliar un local para allí establecerse
texts.en: María del Socorro is 19 years old, single and independent.  She has a clothing and a food business that she started a year ago.  She says that she’s very happy because she’s getting ahead.  She will use her loan to buy ingredients she uses to prepare the meals: cheese, chilies, tomatoes, cream, tortillas, dough, etc. and also to buy clothes to sell.  She hopes to increase the business because she wants to enlarge a locale to establish herself there.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cheese, chilies, tomatoes, cream, tortillas, dough, etc.

loans.name: Senia

texts.en:
Senia, 32 years of age, is married and has three children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Senia needs a loan of WST 2,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 800 WST or US $333 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Senia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Senia's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Agripina De Jesus

texts.es:
la sra. Agripina de Jesús tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada y es madre de 3 hijos los cuales estan estudiando en la escuela publica de la comunidad, Su actividad principal es el comercio y cuenta con una pulpería en su casa de habitacion, realiza esta actividad desde hace 18 meses y nos manifesto que durante todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien, junto con su esposo se apoyan para salir adelante con su familia.
su esposo se dedica a la venta de ropa en el sector de la montaña de Guanacastales y en ocaciones con su vehiculo realiza fletes a diferentes partes de su localidad.
La Sra. Agripina utilizara el credito para la compra de mercadería y así surtir su negocio para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Agripina de Jesús, 30, is married and has 3 children, 2 that are studying in the local public school.  Her main business is commerce and she has had a general store in her house for the past 18 months.  She tells us that during this period it has done very well and that she, with her husband's support, are working to get their family ahead.
Her husband sells clothing in the Montaña de Guanacastales area and sometimes he drives passengers to different parts of his town.
Agripina will use the loan to buy merchandise and thus stock her business to satisfy the requests of her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as basic grains, meats, bread, soft drinks and juices

loans.name: Mayapati Devi

texts.en:
Mayapati is 27 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of the Bara District of Nepal with her husband, Mahesh, and four children. Two of her children study in the local school. 

Mayapati and Mahesh run a small vegetable farm where they grow maize, tomatoes, and potatoes. The family has a bull-cart which they use for transportation of vegetables and fruits to nearby villages for selling. The total average monthly income of the family is 5,000 NPR.

Mayapati requested a loan for purchasing fertilizers to increase her vegetable and fruit production. After fertilization and properly done seasonal agricultural work, they hope to get a good harvest. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will be able to finance the studies of their children. Thus, they will be able to create better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 48-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with six children. Her eldest is 27 and her youngest is eight years old. 

For fourteen years now, Rubina owns a sari-sari (variety) store in her place. This business earns her an average monthly income of 2000 PHP. Her husband works as a driver and does not earn much either. 

She is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, chips, candy, cooking oil, sugar and coffee. In the future, she hopes to continue expanding her business so she can support her family and increase business profitability.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, chips, candy, cooking oil, sugar and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Guigo We Na Mahu Group

texts.fr: GUIGO WE NA MAHU est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même zone. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mèdonvè Séverine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 34 ans. Mèdonvè Séverine est mariée à un plombier du nom de Félicien. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Mèdonvè Séverine et son mari. Pour cette raison, Mèdonvè Séverine vend du maïs à son domicile depuis une quinzaine d'année. Parallèlement à son activité, Mèdonvè Séverine également du pain ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Mèdonvè Séverine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Mèdonvè Séverine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe GUIGO WE NA MAHU, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et du pain.

loans.name: Ubumwe Cb Kivuye Group

texts.en:
Lydie is a group leader, aged 38.She is married with 4 children aged between 19 and 4 years; all of them go to school. The group is called UBUMWE, which means “unity” in English. 

Lydie has a shop, and has been in selling business for the past four years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more biscuits, soap, sugar and salt for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits, soap, sugar and salt

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
Don José Santos tiene la edad de 42 años, creció en el Municipio del Rama donde formó su familia, su esposa es ama de casa, él no tuvo educación profesional pero su trabajo como Vendedor de Textil y Zapatos que tiene establecido le permite darle educación a sus hijos y mantener su familia, sus dos hijos mayores son independientes y el menor estudia en Secundaria en tiempos libre ayuda a su papá con el Negocio siendo muy concurrido por la ubicación geográfica.  Con la esperanza de hacer crecer su Negocio e introducir nueva mercadería como sombreros, gorras, lentes de sol, sombrillas y otros; aprovechando la época de Verano y estar activo dentro del mercado Don José Santos  se presenta a Afodenic para solicitar este crédito a Kiva que aplicara en Capital de Trabajo comprando Ropa, Calzado y otros artículos que vende en el Tramo ubicado en el Municipio del Rama donde la demanda crece a diario y necesita abastecer la demanda.

La mayor dificultad que enfrentar en su negocio es cuando las ventas se bajan por las temporadas esto suele suceder en todo negocio hay temporadas bajas y temporadas altas ya sea por el cambio climático, alzas en la canasta Básica u otros factores por ejemplo la salud entre otros factores que siempre hay que dar una solución.

Su meta principal es mantenerse en el Mercado y que su negocio aumente, darle mayor educación a su Hijo y así gocen de mejores Beneficios laborales y Sociales.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo, comprar Camiseta, Blusas, Pantalones y Calzado con el fin de aumentar su capital de trabajo y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.name: Perihan

texts.en:
Perihan is divorced and has three children.  In order to make a contribution to the family budget and provide her children's school needs she is making trousseau and selling them from home or on the stands.  With the help of the loans she bought bulks of threads and fabrics, made her trousseau, sold them, made money and developed her business.  With the help of her fourth loan she will buy bulks of fabrics and threads and continue producing.  

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Perihan hanım üç çocuk annesi eşinden ayrıldıktan sonra aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamak hem de çocukların okul masraflarını karşılamak için evden ve stantlardan yaptığı çeyiz işlerini satıyor.  Kullandığı mikro kredi ile çeyiz malzemesi ip kumaş alarak ve üreterek satarak para kazandı ve işlerini geliştirdi.  Dördüncü mikro kredi ile kumaş ve ip alarak üretimine devam edecek.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Alfredo. I have a local public taxi that I have been operating for several years and which generates enough income to cover my family expenses. With this business I have given my children an education and improved my home. I now need to do some repairs on my vehicle and I do not have the finances to pay for them so I am requesting your support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

Hola mi nombre es Alfredo, cuento con una unidad de Taxi (transporte de pasajeros en mi ciudad) actividad que realizo desde hace varios años y me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares, con esta unidad he dado a mis hijos educación, tambiem he mejorado mi vivienda. Actuamente necesito hacele unas reparaciones al automovil y no cuento con el capital por lo que solicito su apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase automotive parts.

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en:
Rafik is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. He has had this business for 2 years. He enjoys looking after calves. 
Having borrowed $600 he bought 3 calves. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a cow.
He is 54 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in Fizuli region Kayidish village. He is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: LAPO has blessed me and my family says Mrs. Comfort  Udebulu. A 64 years woman with nine (9) children, specializes in the sale of bags of cement to the public. She started her business 6 years ago. According to her she needs the above amount for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement for sale

loans.name: Angela Gabriela

texts.en:
Angela is a 43 year-old mother of three. She has two boys Jhohan and Harold and a 6 year-old daughter, Marycruz. She rents a post in a very busy part of town where she has set up a repair shop for bicycles and tricycles, which are some of the most used means of transportation amongst the city's population. She employs her two sons and a nephew who have helped her out for several years. Even though she sometimes does minor tasks such as fixing chains or a flat tire, she spends most of her time administering her business and selling spare parts.

With her $275 loan, Angela will be able to purchase more spare parts which she can sell at her shop. In the future she hopes to save enough money and have enough capital to change businesses to some other commercial activity because her current business is quite wearing on her physically. She is also sure that sometime in the future her sons will move on to their own businesses leaving her without knowledgeable repairers.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of spare parts.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Madam Eliana as she is vary caringly called by her clients is the mother of 2 children, one 18 and the other 12 years old. Her husband decided to leaver them more than 10 years ago, and he left them without any economic protection. However, this fact did not become a motive for Eliana to cave in emotionally and spiritually. A little while after she decided to dedicate her self, in an ambulatory way, to selling chicharrones; a specialty that she shared and learned when she was very little in her mother’s company.

In the little bit of mobility that she adapted with the help of her children, this activity can take shape if she can resolve the most urgent expenses of her family.

Due to the large demand of her typical dishes she hopes to open a restaurant and sell chicharrones, which will offer better and more comfortable service to the population, and increase the quantity of clients. All this would allow her to generate a larger economic income for her family, with the aim to elevate their quality of life and education. In order to carry this out she is proposing to solicit a loan of $425, money that will be invested in the opening of her own business. She promises to return the money over a 6 month period of time. With your help Eliana will be able to open her restaurant, and turn her wishes in to reality.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Eliana como la suelen llamar cariñosamente sus clientes, es madre de 2 hijos, uno de 18 y otro de 12 años de edad, su esposo decidió marcharse hace más de 10 años y los dejó sin ningún amparo económico, sin embargo este hecho no fue motivo para que Eliana se derrumbara espiritual y anímicamente y poco tiempo después decidió dedicarse en forma ambulatoria a la venta de chicharrones; especialidad que compartió y aprendió desde muy pequeña en compañía de su madre.

En una pequeña movilidad que adecuó con ayuda de sus hijos realiza esta actividad con el que puede solventar los gastos más urgentes de su familia.

Debido a la gran demanda de sus asiduos comensales desea abrir un restaurante de venta de chicharrones en el que podrá brindar un mejor y cómodo servicio a la población e incrementará la cantidad de clientes con el que podrá generar mayores ingresos económicos para su familia con el fin de elevar su calidad de vida y educación.

Para llevar a cabo este propósito solicita un préstamo de 425 dólares dinero que invertirá en la apertura de su prospero negocio con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses.Con tu apoyo Eliana podrá abrir su tan anhelado restaurante y podrá convertir sus deseos en realidad.

loans.use: Would like a loand so that she can open a lacation and offer a better service to her clients.

loans.name: Aboh Richmond

texts.en: Aboh Richmond K. is 34 years old.  He lives with his cohabitant and their child, who is in primary school. Aboh is a dynamic dressmaker who has been in the tailoring business for more than 15 years. He lives with his family in Attecoube, a populated township in North-West Abidjan. Aboh wants to buy new sewing equipment for his shop in order to attract new customers. He is an excellent performer who has benefitted from several loans from AE&I and has repaid them without any problem. The new equipment will improve Aboh's performance and expand his business.

loans.use: Aboh Richmond Koffi will use the loan to purchase a new electric sewing machine

loans.name: Kuruthum

texts.en:
Since 2005, Kuruthum B. has run a general store in the rural town of Kibamba, where she sells food and items people use in their homes such as cookware. She has requested a loan of $450 to buy, in bulk, additional items she can sell in her store. Kuruthum is a single mother with two children, Zainabu, 16 and Salma, 14, and is also responsible for the care of her nephew Nicksoni, 9. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not credit-worthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback". SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases beck the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase in bulk additional stocks of food and other items to sell.

loans.name: Osatohanmwen

texts.en: "The sale of kitchen utensils is a lucrative trade for me," says Mrs. Osatohanmwen A.. She is married with 8 children, and is 40 years old. She has been a LAPO member for 4 years. She is from Edo State. She needs the loan of $375 to enable her buy more kitchen utensils to sell. She has been in the business since 1999.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils

loans.name: Sabur

texts.en:
U. Sabur is 56 years old. He is married and his two grown-up sons help him in his business.

Sabur runs a private shop manufacturing wooden doors, window frames and also certain items of furniture. He is in this business for 20 years and his two sons are also involved in the business. Through his years of work Sabur has obtained the reputation of the best carpenter in his neighborhood, so the family business is quite stable generating the main income and allowing Sabur to support his family. 

Now Sabur is planning to repair his shop, thus improving the working conditions. He also shall purchase lumber. For this purpose he requests 3460.00 Somoni (1000.00 US dollars) for the term of 12 months. As this is his first loan, Sabur thanks all for the trust in him and his business.

loans.use: Improving the conditions of the shop and purchasing materials like lumber.

loans.name: Uche

texts.en:
Uche E. is married with 4 children. She is 39 years old. She is from the eastern part of Nigeria but resides in Benin City in Edo State, Nigeria.

Uche sells used clothes to earn a living. She learnt her trade over a six month period. She has been in business since 2004. She needs the loan of $350 to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Santos Vidal

texts.es:
Mr. Santos is very well-respected in his place of employment at the Ministry of Education, where he has worked for many years as a security guard. His wife is a merchant, and they have three grown children.

One of Mr. Santos’ wishes is to finish building his home, so he and his family can live there with the dignity merited by all the family’s hard work.

He is seeking this loan to replace his roof, to ensure that during the coming winter season they will be without leaks and moisture within the house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Santos es una persona muy respetada en su lugar de trabajo, lleva muchos años trabajando en el Ministerio de Educación como guarda de seguridad. Su esposa es comerciante y tienen 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad. Uno de los anhelos de don Santos es terminar de construir su casa de habitación, para que él y su familia puedan tener una vivienda digna, merecedora de todo el esfuerzo del trabajo de su familia. Este préstamos lo está solicitando para cambiar el techo de su casa y de esa manera asegurarse que en el invierno inmediato no tendrán problemas de goteras, ni humedad en su casa.

loans.use: Replace the roof of his house.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is very enterprising and has always sought for the best ways to improve the well-being of her beloved family. Since some time, she has been using the small income she has to buy firewood. She stores it in her house and later on sells it to her neighbours. She started this business because she got a little baby and wanted to give him attention spending most of her time with him.

Over time, she has increased her income through the sales of the firewood.

In order to improve her business, and in order to make sure that this vital heating source is adequately stored, she has in mind to set up a dedicated storage space.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria, es emprendedora y siempre ha estado en búsqueda de las mejores oportunidades para generar mayor bienestar a su amada familia.

Hace poco se dedica a la venta de leña porque llegó a albergar a su pequeño bebé y requería de mayor tiempo y atención para lo cual el pequeño capital del que disponía fue destinado para comprar leña al por mayor y lo almacena en su casa para luego venderlo poco a poco a sus vecinos, con el tiempo ha visto mejorar sus ingresos.

Desea seguir con su labor y para evitar el deterioro de este indispensable conductor de calor tiene en mente adecuar un espacio de almacenamiento.

loans.use: Set-up of a storage space

loans.name: Donia

texts.es:
Donia, is a person who knows how to value the work of her farm animals, with their immense strength they are able to help prepare the land for the cultivation of her products, for that reason she cares for them very much. Recently she began to implement a small grocery shop in her home and has realized the great value of this store to her neighbors and it has become a suitable space to make daily purchases near home. Before her shop neighbors had to walk long hours to get what was necessary. Donia wishes to improve her space and provide a greater quantity of goods.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Donia, es una de las personas que sabe valorar el trabajo de sus animalitos, debido a que estos con la inmensa fuerza que poseen la ayudan a preparar la tierra para el cultivo de sus productos por esa razón los cuida y engríe siempre. De manera adicional hace poco a empezado a implementar una pequeña tiendita de comestibles en su hogar y se ha dado cuenta de la gran utilidad de esta para sus vecinos ya que se ha convertido en un espacio adecuado y cercano para realizar las compras diarias ya que antes tenían que caminar por largas horas para obtener lo necesario. El deseo de Donia es mejorar mucho más su espacio y ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos.

loans.use: Injection of capital to meet production demands from her neighbors and friends.

loans.name: Shilpa

texts.en:
Mrs. Shilpa M. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Thecho. She opened her shop a few years ago to improve the living standard of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods like rice, bitten rice, maize, and snacks in her shop. Due to the economical condition of her family she cannot invest funds, so she is unable to fulfill the demands of her customers So Mrs. M. is requesting a Rs 20,000 ($300) loan to buy different varieties of grocery items for her shop.
Mrs. M. lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband's name is Mr. Sum Nath M. and he makes handicraft goods.  Both of her sons are studying in boarding school.
Mrs. M. would like to use her income to provide a better education for her children and help her husband in fulfilling household expenses.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma baji is the widow of F. H., and she has been living with her family in the city of Riwind, Pakistan for the last 25 years. She is the mother of three sons, all of whom work in a factory. Salma baji is a housewife, though she also runs a dairy business which she has operated for 20 years. Interestingly, Salma baji does not let her children realize that their father passed away. She has a dream to see her children in good professions.

Notably, Salma baji successfully repaid three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Currently, she is applying for another loan in order to buy a buffalo for her milk business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her dairy business by purchasing a buffalo

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
This is the second loan of Mrs Va L. to improve her business activities. She is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. During rainy season, she cultivates rice while she grows vegetables in the dry season. Since it is now the rainy season, Mrs Va L. wants to cultivate rice, so she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer to work on her farm. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more fertilizers to support her fields to produce a better crop.

Mrs Va L.'s husband, Mr Khut Nget, assists his wife on the plantation. Mrs Va L. is 52 years old and the mother of three children who are all employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To hire a laborer and to buy more fertilizers.

loans.name: Danga

texts.fr:
Née le 31 décembre 1963 à Tchitchao dans la région de la Kara, dame E. Danga est mariée  et mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Elle a pour activité la vente du bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois dans le quartier d’Agoè  à Lomé. Elle est une femme battante et n’aime jamais que ses enfants soient renvoyés à l’école faute du paiement d’écolage. 
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit au près de WAGES pour acheter 28 sacs de charbon de bois et 2 fagots de bois de chauffe afin de pouvoir bien vendre et aider son mari dans le paiement des frais scolaires de ses enfants
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1963 in Tchitchao in the Kara region, Mrs. Danga E. is married and mother to five children who all attend school. She has a business selling firewood and charcoal in the Agoè district of Lomé. Mrs. E. is a woman who fights for what she needs, and she never likes to see her children sent home from school because the fees have not been paid.

She is requesting this first loan through Kiva Field Partner, WAGES, to buy 28 sacks of charcoal and two bundles of firewood in order to sell them and thus help her husband with the payment of their children’s school fees.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Som-Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Som-ol C., 61, and her husband, Mr. Chheng Pong, 59, who live on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married for over 30 years and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Their daughter is married and lives outside the family home while two sons study in the local school and the other is a farmer and silk weaver.

Som-ol has been a weaver for almost 40 years, having learned the skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Her husband, a rice farmer since 1960, also raises cows. Som-ol is now requesting a loan of $250 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay the fee for rice planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for growing rice.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
La señora Rogelia es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella se dedica a la confección de ropas y además posee una librería todo en su propia casa. Rogelia cuenta que aprendió el oficio de la costura de su madre y gracias a la ganancias que le ha dejado este trabajo ella pudo montar su librería.

Ambos negocios son atendidos por ella misma, dice que esto le ha ayudado a sustentar su familia pues la situación económica del país no ha sido del todo buena. 

Ella ya ha solicitado créditos a la Fundación Paraguaya con anterioridad y en esta ocasión ella solicita una nueva para poder comprar telas e hilos pues ha tenido una gran cantidad de pedidos de confección para estas fiestas de fin de año. Al igual desea comprar algunos artículos de decoración navideña para vender en su librería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rogelia is a very hardworking woman. She makes clothing and also has a school supplies store in her house. Rogelia says that she learned the trade of sewing from her mother and thanks to the earnings that this work has produced she was able to start up her school supplies store. She takes care of both businesses herself. She says that this has helped her support her family, since the economic situation of the country has not been all good. She has already requested loans from Fundacion Paraguaya previously, and on this occasion she requests a new one to be able to buy fabric and thread, since she has had a large quantity of orders for tailoring for all the end of year parties. At the same time, she would like to buy some Christmas decoration items to sell in her school supplies store.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and other accessories for sewing

loans.name: Y

texts.en: Mrs. Y L. is 53 years old and she now lives in Tuol Kvav village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Arm Boeun, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. They now face an obstacle because they do not enough money to hire laborers to collect their’ products. Thus, Mrs. Y L. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She has three children, two of whom help their parents while the remaining one is a beautician. Her husband is also presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To hire laborers to collect their products.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Don Agustin es casado, de 48 años de edd, con 6 años de servicio en la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa como vigilante, su esposa no trabaja fuera de su casa, lava y plancha durante la semana, con el dinero que gana lo utilizan para los gastos de la casa y el salario de el es utilizado para pagar sus creditos y hacer fretne a cualquier imprevisto, sus hijos son adultos y no estan bajo su reponsabilidad solo una hoven quien esta estudiando la secundaria. Este cliente esta solicitando su 2do credito que sera utilizado para construir un baño y los servicios higienicos dentro de su casa con la intencion de brindar seguridad a su familia para no tener que salir al patio, ya que ellas en algunos dias quedan solas por la noche cuando el esta cumpliendo con su trabajo el que lo desarrolla unos dias de dia y otros por la noche.  Su primer credito tambien lo utilizo para mejorar su vivenda, ya que platea que es dificil juntar una cantidad para invertirlo en su casa, que con el credito esta consiente que cada mes despues del pago tiene que pagar la cuota que ya esta establecida.
texts.en:
Mr. Agustin is married and is 48 years old. He has worked in the Alcaldia Muncipal of Juigalpa as a guard for 6 years. His wife doesn’t work outside the house. She washes and irons during the week. She uses the money she earns for the expenses, and his salary is used to pay his loans and to fund unexpected expenses. Their children are adults and aren’t under their responsibility. They have only one child who is in secondary school. This client is requesting his second loan, which will be used to build a bathroom and sanitary services inside her house with the intention of offering security to his family so that they won’t have to go out to the patio. This is important because the women are sometimes in the house alone at night when he is working. Some days, he works during the days and other days during the nights. His first loan was used to improve his home, since it is difficult to put together enough money to buy foundation slabs. With the loan, he agrees that each month, after the payment, he has to pay the installment that is already established.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom and sanitary services

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura comenzó a trabajar en una tienda propia, estuvo muchos años pero no fue si no hasta que cayó enferma que lo abandono. Luego de ello emprendió un nuevo negocio cojo vendedora de libros en el centro de la capital. No tenía capital para comprar un puesto o alquilar, es por eso que se desenvolvió  como ambulante todo el tiempo que estuvo en este negocio, que fue cinco años.

Aunque no le fue mal vendiendo libros, opto por abrir un negocio que le permitiera estar más cerca de sus tres hijos con el fin de supervisarlos mejor en sus estudios. Hace año y medio que se dedica a cocinar y atender en su restaurante, abierto desde las 10am hasta después del almuerzo. Más adelante le gustaría construir un segundo piso en su casa para alquilar cuartos y agradar el local que usa para el restaurante con la idea de no solo vender comida si no también de abrir un deposito de cerveza.
texts.en:
Rosaura began working in her own store. She had it for several years but abandoned it when she fell ill. Later she started a new business as a bookseller in the center of the capital city. She did not have the financial capital to buy a market stall or to rent one, so she worked as a street seller the entire time she was in that business, which was five years. Although it wasn’t bad selling books, she decided to open a business that would allow her to be closer to her three children so that she could better supervise their studies. For the past year-and-a-half she has been cooking and tending to customers in her restaurant, which is open from 10:00am until after lunch. Eventually, she would like to build a second floor in her house for the purpose of renting rooms, and to expand the space she uses for her restaurant with the idea of not only selling food, but also to include beer sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, other restaurant ingredients

loans.name: Soa

texts.en:
Soa K., 45, is a good housewife who lives in the Siem Reap province. Her husband has worked as a housekeeper at the Grand Hotel d’angkor since 2003 and makes $140 per month. Three of their children have a business selling souvenirs and one is a student.

Soa K. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her children for commuting to work. This will cut the transport cost that is their main daily expense.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Fulgencio

texts.es:
La Señor Fulgencio O. Riveros, vive en el Barrio Pai Ñu de la Ciudad de Ñemby, posee un automóvil Marca Nizzan Bluebira que utiliza como elemento de trabajo. 

Esta acompañado hace 20 años con la señora Anatolia Baez. La Sra. Anatolia es modista y se dedica a la confección de Ropas como uniformes de oficina y vestidos de fiestas, tienen 1 hijo ya mayor.

El Señor Fulgencio O. posee una parada de Taxis ubicado San Valentin e/ Av. Avelino Martinez del Barrio Barcequillo de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, frente al Colegio Domingo Sabio, limitando con la Ciudad de Ñemby.- 

Don Fulgencio y su mujer han realizado el presente préstamos a fin de poner en condiciones su vehiculo para el comienzo de las clases., pues la época en que aumenta la cantidad de clientes en la zona.

Con el comienzo de las Clases por que las maestras son por lo general clientas seguras de su Taxi para salir a la ruta Acceso Sur.

Son pocos los transportes públicos que transitan por la Avenida Avelino Martinez.
El taxista se levanta muy temprano, va a la parada donde espera que lleguen los pasajeros en la parada., más aun en días de lluvia
texts.en:
Mr. Fulgencio O. Riveros lives in the Pai Ñu neighborhood in the city of Ñemby. He owns a car, a Nissan, that he uses for his job. He has spent the last 20 years with his wife, Anatolia Baez. Anatolia works in fashion and makes clothes like office uniforms and party dresses. They have one grown son. Fulgencio has a taxi stop located at San Valentin and Avelino Martinez Avenue in the Barcequillo neighborhood in San Lorenzo, in front of the Domingo Sabio school, near the border with Ñemby city. Fulgencio and his wife are asking for this loan in order to make repairs to his vehicle so it is ready for the beginning of classes, which is when the amount of customers increase. Teachers are some of his regular customers who need taxis along the Acceso Sur road. There are few public transportation options along Avelino Martinez Ave. Fulgencio gets up very early to go to the taxi stand and wait for his customers, especially on rainy days.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: auto repairs

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Doña Inés tiene 46 años de edad, tiene una pulpería que desde hade diesiciete años administra sus ventas la cual inicio con liquidación del trabajo anterior y ayuda de su esposo, reside en el barrio Villa Venezuela con tres hijos de 9, 20 y 25 años de edad, los dos mayores trabajan y el pequeño estudia, esta es su novena solicitud en Afodenic y da las gracias por la oportunidad y los beneficios que ha logrado en su negocio como en sus ventas. Con este crédito va invertir en mercadería variada como granos básicos, productos enlatados, y productos de consumo diario. Lo cual espera elevar las ventas y poder tener mejores ganancias. Sus planes a futuro es poder mantener ahorros para apoyar a a su hijo con los estudios.
texts.en:
Inés, 46, has had a mini market for 17 years. She started the business with liquidation from a previous job. She also had her husband’s help. She lives in the Villa Venezuela with her three children who are 9, 20 and 25. The two older children work, and the youngest goes to school. This is her 9th application with Afodenic. She is thankful for the opportunity and benefits she has achieved (like sales) in her business. With this loan she will buy various merchandise like basic grains, canned goods, and products that are consumed daily. She hopes this will increase her sales and give her better earnings. Her future plan is to be able to have savings to support her son in his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains and canned goods

loans.name: Rahbaroy

texts.ru: Орзиева Рахбарой , женщина в возрасте 35 лет , замужем , имеет троих детей. Рахбарой работает медсестрой в больнице Паласса. Её заработная плата очень низкая, поэтому она вместе с мужем занимается откормом и продажей скота. Также у неё дома имеется большой земельный участок, на котором она посадила огурцы и помидоры. В период закруток Рахбарой будет консервировать свои овощи с огорода. У  Рахбарой отец наш давнишний клиент , который кредитуется для бизнеса животноводства. Он посоветовал своей дочери увеличить скот , пока он дешёвый на рынке. Сейчас у Рахбарой три коровы, на снимке одна из них. Поэтому Рахбарой обратилась к нам.
texts.en:
Rahbaroy O. is a 35-year-old married woman, who has three children. She works as a nurse in the Palassa hospital. However, her salary is very low, and this is why Rahbaroy and her husband are involved in livestock feeding and sales. She also has a large plot of land at home where she planted cucumbers and tomatoes. Rahbaroy plans to can the vegetables from her garden. Rahbaroy’s father is a long-time client of ours. He obtains financing for his animal husbandry business. He is also the one who advised his daughter to increase her livestock headcount while livestock market prices are low. Rahbaroy now owns three cows, one of which is pictured here. This is why Rahbaroy requested this loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is 28 years old and is single without a child. He sells furniture fabrics. He hopes for the loan of N80,000 to purchase more furniture fabric to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture fabric to sell

loans.name: Amato

texts.en:
Amato, a widowed mother of two, has always loved children and believes her mission in life is to help them. For over ten years, she worked with disadvantaged children at various nonprofits before being laid off in 2003.  She began fostering children and decided to take this effort one step further by opening a daycare center in her home in California. Amato hopes that the individual care and attention each child receives at Village d’Afrique will teach them great values and give them the opportunity to flourish in life. She’d like to provide this opportunity to more children, but needs funds to fully convert her home into a daycare center with a higher capacity.
With a $6,000 loan from Opportunity Fund, Amato will be able to carpet the living room nap area, convert her garage into a play room, and buy art and educational supplies. Currently, Amato has three children in her bilingual French and English daycare program, but she hopes that the loan will expand her capacity to care for more children.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Amato from  United States

loans.use: Carpet nap area, convert garage to play room, and buy educational and art supplies

loans.name: Bobosadik

texts.ru: Бобосадик Назаров проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Бобосадик более 22 лет занимается земледелием, он в основном выращивает огурцы. До этого он работал колхозником. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить зерна и минеральные удобрения.
texts.en:
Bobosadik N. lives in the Yavan district. He is 50 years old, married and has 4 children. Bobosadik has been involved in agriculture for over 22 years. He mainly grows cucumbers. Previously, he worked as a farmer. Our client is requesting this loan in order to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Babi Berna’S Group

texts.en:
Berna is the leader of a four-member group. She is a 33 years old and married with three children aged between 10 and 16 years. All her children go to school She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is living with six people. She also takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Berna resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She uses public transportation to and from shopping in Kampala city and goes for shopping twice a week. Her major monthly expense is school fees

Berna is a poultry farmer in Bakuli, one of Kampala’s suburbs and has been in this business for the last seven years. She sells to an average of twenty people a day and sells to mainly women. She works seven days a week.. Besides poultry farming, Berna sells secondhand clothes at her home and also is a property agent.

Berna has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more chicken feed. Berna is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and also completing her house which will also work as her business premises.

loans.use: To buy more feed for her chickens

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a woman of courage and strong determination. She strives hard to lift her family from poverty. She is 55 years old and mother of three children are of legal age. She is happily married to Santiago, who is 61 years old. She lives in the coastal town of Cardona, Rizal Province in the Philippines.

Opportunity knocks only once, so when she was given the chance to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, she really grabbed it. She is expert in managing a sari-sari (general store) because she has been doing it for ten years. She is happy with the proceeds that she receives from her business.

Now she is proposing a loan of 23,000 pesos as additional capital for her store. Specificallly, the loan will be used to buy 10 sacks of rice, beverages, liquor, cigarettes and groceries for her store. She is optimistic that, with the confidence of ASHI and KIVA, bit by bit, she can achieve her dream of purchasing a housing lot and having savings for her and her husband's future.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks oof rice, beverages, liqours, cigarettes and groceries for her store.

loans.name: Enebish

texts.en: Enebish D. runs her own tailoring business that she started in 2001. She lives with her two sons, ages 7 and 11, and mother in a ger (nomadic housing tent) district on  the plot of land she owns in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. In 2006, Enebish expanded her business by selling second-hand clothes at the local market. She purchases and imports used clothing from South Korea. She currently pays 10,000 tugrugs (aprx. 7 USD) per kilo of clothing she imports, then resells each item individually at marginally higher prices. Enebish says that, "Many poor and vulnerable people live in my province. A large portion of my customer base comes from this group of people. Since second-hand clothes are cheaper than new clothes, they sell quicker." She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for her inventory. In the near future she is planning to import and sell new clothes through her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her inventory.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 45 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 2 hijos, Carmen estudio primaria incompleta (3er grado), ella vive en la comunidad de segundo Camicachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo utilizo en la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra ganado menor ovino para venderlos en las ferias de la zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank "Manuela de Hoy II," which is located in Camicachi, Llave district, Collao Province, Puno. She is 45 years old, married and is the mother of two children. Carmen attended school through the 3rd grade but did not complete primary school. She lives in the community of Segundo Camicachi. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 2 years. Her initial loan was for 500 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase livestock. She currently needs a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, to invest in the purchase of sheep that she will sell in the regional markets. Her desire is to continue working and she enjoys saving.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is the married mother of two children, one of whom has completed secondary school level and is waiting to join university. She lives with her family in Kigumo Runyenjes.

Lucy specializes in knitting sweaters as well as selling secondhand clothes. She has requested Kshs 50,000 to increase her stock of used clothes.

loans.use: To increase her stock of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: réparer son four

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a 50-year-old woman. She is married with four children who are currently in school. She is a baker and a food vendor. She sells banku. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as lunch and supper. She also bakes bread to supply to grocery shops around her vicinity. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, firewood, flour, baking powder, sugar, margarine, etc. She hopes to increase her income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 42-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the town of Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town, but the majority of the residents practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities. 

Theresa prepares and sells porridge in the mornings. Theresa hawks (sells door-to-door) in her community. She buys the goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize for her porridge business

loans.name: Melida Narcisa

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Cisne se encuentra en la  hermosa parroquia El Valle al  suroeste de la Ciudad de Cuenca, siendo famosa por su producción de maíz, papas, etc., sus atractivos turísticos como la laguna de Cochapamba que se encuentra llena de totoras (plantas para hacer esteras, sombreros, adornos), la colina de Tasqui que nos brinda una hermosa vista de la parroquia y de la ciudad de Cuenca y su gente muy cálida y amable que nos hacen sentir como en casa son atractivos para los turistas.
 
Melida L. es una de las  socia activas de éste banco, lleva dos año trabajando con su banco comunal,  vive en la comunidad de Chilca totoras en el sector El  Valle, tiene 28 años de edad es casada y tienen una hija de 11 año que estudia en la escuela Dolores J. Torres de la localidad, su esposo vive  en el exterior  viajó hace varios años en busca de mejores días para  su familia, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia.

Melida trabaja como chofer de transporte escolar, tiene una furgoneta en la que transporta diariamente a varios niños de las escuelas de la localidad, lleva un año en esta actividad, nos comenta que este es su segundo préstamo, con el dinero que reciba del crédito solicitado  a  la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR  va a realizar el mantenimiento de su vehículo  y comprar llantas, su meta es seguir adelante y prosperar en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Swan Communal Bank is located in the beautiful parish of El Valle in southwestern Cuenca. This area is famous for its agricultural production of corn, potatoes, and other crops. Tourist attractions such as the Cochapamba Lagoon are filled with reeds used for making mats, hats, and decorations. Tasqui Hill provides a beautiful view of the parish and the entire city of Cuenca. The people are very warm and friendly. They make you feel at home, which is why tourists enjoy being around them.

Melida L. is one of the active members of this Communal Bank. She has been a member for two years. Melida lives in the community of Chilca Totoras in El Valle Parish. She is 28 years old, married, and has an 11 year old daughter who attends the Dolores J. Torres School. Her husband has been living abroad for several years. He travels in search of better days for his family. His hard work has enabled them to build a house of their own.

Melida works as a school shuttle driver. She owns a van which she uses to transport numerous children every day to schools throughout the area. Melida has been in this business for one year. This is her second loan and will use the money from Fundación ESPOIR to maintenance her vehicle and purchase new tires. Her goal is to move forward and prosper in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance & purchase tires

loans.name: Rosalpina Del Carmen

texts.en: Rosalpina has four grown children who are all independent of her and she is not married. For nearly thirty years her business has been the sale of baked goods and vegetables. Rosalpina says that this has been her business because she loves to cook. The vegetables that she sells vary from season to season and the baked goods she sells include a kind of shortbread cookie called "rosquillas" and a pastry with a cheese filling called "hornados." Rosalpina dreams of being able to afford repairs to her house. Rosalpina is an excellent client of Fundación León 2000, but she reports that her sales have been low and she has clients who are behind in their payments.

loans.use: Working capital for her business

loans.name: Maritza Isabel

texts.en:
For ten years Maritza has had her business. She sells cooked beans which she makes in her home and sells in the central market of Chinandega very early in the morning.

Maritza will use this loan to buy products to support her business like beans and wood for her stove. Her aspirations are to continue to expand her business and improve her household.

Maritza is married and her husband works at a local factory. They have two children, 16 and 18, who are both in high school.

loans.use: To buy products to support her business like beans and wood for her stove

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is divorced. She has a grown daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, where she sells clothing merchandise in one of the local marketplaces. Nina is an experienced entrepreneur. She has been in this business for 12 years. Lending assistance has benefited her business a lot. Currently, she has about 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her monthly gross income amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas.  

Nina is seeking a loan of 8,000 Grivnyas to increase the variety of assorted merchandise she offers for sale in her kiosk. She is hoping to continue developing her business to ensure a stable future for her family. Nina hopes her business keeps a stable standing so that she could continue supporting her daughter and a grandson, as well as her elderly father who is 90 and lives with her.

loans.use: To increase the variety of assorted merchandise

loans.name: Josué Daniel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote en el deparamento de León, el señor José Daniel D. se dedica con mucho sacrificio a trabajar para brindarle el sustento a sus pequeños hijos que tanto necesitan de su apoyo por ser un padre ejemplar y digno de imitar ya que ha sabido mantener su hogar.

Actualmente sus dos hijos entrarán a la escuela y para ello necesita realizar los pagos escolares y por esto solicita un crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la educación de sus hijos para formarlos y lograr que lleguen a ser profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Nagarote in the district of León, Mr. José Daniel D. works, with a lot of self-sacrifice, to provide the basic necessities to his young children who rely completely on his support. He has proven himself to be an exemplary and worthy father who has recognized his responsibility to maintain his household. Currently, his two sons are about to enter a new school. Mr. D. needs to pay for their education, and thus is seeking a loan to invest in the education of his sons and their development. His wish is for them to be able to become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School payments for his children

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S. est une dame ménagère elle habite a la sicap baobab ou elle exerce un commerce de jus de fruits et de glace elle est membre a la caisse de liberté 6 depuis 2007 a son troisième pret elle sollicite un montant de 200 000 F CFA pour renforcer ses activités
texts.en:
Fatou S. is a housewife living in Sicap Baobab, where she runs a business selling fruit juices and ice-cream. She has been a member of the Liberté 6 village bank since 2007. For her third loan, she is requesting 200,000 CFA Francs to boost her activities.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to boost her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora VICTORIA C. C., se dedica a la Lechería, elabora quesillos para su venta en el pueblo próximo a su localidad, vive a 24 kilómetros de la ciudad de Cochabamba en Curubamba, una zona muy bonita llena de vegetación y productora de leche y sembradíos.

Es casada, tiene cuatro hijos entre 13 y 3 años de edad.  Su esposo trabaja la tierra y así también es albañil.  

Quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida, tiene una casa de 2 habitaciones a medio construir.  Quiere comprar una vaca lechera con el crédito para crecer en su actividad y con el tiempo desea poder seguir comprando mas vacas y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria C. C. operates a dairy and makes cheeses to sell in the neighboring village. She lives 24 km from the city of Cochabamba in Curubamba, which is a beautiful area full of vegetation. Many milk producers and farmers live in this area.

Victoria is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 13. Her husband works on their land and is also a bricklayer by profession. She and her husband want to improve their living conditions and they have a two-bedroom house that is halfway built. With her loan, she wants to buy a dairy cow so that she can grow her business. Over time, she hopes to continue buying more cows and improving her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Edmée Maty

texts.fr: Edmée Maty F. est une femme de 59 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 ans et responsable de 2 autres enfants qu'on lui a confiés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DOUROU-KHOUDOSS depuis juillet 2007 et y a bénéficier de 7 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés sans difficultés. Elle est détentrice d'un salon de coiffure et y vend en même temps des effets cosmétiques. Elle participe financièrement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Edmée Maty F. is a 59-year old woman who is married and has two children of her own; she also has two other children who have been entrusted to her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in DOURU-KHOUDASS since July 2007 and has had seven loans, which she has always managed well and repaid without problem. She owns a hairdressing salon and at the same time sells cosmetics there. She is contributing financially to the improvement in her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her hairdressing salon

loans.name: Richard Kimaiyo

texts.en:
Richard Kimaiyo K. is a thirty-six year old man married to Monica Tanui and they are blessed with six lovely children. He lives in Sergoit in Eldoret and he is a maize farmer in the same area. He has been farming for the last twelve years and besides farming he also sells milk to one of Kenya’s biggest milk suppliers, the Kenya Cooperative Creameries. 

He came to know about KADET through his friends where he stays.  This will be his first loan from KADET and he plans to use the entire loan for maize farming through things like hiring a tractor for digging, buying maize seedlings and fertilizers.

Richard's life goals are to continue farming and become a better farmer, buy land on which to build rental houses, and educate his children to the highest level.

loans.use: To use in maize farming

loans.name: Ayim Group

texts.en:
Mary A. is a hard-working and honest baker and the group leader of 'A.' group. She has been in the bakery business for the past seven years, and currently has one oven which she says is not enough to meet the demand from her customers. As a result she is looking for support to expand her business to the level that she can own 5 gas ovens which will enable her to meet the high demand from her customers and also support her children's education to the university level.

'A.' group is comprised of 5 members and has been in existence a little  over one year. All members say they are happy to be together and with hard work and financial support, each hopes to own a big business where they can retail their products. They are excited to be taking this loan to enable them to accomplish their dream.

loans.use: Purchase bags of flour for baking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Karimkulova Ruzvanhan Group

texts.ru:
