Рузванхан является лидером этой группы. Ей 52 года, замужем и мать 3 уже взрослых детей. Из них младшая дочь помогает матери в бизнесе. Она в данное время занимается выращиванием риса. На кредит она закупит 300 кг семян риса, 50 кг удобрений и 10 литров солярки.

Нуржамал, 41, замужем.  У нее трое детей:двум дочерям 21 год и 14 лет, а сыну 19 лет. Старшая дочь рабоает в городе Ош в швейном цехе и получает 100 долларов, сын работает помощником бухгалтера в больнице и получает 50 долларов. Младшая дочь учится в местной школе.  А супруг работает  в лесхозе. Нуржамал занимается сельским хозяйством, 15 лет назад был взят в аренду земельный надел и начат бизнес. Сначала сажали только пшеницу. Цель кредита - закуп 100 кг семян, 500 кг удобрений и 50 литров дизельного топлива.

Алима, 53, замужем. У нее одна дочь.Супруг клиента работает контролером в РЭС с зарплатой около 150 долларов. У алимы есть домашнее хозяйство, где она занимается откормом живности. Цель кредита - закуп 1 овцы и корм для разведения.

'Марату 36 лет. Его супруга занимается сельским хозяйством ( выращивает рис). Сам же работает в больнице в Куршабе, материальным бухгалтером, а также занимается животноводством. Цель кредита - закупа МРС.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Ruzvanhan is the leader of this group. She is 52 years old, married and is a mother of 3 already-grown children. Out of the children, the youngest daughter helps her mother with the business. Ruzvanhan in currently involved in growing rice. She will use this loan to buy 300 kg of rice seeds, 50 kg of fertilizers and 10 liters of diesel fuel. Nurjamal is 41 years, married. She has three children: two daughters are 21 and 14 years old, and the son is 19 years old. The oldest daughter works at a sewing factory in the city of Osh and earns 100 dollars. The son works as an assistant accountant at a hospital and earns 50 dollars. The youngest daughter attends a local school. Nurjamal's husband works at a forestry. Nurjamal is involved in agriculture. The family leased a plot of land 15 years ago and started this business. At first, they only planted wheat. The goal of the loan is to purchase 100 kg seeds, 500 kg of fertilizers and 50 liters of diesel fuel. Alima is 53 years old, married. Her husband works as a controller at the RES and has a salary of around 150 dollars. Alima has a household business of fattening livestock. The goal of the loan is the purchase of one sheep and livestock feed. Marat is 36 years. His wife is involved in agriculture, growing rice. Marat works as a materials accountant at a hospital in Kurshab and is also involved in animal husbandry. The goal of the loan is the purchase of small livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice seeds, fertilizers and diesel fuel

loans.name: Blanca Nacisa

texts.es:
Blanca de 26 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Guayaquil, su casa es de caña y solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico, ella tiene una tienda de especies de ( acelga, albahaca, achiote, alcaparra, alfalfa etc.). Antes de tener su tienda de especies ella trabajaba en un almacén pero por la reducción del personal la despidieron y se quedo sin trabajo. 

Pero por su esfuerzo y el dinero ahorrado que tenia compro especies alimenticias(las que aparecen en la foto) y empezó a vender en su casa a todas las personas que la conocían. En la actualidad ella trabaja todos los días vendiendo especies alimenticias. Quiere con el préstamo comprar especies y readecuar mas su negocio con vitrinas.  

En el futuro quiere expandir su negocio con mas tienda de especies.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 26, lives in the periurban area of Guayaquil. Her house is made of wood, and the only basic service she has is electricity. She has a spice store (chard, basil, annatto, capers, and alfalfa). Before she had her spice store she worked in a store. Due to a reduction in personnel, they let her go. She was left without work. Through her effort and the money she had saved she bought spices (they appear in the photo). She started to sell in her house to everyone she knew. She currently works everyday selling spices. She wants the loan to buy spices and to recondition her store with display cases. In the future she wants to expand her business with more spice stores.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Display case and spices

loans.name: Edwin Fabián

texts.es:
El señor Edwin Fabián A. se dedica con mayor frecuencia a realizar actividades agropecuarias como la siembra de maíz, ajonjolí y sandias también se dedica a la crianza de ganado bobino, ovino, porcino y aviar con los que genera sus ingresos para la mantención de sus familia la que se compone de su esposa y sus tres hijas las que actualmente estudian secundaria. 
Actualmente este  cliente tiene como propósito mejorar los potreros en donde mantiene sus animales, solicito este crédito con el fin de tener a su disposición fertilizantes y los demás insumos para el establecimiento de sandia, con los que pretende pagar sus obligaciones y ayudar a comprar una parte de terreno de la finca, también sueña con poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Edwin Fabián A. has been dedicating increasing amounts of time to farming, including sowing corn, sesame, and watermelon. He also raises cattle, hogs, and poultry. These endeavors generate income to sustain the family, which consists of his wife and three daughters , both of whom attend secondary school. This loan candidate intends to improve the pasture where the animals are kept. He requests the loan to purchase fertilizers and the rest of the supplies to establish a watermelon crop. With the crop, he intends to pay his obligations and come closer to purchasing part of the land of the farm. Edwin also dreams of improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and fungicide

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Micaela R. tiene más de un año dedicándose a la venta de ropa nueva y novedades.
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía y no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
Es por eso que solicita su cooperación en este crédito, y así su negocio tendrá más mercancía para la venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Micaela R. has worked for more than a year selling new clothing and novelty items. She is requesting a loan because her merchandise has declined and she does not have enough capital to invest on her own. She does not want to take away from her business because it is her family's only source of income. For this reason she asks for your help with the loan so that her business can have more merchandise available for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani lives in a city called Borewala in Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a daily wage labor and both his sons do the same work. The contractors hire them for periods of 15 to 20 days and give them the task of breaking bricks into pieces and also carring bricks. Her husband has tractor also with which he drives in the field to plow the land. 

Rani family is living in very poor financial condition as sometimes her husband and sons can get work and sometimes not. So, to financially support her husband, Rani makes and sells toys with which she earns a reasonable income. 

She has applied for a loan for the third time from Asasah for her husband. Rani is hoping that her family’s financial condition will get better with the help of a loan  they will be able tohave a better standard of life.

loans.use: To buy new tractor tires

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb Z. is fifty-six years old, married, and has six children. They hope to teach their children good business skills so that even the grandchildren will enjoy the benefits of business. His business is located at Chanduma market near a college in Kakamega. He has been selling scrap metal, cookers and other items for the last 20 years. He sells to local people and has two employees. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 30,000 to buy more scrap metal to make cookers to sell to the local people. He hopes to grow his business and open other outlets in future. He describes himself as very polite, honest, and aggressive.

loans.use: Scrap Metal

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose T. makes a living selling clothes such as dresses, pants and head dresses. She is applying for a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. Rose is 45 years old and her husband makes a living working for an NGO. They have five children, all of whom attend school. With the extra profits made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family to live in.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell to her customers

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “God Is Great” Group. They are microentrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of 1,400,000 leones each. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. 

Mariama Siray M. is the leader of this group. Mariama was born in Makeni. She is 38, married to a businessman and they have four children:  one in primary school and three in secondary school. Mariama has been a businesswoman for quite a long time now. She sells baby clothes. She wants this loan in order to buy more baby clothes to add to her business. 

Also included in the photo is the loan officer in charge, handing over the loan.

loans.use: To buy more baby clothes

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim lives in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She is a 51-year-old housewife who spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household tasks. She is widow and lives with her son and brother in a two-room brick house in the Mughalpura area.

Shamim’s brother operates a motor workshop where he repairs motorbikes. Her son assists him in this business. Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her brother’s business. With the loan, he will buy the latest repairing tools for his motor workshop to make his work more effective for his customers.

Shamim is a new loan applicant and she hopes the loan will bring positive changes to her brother’s business. She is hopeful that he will be able to make positive changes in his business by utilizing the loan in a proper way.

In the photo, Shamim is the lady who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To enable her brother to buy the latest repairing tools for his motor workshop

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
El Señor Moisés P. M. tiene 27 años, el está separado de su esposa  y es padre de tres hijos a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educación, el trabaja en el magisterio como profesor de primaria, él también trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato “EL SAYUBU” en la localidad de Puerto Villarroel en el trópico de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  en el cual esta hace mas de 10 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.

Cabe señalar que el señor Moisés P. M. se apersono a CIDRE a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Moisés P. M., age 27, is separated from his wife.  He has three children who he helps, and he supports their education.  He works as an elementary school teacher.  

He also works as a “moto taxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) driver for the El Sayubu syndicate.  He drives his taxi in Cochabamba’s Trópico area in Puerto Villaroel.  He has been an active member of the syndicate for over ten years.  The taxi service is profitable because many people use it for its ease, speed, and efficiency. The union has stops and shifts for each member at different points in the town of Ivirgarzama, where people use the taxi service.

This is his first loan with our institution.  He will use the loan to buy a new motorcycle.  His motorcycle has finished its useful life.  With the new one he will be able to provide better service to his customers.  This will allow him to improve his income, which will consequentially improve his quality of life.

Moisés P. M. came in person to CIDRE's offices to ask for a loan after his coworkers told him of the institution's good credit conditions.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Magdelena

texts.es:
María Magdalena es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la comercialización de productos de belleza por catálogo. Ella cuenta con una clientela estable, pero aún asi siempre trata de buscar nuevos clientes ya que, a más cantidad de pedidos, mayor es la cantidad de ganancias que percibe. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad los utiliza en el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María desea adquirir algunos productos por su cuenta y empezar a contar con un stock fijo de productos que le permita satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes sin tener que esperar a fin de mes, que es cuando llega el pedido. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Ella es una mujer responsable,activa y bastante emprendedora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida..
texts.en:
María Magdalena is a 43 year old mother who resides with her husband and two children in the District of Tambogrande, an agricultural area located in the province and region of Piura. This community is more than three and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

María has been selling beauty products by catalog for four years. She has an established clientele, but is always looking to attract new customers and generate more orders so that she can receive additional income. The earnings from her business enable her to support her family’s finances.

María wants to acquire a few products to keep on hand and build up a fixed inventory of merchandise so that she can meet the demand of her customers without having to wait until the end of the month when orders arrive. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 500 PEN to accomplish her goal.

María is a responsible, active, and enterprising woman. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise to build up a fixed inventory

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela D. P. is a widow who lives in Marabahay, Barangay Rio Tuba, Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  a general store, a tricycle transport business, and dried fish selling. 

Angela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Angela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $237, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 16th cycle loan, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, with which she intends to buy inventory for the general store and dried fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Angela D. P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITTY CACHIMAYO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; tiene 22 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cerveza, ella tiene un deposito de cerveza y atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cajas de cerveza al por mayor.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the communal bank "SR OF COYLLORITTY Cachimayo". The bank is located in the district of Cachimayo, which is in the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

Ms. Luz Marina is 22 years old and is married with 1 son. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling beer.  She has a beer depot which is open from 9:00 am to 10:00 pm.  Her business is allowing her to give her child a head start in life, so the member wants to expand the business. The member is requesting a loan to buy cases of beer at wholesale.

The member is grateful for the requested loan and agrees to make her payments on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to buy cases of beer at wholesale.

loans.name: Margot Bonifacia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margot Bonifacia; ella tiene 47 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes y restaurant, la socia trabaja desD. las 7:00 a. hasta las 9:00 p.m, la socia quiere vender panetones, champas, chocolates para la época naviD.ña. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la época naviD.ña.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el pL. establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Margot Bonifacia belongs to the Ricchary Cusco Community Bank which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name.

Margot is 47 years old, married, and has two children. As well as her household duties, she also runs a grocery store and restaurant. She works from 7 am to 9 pm.

Margot wants to take advantage of the Christmas season and sell panetones (a dessert bread), sweaters, and chocolates. She needs a loan to buy these items. She is very grateful to all those donors who are helping her fulfill her dream and promises to make repayments on the loan according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy items for the Christmas season

loans.name: Vilma Mery

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y  provincia de Puno, tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene  03 hijos independientes, la señora estudió educación superior.

Trabaja  con  el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 09 años, su préstamo inicial fue de   S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos artesanales.

Su nuevo crédito es de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá para comprar lanas de colores oscuros  y botones para sus tejidos como chompas, suéteres, etc. 

Su visión es mejorar el negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque es una distracción conversar con las socias.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the 'Las Kantutas' community bank which is located in the district and province of Puno.  She is 60 years old, married and has three grown up children who live independently.  Vilma completed her higher education.

Vilma has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 9 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling handicrafts.

Vilma's new loan is for 1,000 Peruvian soles which she will invest in buying dark-colored yarn and buttons for her knitted items such as sweaters.  Her vision for the future is to improve her business and her profits.  What she likes about her community bank are the meetings because it is fun to chat with the other members.

loans.use: To buy dark-colored yarn and buttons for her knitted sweaters

loans.name: Navuth

texts.en:
Mr. Navuth P., 43 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Leangky Mey, 42 years old, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1988 and have three children- two sons and one daughter.  

Navuth is a soldier. His wife is a chef and runs grocery store at home. He is asking for his first loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Félix Antonio es un hombre trabajador que disfruta de obtener este medio de vida. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de reparación de aparatos electrodomésticos. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre están pendientes del buen servicio que ofrece. Se levanta temprano pues la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a solicitar de sus servicios. El financiamiento que solicita es para comprar herramientas necesarias para realizar sus trabajos. Desea salir adelante con su negocio que es lo más importante.
texts.en:
Félix Antonio is a hard-working man who benefits from his way of life. He offers a repair service for home appliances. The majority of his customers are loyal to the good service that he offers. He gets up early. The majority of his customers come to him to request his services.
The requested loan is for the purchase of the necessary tools to do his work. He wants to succeed with his business; this is the most important thing for him.

loans.use: working capital--tools for home electronics repairs

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Carlos S. R. él es trabajador activo de la Empresa Contratista “Marvin Murillo Pizarro” desempeñándose como Operador de Equipo Pesado tiene  tres años  de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  ocho créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Juan Carlos S. R. is an active worker for the contractor Marvin Murillo Pizarro, acting as a heavy equipment operator. He has worked for this business for three years. He is currently married and has two school-age children. He has received eight loans through Kiva partner CEPRODEL, and each one has been used to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, rocks, gravel, bricks, etc. To expand and improve his house, these loans with CEPRODEL have helped greatly, and so he has improved his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Bricks, gravel, sand, and cement

loans.name: Marion

texts.en: Marion, 33 years old, is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She is a member of the Hope Self Help group with Faulu Kenya. Marion runs a salon for a living and works hard in her business. She joined the Faulu Kenya group so that she could access financial resources easily. She has certainly benefited because she has managed to build her own house with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya. Marion is looking forward to opening a cosmetic shop in the future. Marion needs 60,000 KES to buy hair chemicals, hair extensions and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals, hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: Lino Alexis

texts.es:
El señor Alexis es un pequeño comerciante quien trabaja por su cuenta en la comercialización de queso y crema el cual viaja diariamente para vender este producto tiene más de 5 años en estas actividad
Este es el primer crédito que solicita en la institución el cual será invertido en la mejora de la vivienda ya que quiere construir unas parades como división  que en la actualidad son de plásticos 
En la actualidad está casado y con dos hijos a su cargo su esposa es ama de casa
texts.en:
Alexis is a small merchant working independently selling cheese and cream.  He travels daily to sell these products and has more than five years experience in this activity.

This is the first loan he’s requested from the institution and it will be used for home improvement because he wants to build a few interior walls which currently are plastic sheets.  

He is married and has two children in his care; his wife’s a housewife.

loans.use: To buy bricks and sacks of cement.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn V. is from the town of District 1, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 24 years old and married with one infant child. To make a living, Ronalyn raises pigs for fattening and sale. Ronalyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of her grown pigs.

In 2010, Ronalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Ronalyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Chhith

texts.en:
Mrs.Chhith was born in 1983 and is married to Mr. Phorn, who was born in 1971. They have four children, two of whom are attending in the local public school. The other two are too young to study or work. 

Her husband is a construction worker and also a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support his family. 

Mrs. Chhith is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice. She also earns her living by breeding pigs. In order to support these  businesses, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. The rest of the loan she would use to support her crop.  

Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for breeding and to support her farming crop

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La señora Roxana se dedica al tratamiento con productos natural de diabetes detectan y tratan esta enfermedad tienen productos naturales con los que palean esta enfermedad ella junto a su esposo patentaron productos naturales para el tratamiento de esta enfermedad ya son mas de 8 años que se dedican a esta actividad  sus hijos también le ayudan en este emprendimiento el hijo mayor está en ultimo año de la carrera de medicina  el es de gran ayuda para esta actividad con esto generan ingresos para su sustento tiene bastante documentación que acredita que sus productos funcionan. Viven en casa propia, con el dinero del crédito compraran insumos y algunas plantas naturales para la elaboración de los mismos, esta agradecida con la institución  por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Roxana diagnoses and treats diabetes with natural medicine.  She and her husband patented these natural products and have been treating people for more than eight years.  Their children also work in this field.  Their eldest son is in his final year of medical school and he is a great help to the business, which generates an income.  They have plenty of documentation that accredits their products.  They live in their own home.

They will use the money from this loan to buy supplies and some plants to make their treatments.  She is grateful to the institution for its backing.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia tiene 58 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia.

Tiene  36 años de experiencia en ventas pero desde hace 15 años viene formalmente su negocio de cafetín en un centro educativo superior, vende comida, frutas y dulces para toda la población estudiantil de esta institución, el trabajo que realiza es junto a su esposo y trabajan todos los días  y descansan los fines de semana porque generalmente en esos días no hay clases, Ofelia considera que su trabajo es muy rentable porque le permite rotar  con mucha frecuencia su mercadería evitando que perezcan los productos perecibles, además tiene mucha demanda en sus ventas a pesar de que su cafetín no es el único que existe en ese centro educativo y así puede superarse sus metas de ganancia que se propone y aumentar su mercadería, su meta es mejorar el local de sus ventas e implementarla por lo que se seguirá esforzando. 

Es su crédito número  7 que tiene con MFP, se siente muy contenta de  tener este préstamo muy importante  para el logro de sus metas por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en la devolución mensual.

Con el dinero comprara nuevos mostradores que es  una implementación de su local de ventas.
texts.en:
Ofelia, age 58, lives with her husband and their three children in their own house.  She has 36 years of experience in sales.  However, for 15 years she has been managing her business, a café, in a center for higher education.

She sells meals, fruit, and sweets for all of the student population in this institution.  She works together with her husband every day.  They rest on the week-ends because there generally are no classes then.  Ofelia feels that her work is very profitable because it allows her to frequently rotate her merchandise.  This way she avoids having the perishable products spoil.  

There is a great demand for what she sells at her cafe in spite of the fact that hers is not the only café in the educational center.  That is how she is able to meet the earning goals that she has set and increase her merchandise.  She will continue to put forth great effort in order to be able to achieve her goal of improving her business.

This is her 7th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to have this loan.  It is very important for her to achieve her goals.  She pledges to make her payments on time.  She will use the money to buy new display counters to use at her place of business.

loans.use: to buy display counters.

loans.name: Jenniffer Estrellita

texts.es:
La señora Jennifer es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Forjadoras del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera  y tiene una hija.
Lleva 3 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de madera.  Tiene un local  y debido a la gran demanda ha tenido que contratar a una persona para que le ayude en el negocio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles,comprará de 50 listones de madera y  300 tablillas para venderlas por cientos.
Jennifer es madre soltera y tiene que ver la manera de trabajar para poder criar a su pequeña hija y cubrir todas sus necesidades.  Gracias a Manuela Ramos pudo contar con un pequeño capital el cual lo ha sabido invertir adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Jennifer is a member of the “Mujeres Forjadoras” (Forging Women) communal bank located in Callería district, Ucayali Department.  She’s 25 years old, single and has a daughter.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for three years.  She sells lumber.  She has a locale and due to large demand she’s had to hire a person to help her with the business.

She will use her new 1000 new sol loan to buy 50 wood slats and 300 splints to sell by the hundred.

Jennifer is a single mother and needs to find the way to work in order to raise her young daughter and cover all her needs.  Thanks to Manuela Ramos she was able to have a bit of capital that she’s known how to invest adequately.

loans.use: to buy wood slats.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Aiming to support the education of her five school-aged children, Editha grows rice. She has operated this business for 10 years. Although she is already 45 years old, she is still very strong and dedicated to generating income for the sake of her family.

To make her farming business more profitable, Editha is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds to grow. She will also use some of the loan for the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Turanta

texts.en:
Turanta, 43 years old, is married with five children. He lives in Narok, Kenya. He has been farming for the past seven years. 

He is a humble client. He knew of KADET through other clients registered in his area. This will be his second loan from KADET LTD and he intends to spend it on preparing the land for planting and to purchase maize seeds.

The profit generated he will plough back into the farm. His dream is to become a big farmer. He can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: to prepare the land for farming and purchase maize seeds.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been extracting stones from quarries in Naivasha town for the last eight years.  He is 43 years old, married to Lilian and they have four school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 17,000 KES well and in good time.  He used the previous loan amount to buy another quarry. He plans to use this loan amount to buy another quarry site and employ casual workers so that he may increase his production.

In future, Daniel hopes to grow and own many quarries.

loans.use: To buy another extraction site.

loans.name: Alma Leticia

texts.es: La Sra. Alma es  una persona  responsable  y  muy trabajadora  acudió con nosotros para solicitar su crédito ya que desea terminar  la pared de una  habitación de  su  domicilio   de la  cual  había  realizado  la  construcción  con anterioridad, agradece  de antemano  el  apoyo brindado  por la  institución para la realización de  su  proyecto, ya  que   ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  de  ofrecer  a su  familia una  mayor  comodidad y  una excelente imagen a  su  domicilio.
texts.en:
Alma is a responsible, very hard working woman who came to us to request a loan because she wants to finish off the wall in one of the rooms in her house that she built recently.  

She thanks in advance for the support provided by the institution for her to carry out her project because she sees in the loan the possibility of providing her family with more comfort and an excellent image for her house.

loans.use: to finish off the walls on her house.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel de 42 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de su madre, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turísticas (tiene diferentes sitios arqueológicos).

Manuel desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de helados, negocio que a instalado en su domicilio, cuenta con su propia clientela, también vende láminas escolares y album de fotos, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias y personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería (helados) y seguir vendiendo a sus clientes para satisfacer su necesidad, con sus ganancias que adquiera podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.   Manuel es un hijo responsable y trabajador  que lo único que desea es que su negocio crezca y poderle brindar algunas comodidades a su madre con la quien vive.
texts.en:
Manuel is 42 years old, single, and lives in his mother’s home, which includes running water and electricity.  It’s located in the urban zone of the Lambayeque department.  This zone is known for its farming, livestock, and tourism (it has different archeological sites).

Manuel has been selling frozen treats for the past six years, from a business that he runs out of his home.  He has steady customers and also sells school notebooks and photo albums.  He pays his personal and daily expenses with the income he earns.

He is requesting this loan of 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa, through Capital Semilla, so that he can buy more merchandise (frozen treats) and continue selling to his customers and meet their needs.  He will repay the loan through his earnings and also improve his quality of life.  Manual is a responsible and hardworking son who only wants to grow his business and provide some comforts to his mother.

loans.use: to buy frozen treats for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is from the municipality of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 50 years old, married and has 2 grown children. She owns and operates a retail store at home to make a living. She has been doing this for 11  years. Cecilia usually makes a monthly income of PHP 10,000.00 from the store operations. 
Earlier this year, Cecilia joined GDMPC to have an easy access to financial services. She has applied for a loan of PHP 15,000.00 from the organization to purchase grocery items or daily use commodities to sell in the store. She hopes to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items or daily use commodities to sell.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en:
Farogat is married and has one child. She sells men’s clothing at the central market. Farogat has been in this business for five years. She decided to start her business because she needed to provide for her growing family. Shirts and trousers are always in demand, so Farogat decided to sell them. She is a hard-working person and desires to develop her business even more. Farogat would like to receive a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase seasonal shirts, trousers, and suits for the coming season. She hopes that the loan will help her to increase her profits.

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase shirts, trousers, and suits

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her second son who is a movie maker and offers movie-making services on different occasions such as wedding ceremonies, birthdays etc. With the loan, he will buy a movie camera and film rolls to provide better quality work to his clients and increase his income. He is very good in his work and has started doing this business just a year ago. Bilqees is very much hopeful that an investment will help him establish his business and increase his profits. 

Bilqees is married and her husband is a mason.  She is the mother of three sons. The eldest son works in a factory and the youngest son is studying in class 5th. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Bilqees.

loans.use: To buy a movie camera and film

loans.name: Mamudu E.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. This group of teachers is among the first group of applicants to have received a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders in the city. Like their counterparts in other regions of the country, they have applied for a loan of 21,800,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, through their school’s bursar, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 

The leader of this group is Mamudu. The 50-year-old was born in Kono. He is married and has seven children – four in primary school and three in secondary school. Having served in the teaching profession for 27 years now, Mamudu is requesting a loan of 1,900,000 SLL in order to renovate his house by buying house-building materials like bags of cement and paying workers, etc.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Niginamo

texts.ru: Нигинамо ответственная и предприимчивая женщина. В бизнесе она 11 лет. С 2000 по 2005 года она занималась продажей продовольственных товаров, позже  стала  заниматься куплей и продажей парфюмерии и кондитерских изделий. Она в разводе, у нее 3 детей. В бизнесе ей помогает дочь Муниса, которой 20 лет. Нигинамо  очень честная, трудолюбивая, поэтому имеет хорошую репутацию среди родных и знакомых. Нигинамо хочет обеспечить детей хорошей жизнью и будущим, развить бизнес, поэтому просит 2100$ США для увеличения товарооборота. Нигинамо благодарит вас заранее за  поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Niginamo is a responsible and business oriented woman. She is in business eleven years. Since 2000 to 2005 she has been selling household goods and later began to buy and sell perfumes and confectioneries. She is divorced and has three children. Her daughter Munisa who is 20 years old helps her in the business. Niginamo is very honest and hardworking and it's the reason why she has a good reputation among her relatives and friends. Niginamo wants to provide her children with good life and future, develop her business and is asking for a loan in the amount of $2100 USD to increase her sales volume. Niginamo is thanking all of you in advance for the support and help.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise.

loans.name: Martha Gregoria

texts.es:
Martha de 29 años. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada el “fortín”. Es una mujer muy empeñosa en su trabajo se destaca diariamente en lo que hace, ella tiene un comedor que inicio hace un año. Ya que ella se di cuenta que tenía el talento para la cocina.

La dificultad de ella es la delincuencia y la competencia. Ella solicita este préstamo para agrandar su negocio y comprar mercadería como: platos, cucharas, bebidas, etc.

Su sueño es terminar su casa de cemento, que su negocio este en un local comercial y que sus hijos puedan terminar la carrera escolar.
texts.en:
Martha is 29 years old and lives in a peri-urban area called 'El Fortín'.  She is a woman who is very committed to her work.  She distinguishes herself every day in what she does.  Martha has an eatery that she opened a year ago as she realized that she had a talent for cooking.

The difficulties that Martha faces are crime and competition.  She is requesting this loan to expand her business and to buy merchandise such as plates, spoons, drinks, etc.

Martha's dreams are to finish building her home from cement, for her business to be located in commercial premises and for her children to finish their education.

loans.use: to buy plates, a blender and glasses

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Oñondivepá”, se conformó en el año 2010, mediante la promoción hecha a la Sra. Delis, actualmente se encuentran en su tercer ciclo. Las señoras se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en equipo, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa Comité de Mujeres.
Una de las miembros es la señora María, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, comenta que empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del día, es allí cuando se levanta a prepara sus comidas. Dice que tiene muchos clientes los cuales siempre acuden a ella, pues tiene riza sazón.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes esenciales para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende, como ser carnes, condimentos y demás. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The Oñondivepá women's communal bank was formed in 2010 thanks to Delis' promotion.  They are currently in their third loan cycle.  The women are very comfortable working as a team and do so with great effort and care as a supportive and close-knit unit in the Comité de Mujeres program.

One of the members is María, who sells all kinds of food for a living.  She tells us the that she starts work very early in the morning, which is when she gets up to prepare her dishes.  She says she has many customers who always come to her because her food has great flavor.  

She is asking for this loan to buy essential ingredients to make the foods she sells, such as meats, condiments, and other things.  She thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they have given her.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, and other things

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: Maria Elsa tiene 68 años, su actividad se dedica al comercio de especies, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamiento por lo que se siente muy contenta con este medio de vida. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de romero, salsas, manzanilla, romero, clavo de olor entre otros. Maria tiene más de 22 años en este negocio, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener ella es una mujer trabajadora y disfruta de tener este medio de vida. sueña con ampliar su negocio cada dia.
texts.en: Maria Elsa is 68 years old and sells spices. This is not the first time that she has had funding for which she is very happy with this way of life. The loan she is requesting is to buy rosemary, sauces, chamomile, cloves among others. Maria has more than 22 years in the business which with a lot of effort she has managed to keep running. She is a hardworking woman and is happy with this way of life. She dreams of growing her business every day.

loans.use: to buy rosemary, sauces, chamomile, cloves and others.

loans.name: Vamig

texts.ru: Etot molodoy chelovek jivet v Absheron regione. On jenat, u nego yest odin rebonok. Vamig 28 let. Pochti 5 let tomu nazad on nachal rabotat shoferom v chastnoy firme, no potom on uje 2 qoda kak stal taxistom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy v svayo  vremya rabotal chastnim shoferom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya togo chtobi pochinit taxi tak kak on ne mojet rabotat poka ona isporchena. Vamig prismatrivayet i za svoyey mamoy kotoraya uje pojelaya i polzuyetsya mnogimi lekarstvami i poetomu yemu nujno poskoreye pochinit yeyo.
texts.en: This young man lives in the Absheron region.  He is married and has one child.  Vamig is 28 years old.  He started working as a driver for a private firm almost five years ago, but then became a taxi driver and has been working as a taxi driver for two years.  He learned this business from his father, who worked as a private driver in his time.  Currently, Vamig needs 2000 AZN to purchase spare parts and repair his taxi because he cannot work while it is not fixed.  Vamig looks after his mother, who is elderly and uses a lot of medicines, so he needs to repair his car quickly to continue supporting her.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and repair his car

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
Asma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her livestock business. With the loan investment, she will buy a buffalo to raise and sell for profit. She has been operating her business for many years and is confident that a loan investment will help her earn a higher profit from from her business. She also sews clothes in her spare time for her neighborhood clients and earns a reasonable income between the two businesses.

Asma lives with her two sons and her daughter. Both of her sons are studying and also help to support her outside their studies.

Asma is widow and has faced many hardships after the death of her husband. She has never given up hope and has raised her children with great effort. Her daughter is 22 years of age and Asma hopes that an improved business will enable her to provide a dowry for the marriage of her daughter in the near future.
 
She is a new loan applicant and is confident that it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo to raise and sell

loans.name: Elba De Jesus

texts.es:
Elba de Jesus tiene 46 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 4 hijos, vive con el esposo  y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El caimito, Perteneciente a la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo Corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.

Alba se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y a la agricultura.  Las compras  lo realiza en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura siembra de maíz y comprar abonos agrícolas. Con la ayuda de préstamo tendrá un mejor beneficio económico. El sueño es poder tener una casa. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En los tiempos libres le gusta ver televisión.

Con el crédito anterior invirtio en la agricultura, la situación de la familia ha mejorado, los ingresos han sido más notorios porque puede aportar en el beneficio de la familia.
texts.en:
Elba de Jesus is 46 years old and lives with her common-law husband and has 4 children. She lives with her spouse in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. The communal bank Jerusalen is located in the Caimito district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in the canton of Puebloviejo. This is an agricultural area which plants corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Elba is a housewife who also particpates in agriculture. The shopping is done in Ventanas, and she is asking for a loan to invest in corn seeds and to buy agricultural fertilizer. With the help of the loan she will have a better financial standing. 

Her dream is to have a house. She has not been presented with any problems. In her free time she likes to watch television.

With her previous loan she invested in agriculture. Her family circumstances have improved, and her earnings have been evident because she can contribute to the well being of the family.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Porceli

texts.en:
Porceli is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing/fish vending business. Porceli has been in this business for 15 years.  She earns additional income from nipa weaving.  Porceli has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for fishing

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El señor Benito es un señor trabajador, alegre, humilde, se dedica a la venta de chiles y tiene un pequeño local de servicio automotriz  donde ofrece sus servicios de 8:00  de la mañana a 3:00 de la tarde  y en las tardes se dedica a la venta y a la siembra de chiles.
Esta felizmente casado con la señora Lidia Clara es  una señora humilde  quien  le ayuda a su esposo  cuando va al campo.
El pidió el préstamo para comprar más semillas de chile para la siembra ya que sus  cinco  hijos le ayudan en la siembra.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado a  para apoyar  a su esposo e hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mr. Benito is a hardworking, kind, and humble man.  He sells chili peppers and has a small automotive business where he offers service from 8:00  a.m. until 3:00 p.m.  In the afternoons he sells and sows chili. 

He is happily married to Mrs. Lidia Clara.  She is a humble woman who helps her husband when he goes to the country.

He is requesting a loan to buy more chili seeds for sowing, since their 5 children help with the planting. 

He thanks the foundation for the support they have given him to help his wife and kids have a better future.

loans.use: to buy chili seeds for planting.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo que se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de la ciudad de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

Aquí vive la señora Carmen, tiene  39 años  de edad, es madre soltera de dos  hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad que estudian en colegio y escuela. Ella vive en casa de su mamá. Lleva más de seis años  en el Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del grupo y le gusta porque aquí se siente como en familia.

Ella se dedica a muchas actividades ya que además de ser una muy buena ama de casa también es auxiliar de enfermería, comerciante y  Artesana, elabora sombreros de paja toquilla y esto lo hace por las noches ya que también tres días a la semana se dedica a recorrer su localidad vendiendo cosméticos, ella dice que todo trabajo es bueno y que tiene que hacerlo por el bienestar de su familia, elabora los sombreros de paja toquilla y luego los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para luego llevarlos a otros lugares para su comercialización.  Lleva más de 14 años realizando esta actividad y que esto lo aprendió de su mamá.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es así como ciclo a ciclo puede sacar adelante su negocio, nos cuenta que su negocio ha estado muy bueno y que en los pagos no tuvo ningún problema ya que ella es muy cumplida y le gusta quedar bien para seguir recibiendo la ayuda de los créditos que ha sido de mucha ayuda en su vida ya que con las ganancias ella puede financiar la educación de sus hijos y los arreglos de su casa.
 
Este crédito es para comprar cosméticos y paja toquilla para elaborar los sombreros.
 
Su sueño  ver que sus hijos sean muy buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo Communal Bank [With Love and Faith Towards Development] meets every 15 days in Los Bajos in the city of Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture and its handicrafts. Its straw hats, for example, are known throughout the country as well as internationally.

Carmen, who is thirty-nine years old and a single mother with two children aged fourteen and twelve, lives here. Her children attend high school and elementary school. She lives in her mother’s house. She has been with the Communal Bank for more than six years and is the group secretary. Carmen likes being a member because she feels like she is part of a family. 

She is involved in many activities in addition to being a good homemaker. Carmen also works as a nurse’s assistant, a merchant, and an artisan. She makes straw hats in the evenings since she spends three days a week traveling through town selling cosmetics. Carmen says that all work is good and that she has to work for her family’s well-being. She makes straw hats and then delivers them to merchants who come to her house to pick them up before taking them to other places to sell. She has been in business for more than 14 years and learned this trade from her mother.

She is requesting the loan again since it is in this way, cycle to cycle, that she is able to get ahead with her business. She tells us that her business has been very good and that she has had no problems making payments since she is very committed and she likes being able to continue to receive the help the loans have provided her. The loans have been a great help to her in her life since with her earnings she is able to pay for her children’s education and also to make repairs to her house.

This loan is to purchase cosmetics and straw to make hats.

Her dream is to see her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to acquire straw to make hats and to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan is a 27-year-old married man. He is from Al Zarqa, Amman Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for his home improvements. In the future he wants to expand his home and increase the social economic status of his family. 
Since Ramadan is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements.

loans.name: Jesus Kpego Group

texts.fr: JESUS KPEGO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Innocentia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Innocentia est âgée de 35 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Innocentia ne vit plus avec son mari. Innocentia est mère de deux enfants. Aucun des enfants n'est scolarisé et un est a sa charge. Innocentia  vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Innocentia. Pour cette raison, Innocentia vend des lubrifiants depuis cinq environ ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de son enfant et à son éducation. Innocentia s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Innocentia sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe JESUS KPEGO, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des lubrifiants.

loans.name: Nculubi

texts.en:
Nculubi is married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  has electricity but no  piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. 
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, wheat flour  and maize . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, wheat flour  and maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rachel would like to buy an upgrade dairy cow

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a single mother with two children. She runs a small business selling flowers in downtown Uzhgorod. Nataliya does special decorating of cars for weddings, makes bridal bouquets and creates the finest floral arrangements for various special occasions. Her flower business has been the only source of income for her family. Nataliya has been in this business for ten years. Her friendly, prompt service brings back many repeat customers. Currently, she makes around $40-80 per day in gross revenue. Nataliya is a very enterprising lady. She believes she is nowhere near the limit for her business and is planning to open a unique flower storehouse unlike any other in the city. Nataliya is requesting a loan for $1,200 to purchase some equipment she will need for her flower storehouse. She’d like to buy a self-contained floral refrigeration system and condensate evaporators that will help keep her plants fresh and fragrant. Nataliya would also like to buy a variety of spring flowers such as daisies, tulips, carnations, daffodils and roses for further retail sale. Being a plant-lover, Nataliya knows that an assortment of flowers will brighten up many people’s hearts after the long, gray winter. She believes that with financial assistance and her commitment to provide the highest quality fresh flowers at competitive prices, she will not only be able to meet the needs of more customers, but she will also be able to provide a better livelihood for her family.

Наталія сама виховує двох дітей. Вона займається бізнесом з продажу квітів в центрі Ужгорода. Наталія прикрашає весільні машини, виготовляє весільні букети та створює прекрасні квіткові композиції для подарунків з будь-якої іншої нагоди. Її бізнес – єдине джерело доходів для її родини. Наталія займається цим бізнесом вже десять років. Завдяки її привітному та пунктуальному обслуговуванню в неї з’вилося багато постійних клієнтів. Зараз вона заробляє приблизно 40-80 доларів за день. Наталія – дуже заповзятлива жінка. Вона не хоче зупинятися на досягнутому, в майбутньому планує відкрити унікальну квіткову крамничку в своєму місті. Наталія просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб придбати необхідне обладнання для своєї крамниці. Вона хотіла б придбати облаштування для підтримки необхідного температурного режиму та розприскувачі води для того, щоб зберігати квіти свіжими. До того ж Наталія планує оптом закупити різноманітні квіти, а саме, ромашки, тюльпани, нарциси, троянди, тощо для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. Наталія сама дуже полюбляє рослини, а, отже, вона сподівається, що широкий асортимент квітів в її крамниці зігріє серця багатьох людей після довгої сірої зими. Вона також вважає, що фінансова підтримка та відданість своїй справі допоможуть їй придбати найкращі квіти за помірними цінами, задовольнити потреби покупців та покращити рівень життя її власної родини.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her flower shop

loans.name: Evang. Peace Oyakhil

texts.en: Mr. Evang. Peace Oyakhilomen I., a LAPO client of distinguished features, cherishes talking about LAPO loans, and the poor in Nigeria.  He is from Uromi, Edo State of Nigeria, and is married with one child.  He is bent on loyalty to LAPO and ensures that repayment is 100%.  He is requesting a loan of $550 to increase his goods.

loans.use:
To buy more materials for the production 
of aluminum.

loans.name: Ahliddin

texts.ru:
In Ahliddin’s region there are a lot of apricot trees. The residents of the region dry apricots every year in July and August and then send them to Russia for sales. Apricots are separated from their pits and spread out under the sun, creating dried apricots “kuraga” known locally as “kaisa.” The pits are sold separately. They are split and create another product called “magz,” which you can see in the photo.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

A large number of people are involved in the processing of apricots and pits and Ahliddin’s family is also involved. Last year Ahliddin took a loan from MLF MicroInvest for the processing of apricots. The resulting profits allowed Ahliddin’s family to make several family expenditures. Ahliddin got his next loan for the purchase of dried apricots. Today, Ahliddin wants to get another loan for the purchase and storage of apricots. В регионе где проживает Ахлиддин очень много абрикосовых деревьев. Население региона каждый год в июле и августе месяце сушит абрикосы, которые затем отправляются в Россию на продажу. Абрикосы отделяются от косточек apricots are separated from clingstone and spread under the sun, и таким образом, получается готовый продукт «курага» или по местному «кайса», а косточки продаются отдельно. Далее косточки раскалываются и получается еще один продукт называемый «магз». На фото Вы видите «магз». В процесс переработки абрикосов и косточек от них вовлечено огромное количество людей и семья Ахлиддина занимается этим тоже. В прошлом году Ахлиддин взял займ в Микроинвест на переработку абрикосов. Полученная прибыль позволила семье Ахлиддина совершить много семейных расходов. Следующий займ Ахлиддин получил на куплю продажу готовых сушеных абрикосов. Сейчас Ахлиддин хочет получить очередной займ на покупку и хранение сушеных абрикосов.

loans.use: Purchase and storage of dried fruits

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María and Néstor are a young couple, 20 and 24 years of age, who decided to start their own family and left Caracoto, their birthplace, in pursuit of new opportunities to prosper and improve their life standards.

Don Néstor offers transportation in a motorcycle taxi from 6:30 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. seven days a week, to make just enough money as this is the only source of income for this enthusiastic young couple. Doña María wishes to support her husband with the expenses of their home and would like to set up a food sales stand in order to save money and in the future be able to open a restaurant with the typical dishes from their home village.

To start this project she needs $275 which she will repay in a period of six months. This amount will allow her to start with a small stand and be able to save money for a restaurant in the future. You can be part of this success story for a young Peruvian couple.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

María y Néstor son una pareja de esposos muy jóvenes cada uno de 20 y 24 años de edad respectivamente hace poco decidieron unirse y formar su propia familia.Como toda pareja joven y entusiasta con muchas ganas de prosperar en la vida tuvieron que salir de su pueblo natal Caracoto en busca de nuevas oportunidades con el deseo de mejorar su calidad de vida.

Néstor se dedica a ofrecer servicios de movilidad urbana en un moto taxi ésta herramienta es la única fuente de ingresos económicos con el que cuentan actualmente y para generar ganancias sustanciales empieza su labor a las 6.30 de la mañana y la culmina a las 7:00 de la noche todos los días de la semana; por su parte María desea apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y para esto quiere emprender un negocio de venta de comida, con el fin de ahorrar lo suficiente para más adelante poner un restaurante en el que podría ofrecer los platos típicos de su tierra natal. Para emprender este pequeño proyecto ella hace una solicitud de 275 dólares; este dinero le permitirá aperturar su negocio de venta de comida en corto tiempo además les extiende su compromiso de esfuerzo y dedicación para realizar la devolución en un período de 6 meses. Tú podrías formar parte del éxito familiar de esta joven pareja peruana.

loans.use: Desea el préstamo para emprender un  nuevo  negocio de  venta de comida al paso, con el fin de generar mayor ingresos económicos

loans.name: Lai Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Lại Thị Tình is 55 years old. She is retired from the work force due to her health condition. In 2003, after learning a bit about TYM fund, she decided to become a member because she found that it would suit her situation. She applied for a loan to open up a stationary/souvenir store. In the beginning she did not have enough inventory so sales were low. After a while, she started getting more and more customers as she used her loan to add more products. She has a lot of students as customers. The office stationary items are good seller but the best ones are souvenir and gift items. Her business is going well, there are always customers in her store. The revenue from the store is quite stable. Ms Tình always participates in group activities organized by TYM despite the fact that she is very busy with her store. Her 2 children are attending university. This time she requests a loan of 325 USD to invest into her store, thus to raise her income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Lại Thị Tình, 55 tuổi, là một công nhân về nghỉ mất sức. Năm 2003 sau khi tìm hiểu về Quỹ thấy cơ chế rất phù hợp với điều kiện kinh doanh cô đã mạnh dạn tham gia vay vốn đầu tư cửa hàng dịch vụ. Lúc đầu cô chỉ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhỏ lẻ nên thu nhập chưa cao. Sau một thời gian, thấy việc vay vốn thuận lợi, mặt khác là nhu cầu tiêu dùng của khách hành rất đa dạng (đặc biệt là rất đông khách hàng là sinh viên ) nên mặt hàng của cô cũng được đầu tư rất phong phú, nhất là mặt hàng văn phòng phẩm, nhưng bán chạy nhất là các mặt hàng lưu niệm và các đồ sinh nhật. Công việc của cô đang rất thuận lợi, cửa hàng của cô lúc nào cũng đông khách nên thu nhập của cô rất ổn định. Công việc bận rộn như vậy nhưng cô Tình vẫn rất nhiệt tình tham gia các hoạt động chung của cụm, ngoài ra cô còn nuôi 2 con học đại học. Vòng vốn tiếp theo cô dự kiến vay 325 USD để tiếp tục đầu tư mở rộng kinh doanh tăng thu nhập cho gia đình

loans.use: Buy office stationary, present, souvenir

loans.name: Irma Garcia Cajamarca's Group

texts.es:
Margarita, Irma and DomitiL. have been partners of the Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas for nine, two and nine years, respectively. They tell us that the Banco Comunal helps them by giving them capital for their businesses and, as a result, they can take care of their homes. In addition, they have learned how to be punctual and responsible. Margarita cultivates and sells fruit and ornamental plants and flowers in a spot in the Cooperativa D. las Americas. She sells at wholesale and retail prices. Meanwhile, DomitiL. prepares and sells ceviche by wandering at the Huanta station. Previously, she traveled to markets with vegetables and fruits but she stopped this activity due to health problems. On the other hand, Irma sells Esika beauty products which she offers to friends and family. These women need loans of 600 soles, 300 soles and 400 soles which will be invested in the purchase of ornamental plants brought from Lima such as ficus, tulips, and roses, as well as in gardening tools, perfumes, lipsticks, nail polish, shampoo and fish. They will use their savings to educate their children and improve their homes. Margarita, Irma and Domitilia’s dreams are that their children become professionals, better than them, and that they can make improvements to their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Margarita, Irma y DomitiL. son socias del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas desD. hace 9, 2, y 9 años respectivamente. Ellas cuentan que su Banco Comunal las ayuda dándoles capital para su negocio y así pueden mantener sus hogares. Además, dicen haber aprendido a ser puntuales y responsables. Margarita cultiva y venD. plantas ornamentales, frutales y flores en un puesto en L. Cooperativa D. las Américas, venD. al por mayor y menor. Mientras que DomitiL. prepara y venD. cebiche ambulantemente en el paradero a Huanta. Anteriormente elL. viajaba a las ferias llevando verduras, frutas, pero dejó D. hacer esta actividad porque esta mal D. salud. Por otro lado Irma venD. productos D. belleza Esika que ofrece a sus amigos y familiares. Ellas necesitan un préstamo D. 600 soles, 300 soles y 400 soles que serán invertidos en L. compra D. plantas ornamentales que trae D. Lima como ficus, tulipán, rosas enanas, injertos, maceteros, perfumes, lápices labiales, esmalte, champú y pescado. Sus ahorros los utilizarán en L. educación D. sus hijos y para mejorar su casa. Los sueños D. Margarita, Irma y DomitiL. son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejores que ellas y poder hacer mejoras en sus casas.

loans.use: This group needs loans of 600 soles, 300 soles and 400 soles which will be invested in the purchase of ornamental plants brought from Lima such as ficus, tulips, and roses, as well as in gardening tools, perfumes, lipsticks, nail polish, shampoo and fish.

loans.name: Halima's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Halima, age 35, is married with 3 children (ages 18, 15, and 12). She has a business of selling spare parts, which started in 1998. She works from 7am to 12pm daily, and this business brings a monthly profit of about $280 from the sales.

Halima hopes to expand her inventory with a loan, which she will share with her subgroup. Her subgroup has businesses in food and stationery sales.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sun SaoR., 34, is a vendor selling a variety of grocery products in the Srass Keo commune part of Kampong Chnang province. Everyday she gains around $3 a day of profit from her sales. To supplement her standard of living, her husband Mr. Sim Sopheap, 39, works as a taxi-driver making on average $5 a day of profit. This couple has two childR. who are students. They strongly believe that their business would improve if they have a loan from Kiva org.

To improve their businesses and to make them successful, this couple categorizes the loan into 2 parts. First, they want to use this loan to purchase more groceries and sell them in large amounts. Second, they need to expand the business. With the principal’s plan they hope that their business will reach the target and gain more profit.

They will use the profit to send their child to a university. In conclusion, Sun and her family are grateful and appreciative for your trust and support.

loans.use: Sun would like to use this loan to purchase more groceries and sell them in large amounts.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 42 year old Mariam M.. She is single with one child, age nine.

In 2000, Mariam established a poultry business. She now requires a loan to purchase additional chicks to raise and sell. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. Who or what are kuku, you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and then either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular--maybe they are friendlier than other animals or prettier--but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Carlos Adolfo

texts.es:
Carlos Adolfo H. D. is a merchant who for some time has sold clothing in the Ruberto Huembes Market, one of the most well-known and visited in the capital city. He started his business delivering on order, and now has his own store in the market. He has two people helping him tend to customer needs, and he hopes in the future to improve his business and provide a better service. Carlos is 57 years old, single, and has one 20 year old son.

One of his aspirations is to grow his enterprise so he can continue helping his son prepare himself for better future prospects. With the loan, Carlos hopes to invest in his enterprise and this way be able to enhance his inventory with new merchandise to offer at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Carlos Adolfo H. D. es un pequeño comerciante dedicado desde hace mucho a la venta de ropa en el Mercado Roberto Huembes, inició su negocio colocando mercadería por encargo, este mercado es uno de los más conocidos en nuestra capital y por supuesto uno de los más visitados. El Sr. H. actualmente tiene su tienda en dicho mercado, cuenta con dos personas encargadas de atender a los clientes, espera en un futuro ampliar su negocio y brindar una mejor atención. Don Carlos es una persona de 57 años, soltero, tiene solamente un hijo de 20 años. Una de sus aspiraciones es lograr que su negocio pueda crecer y de esa manera poder continuar ayudando a su hijo a prepararse para que este tenga un mejor porvenir. Con el préstamo don Carlos espera invertirlos en su negocio y de esa manera surtir su negocio con nueva mercadería que será ofertada en dicho mercado.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to supply his business.

loans.name: Mercy Anita

texts.es:
Mercy belongs to the Dalilas Communal Bank. Her business is located at Jr. Las Gaviotas 467 in the Yarina Cocha District, in the Department of Ucayali. She is 29 years old and single. Mercy received her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles ($100) from Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos, which she decided to invest in a small store.

Mercy's store has grown as a result of the loan and because of her wise management of her income. She studies in the mornings and in the afternoons she looks after her business.
