Mercy will use this loan of 1,000 Soles ($375) to purchase: 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, oil, milk, eggs, soap, toothpaste, canned food, etc. The loan will be repaid in 4 months.

Mercy is very grateful to her communal bank and to Manuela Ramos for helping make her dream of having her own store come true. She feels more independent and successful.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señorita Mercy pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalilas, ubicado en el Jr. Las Gaviotas 467, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años es soltera. Mercy con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad su bodega ha crecido gracias a los préstamos y a la buena administración que ella tiene con sus ingresos, por las mañanas estudia y en las tardes se dedica a atender su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, aceite, leche, huevos, jabón, pasta dental, conservas, etc.

Mercy se siente muy bien gracias a su banco comunal y Manuela Ramos puede realizar su sueño de tener su propia bodega, sentirme mas independiente y realizada.

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Siala Maoama's Group

texts.en:
This new group in Vaitoomuli began in May 2008 and it is fast becoming one of the active groups in the programme. These women live close to the sea and so they prefer to do the fishing business. Their husbands, sons and other family members support them in running their businesses, and they are really honest and hard working. This is their first loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing boats, fishing nets, hooks, knives, chemicals and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
The house where I live doesn't have protection on the windows. This is why I would like to make them more secure so my family and I will be more protected. The area where we live is a little risky, since there have been robberies in some of the homes. I am requesting a loan of $500 so I can have more security for my home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

En la casa donde vivo no cuento con protecciones en sus ventanas, es por ello que quiero ponerlas ya que de esta manera tendría más protegida tanto a mi familia como a mí, pues en la colonia que nos encontramos es un poco arriesgada, pues ha habido robos en las casas. El préstamo que solicito es de $500.00 dlls. Y así tener más seguridad en mi hogar.

loans.use: To make her windows more secure

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann P., 46, is a rice farmer who lives in Siem Reap with her husband, Nginh Nghor, and their six children. Her husband works in construction, repairing and building roads for the city, making US$2.50 each day, while one of the children also works on roads and makes the same income. Vann P. would like to expand her farm and increase her yields, allowing her to sell more crops in the local market. She has asked for a loan of US$300 to purchase more rice seeds to expand her crops.

loans.use: Vann would like to purchase more rice seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Là một phụ nữ rất khéo tay nên hàng ngày ngoài chăn nuôi chị Hoạt còn làm hàng mã để bán nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000, đến nay qua 8 năm vay vốn để chăn nuôi và kinh doanh hiện nay kinh tế gia đình chị Hoạt đã rất phát triển. Chồng chị ngoài  thời gian đi làm công nhân tại nhà máy Z151 cũng hỗ trợ chị rất nhiều trong công việc chăn nuôi vì thế chị cũng có nhiều thời gian hơn để đầu tư cho công việc sản xuất và kinh doanh hàng mã của mình. Hiện tại anh chị đang sống cùng hai người con đã trưởng thành. Các con chị đều có công việc ổn định nên hàng tháng đều hỗ trợ bố mẹ thêm về kinh tế. Với nguồn thu nhập ổn định từ chăn nuôi, kinh doanh  và lương của chồng cuộc sống của gia đình chị ngày càng tốt hơn. Chị mong muốn được vay thêm vốn để đầu tư mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình.
 Mức vốn xin vay 15.000.000đ
texts.en:
Ms. H. is considered to be very skilled with her hands, so besides raising farm animals she also makes fine paper crafts to help with the family’s income. She has been a member of this funding since 2000. After 8 years of investing into her business and raising livestock, her family’s income has increased and since been steady. Ms. H. husband also contributes his time caring for the farm animals, in addition to his regular job at the Z151 Company. Her husband help has allowed Ms. H. more time to focus in on her business. They also have two grown children who also live with them. Her children are grown and both of them are able to contribute to the family financially with jobs of their own. Her family is able to live a better life with the resources coming in from her business, agriculture, and her husband’s job. She hopes to borrow a loan of 15.000.000d to help remodel and expand her farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru: Тоджибоев Толибджон житель района  А.Джоми. Возраст 37 лет, женат, имеет   3 детей. Образование среднее. Клиент занимается  производством  сундуков. В данный момент  сезон свадебных мероприятий.Сундуки являются необходимым атрибутом молодоженов. Этот вид деятельности является основным источником дохода его семьи.На кредит Толибджон хочет закупить строительные материалы для производства.Планирует погасить кредит в  течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tolibjon T. lives in the A. Jomi region of Tajikistan. He is 37 years old and is married with children. He is a high-school graduate and makes his living by producing storage boxes. This is his family's main source of income. Now is the wedding season in Tajikistan, and boxes are an essential part of wedding celebrations. Tolibjon would like to receive a loan for purchasing the necessary materials. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Noah Group

texts.en:
This is the Noah Group: Fatmata F. and Marie K.. They are local entrepreneurs in Kabala town who have each received previous loans from Kiva through SMT. The loans were a great help to these hard-working women, enabling them to take good care of their homes by feeding, clothing, medicating, and schooling their children. They are requesting a new loan for Le 1,600,000 to further empower them by strengthening their businesses and livelihood.

Fatmata is the leader of the group. She was born in Mayamba in eastern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-one and married with two children. One of her children is in secondary school and the other in nursery school. Her husband is an architect and the two work hand-in-hand in running the home.

Fatmata has been selling underwear for ladies for the past eight years now. She buys her goods in Freetown, about 570 miles round-trip from Kabala. Prices range between Le 250,000 to 300,000 per bale. Her greatest challenge now is to build her family a house with two rooms and to provide education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase underwear for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compa de mercadería

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Hun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan, which consists of eighteen members, is located in Chreaek Village in Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. S. H. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members to receive a loan. She owns a small grocery store where she sells grocery products. She is a 45-year-old widow with three children, two of whO. are fishermen while the youngest one attends the local school. Since their fishing business faces some problems, Mrs. S. H. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets and fish line for this business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.
 
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Sixteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end-of-the-loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fishnets and fish line for the family fishing business.

loans.name: Chet

texts.en:
Chet P. is 65 years old and lives with her husband, Som Chhen, 75, (shown in the photo) in Prey Chor District, Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband have a business selling natural medicines in the village, earning a daily profit of about $2. They have developed a good clientèle, as people who live in the province depend more upon natural medicines than commercial drugs. This couple has one child.

Chet is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a horse and cart for her son to operate a taxi. This will provide more income to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and cart.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly cuenta con 48 años D. edad, está separada del padre D. sus 5 hijos, actualmente vive en la casa D. su madre. DesD. muy joven apoyaba a su madre en la venta D. combustible para cocina; pero desD. que tuvo varios hijos y tras el abandono D. su esposo comparte el local con ella implementando un espacio para la venta D. abarrotes. Debido a las carencias económicas, desD. hace 5 años atrás también venD. golosinas D. forma ambulatoria en la puerta D. los colegios, ubicándose en el momento D. ingreso y salida D. los alumnos, D. lunes a viernes; negocio que le ha resultado muy rentable, y ahora  espera con ansias el mes D. marzo, que inicien nuevamente las clases, para que retome esa actividad. Nelly dice estar muy contenta con sus negocios, tanto D. golosinas y su bodega, por ello que está renovando una pared D. adobe, por material noble, para que su negocio sea un lugar más atractivo y acogedor para sus clientes. Ella es muy activa en su banco comunal, en el ciclo pasado tenia el cargo D. vocal, se encargaba D. pasar los comunicados del asesor D. crédito a los integrantes, este es su 12vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha pagado con mucha responsabilidad las cuotas señaladas. El dinero que solicita lo va utilizar en dos rubros: una parte es para mandar a hacer la puerta del renovado local  D. su bodega, y la otra parte es para la compra D. golosinas, ya que se aproxima  la épocas escolar.
texts.en:
Nellly is 48 years old and is separated from the father of her 5 children. She currently lives with her mother. From the time she was very young she helped her mother sell cooking fuel. With the birth of her children and her husband's departure, she now shares the shop with her mother and is setting up space to sell groceries. Due to economic hardship, for the past 5 years Nelly has also sold candy in front of high schools, positioning herself in the doorway at the start and end of classes, Monday through Friday. The business has been very profitable, and she is anxiously awaiting March, when classes start again, in order to resume sales. Nelly is very happy with her businesses, both the candy and the shop. For this reason she is replacing an adobe wall with one of better materials, so that her business is more attractive and welcoming for her customers. Nelly is very active in her communal bank. In the previous cycle, she held the position of spokesperson, in charge of passing communications from the credit assesor to members. This is her 12th loan with MFP, and she has always conscientiously paid the amounts due. The money that she is requesting will be used in two ways: one part is to have a door maD. for the renovated part of her shop, and the rest is for the purchase of candy, now that the school year is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix the wall in her shop and purchase merchandise

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn A. is twenty-seven years old. She is single and independent. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. Evelyn is a very skillful and talented hair dresser. She does all kinds of hair styles like plaiting, perming, weavons, etc. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service; therefore, she wants to use her loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc. to avoid shortages and poor service. She is a member of the community group called Fine Trust Group. In this group, members act as guarantees for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To procure beauty salon supplies

loans.name: Calistan

texts.en:
Calistan sells drinks and pepper soup in her shop. Calistan has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years and she lives in Okoko. Calistan is 35 years old and married with five children.

Calistan is requesting the loan of N70,000 to enable her buy more drinks and pepper soup spices to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pepper soup spices

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 56 year old Avelina G. from Mwanza. She is married with four children, between the ages of 24 and 34 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant because her parents do not take care of her. Avelina has been running a poultry or "Kuku" business since 2008. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. Avelina works at the business for 4 hours per day, 7 days per week and currently earns about 120USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase chickens and raise them. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Avelina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and raise them

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Mrs. Juanita M. is 53 years old and married with 6 children. She is into vegetable farming as her business and at the same time is a hard-working house-wife. She is also supported by her daughter who is currently working in Ozamiz City. She is applying for a loan from Paglaum MPC for the purpose of house repair.

She is hoping that someday she can own a residential lot with her effort through financing with Kiva.

loans.use: House repair

location.town: Ozamis-Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo S. es un caballero originario del municipio de Chichigalpa donde se dedica a su negocio de reparación de bicicletas también dedicándose a la venta de repuestos habiendo adquirido vasta experiencia en este ramo.

El motivo por el cual el señor Ricardo ha acudido hoy en día a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de los repuestos para ofertarlos y así continuar adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ricardo S. is a gentleman native to the Chichigalpa municipality, where he has a business repairing bicycles. He also sells spare parts, having acquired vast experience in this industry. The reason Ricardo has come to Ceprodel today is that he hopes to benefit from a loan for the purchase of spare parts to offer in his store, and thus continue to advance his business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Bilquis Liaqat Masih Group

texts.en:
Rani baji, Razia baji, and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Bushra baji and Bilquis baji each want a loan to buy material (colored thread, clothes and beads) for their decorative embroidery business. Parveen baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Bilquis baji is the ladies' group leader. They all live in a midsize city named Riwind, Pakistan. They all handle their own businesses to share the financial burden of their husbands. Bilquis baji takes orders for her decorative embroidery business from her relatives and neighbors, and after completing each order she earns money. She saves her money in a committee and plans to use it to expand her embroidery business. Her husband drives a donkey cart for carrying items like fruits and vegetables and construction supplies. She is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart because the old cart rotted and was run down.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca C. is 26 years old and has been married to Esequiel Duarte, 32 years old, for more than five years. Esequiel has been an employee of a local business since 1999, and he helps support the living costs of his family with his income. Together the couple has a two-year-old daughter. 

Mrs. Blanca started her business six years ago. It is located in the bus terminal in the city of Caaguazú. There she sells food, candy, sodas, and various other items. The current project for the couple is to be able to finish building their house, which lacks some details. They would also like to continue growing economically in order to give their children a better future. 

They are applying for the loan in order to buy more merchandise to sell that will increase the inventory they offer to clients.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel D. is from the village of Purok 9, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 26 years old, married to Nestor D., and has an infant child. Maricel owns and operates a business selling personalized accessories to the local community members and in schools. She has been engaged in her business for over seven months and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month. In July 2009, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and to improve her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale

location.town: Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom N., 27, is a villager in Trapaing Thmor village in Takeo province. She is a farmer and owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. She is also a pig breeder. Since her breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food for breeding. Additionally, she would use the rest of money to buy fertilizer to make her rice crop more productive. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Keo Phorn, is a construction worker. They have a 3 year-old child. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: By purchasing more piglets and pig food for  breeding and to buy fertilizer to make her rice crop more productive.

loans.name: Jhoniffer

texts.en:
Jhoniffer is 27 years old and married to Gladys when they were only 16 years old. They now have three children and they are all studying.  He operates a passenger tricycle in the village at San Ignacio, Quirino, Isabela.

Jhoniffer is patient in maintaining his tricycle transport business in order to give his family with their daily needs and in supporting the education of their children.  He is also glad that his parents gave him a small farm which is also their source of additional income.  For the maintenance of his motorcycle business, he is now asking for a business capital of PHP4,000.00 from the Kiva lenders.  He hopes that they will give him the chance to improve his business for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely S. is from the village of Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 36 years old, and married with four adult-aged children. To make a living, Mely owns and operates a business venture in the transportation sector. The main source of income for the business comes from operating pedicab transport services to local community members. Mely has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Mely joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Mely is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair existing vehicles to provide a better service. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. Mely plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a hardworking young entrepreneur. She is 26 years old and a married mother of two children. Agnes started her retail business in 2002. It has done well thanks to her first loan that helped her buy stock in bulk. She now requires 40,000 KES to enable her to purchase more supplies.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies

loans.name: Genie

texts.en: Genie T. is from the village of Sibugon, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Genie owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Genie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from GDMPC. Genie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is 45 years old. She is a wife and the mother of 4 children. Ama is resourceful mother and successful business woman. She works hard to be able to send her children to school.  Currently, her business is trading secondhand clothes and bedspreads in her neighborhood. She has inadequate working capital to support her business growth.  She believes that, with the loan she will be able to purchase more bales of second hand clothes and bed spreads. She hopes to save enough income to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 39 years old. She is married and has three children who all attend school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Gladys is a trader who runs a provision store by the roadside in her community. She has been in this business for nineteen years and requests a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock. Gladys desires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools and planks

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: Cirilo tiene una edad de 63 años, es casado, tiene un hijo que depende completamente de él, mismo que estudia, su esposa se dedica a la venta de comidas de manera ambulante, tiene su vivienda propia en Barrio Belén. Cirilo es empleado en la Alcaldía de la localidad donde vive desde hace 9 años, su esposa es comerciante de comidas de manera ambulante desde hace mucho tiempo. Hay competencia, pero la señora tiene muchos clientes por ser antigua en el negocio, Cirilo es el único jardinero en la alcaldía. El destino del crédito es para la ampliación de su vivienda. Es su cuarto crédito secuencial, y tuvo muy buen comportamiento en los demás créditos.
texts.en:
Cirilo is 63 years old, married, and has a child who is studying and completely dependent on him. His wife sells food as a street vendor. He has his own home in the neighborhood of Belén. He has been working as a city employee for nine years. His wife has been working as a food merchant for a long time. There is competition, but Cirilo’s wife has many long-time customers who patronize her business. Cirilo is the only gardener employed by the city.

His loan will be used to expand his home. This is his fourth loan and he has performed very well with all of his previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of his house

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two grown children. She has a degree in economics. Tatyana is a small market vendor from Dneprorudnyi, where she owns a clothing-sales business in one of the local markets. She owns a nice, spacious kiosk/store, which makes it very comfortable for her customers to try on different clothing items. Tatyana has been in this trade for over 12 years. Presently, she has 60,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory.  

Tatyana is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase the assorted inventory she offers for sale in her kiosk. She is planning to consistently develop her venture and see its further stable growth in the future.

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Rita Mercedes

texts.es: La Señora Rita tiene la edad de 44 años. Anteriormente ya había realizado financiamientos por lo que le han sido de muy buena ayuda. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, por los que luchar diariamente. La actividad económica de ella es la venta de ropa ambulante. Ella comenzó este negocio en compañía de su Mama,  hace 7 años ya que desde muy joven  aprendió este negocio y decide seguir adelante con la actividad. Por lo que ahora solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas y camisolas. Por lo que necesita diversificar sus productos para que sus clientes tengan mayores oportunidades de comprarle su mercadería. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio de tal forma que le permita mejorar la situación económica de su familia y brindarles a sus hijos la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Rita, 44, has three children under her care so she must struggle daily for them. She peddles clothing. She began this commercial activity with her mother 7 years ago. She learned this work from a very young age and decided to continue with it. She has had previous financing which has been of great help to her. She is now asking for funds to buy shirts, pants, skirts, sport shirts in order to diversify her inventory. Her greatest wish is to enlarge her business so that she can improve her family's economic situation and provide her children with the best education possible.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia, vive en la  calle Italia de la zona Urbanización Mercurio, de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y una de sus hijas menores.
 
La señora trabaja como colaboradora administrativa de su esposo el cual se dedica a la carpintería, realizando trabajos de puertas y ventanas en madera, en su taller ubicado en su domicilio

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una  materia prima es decir madera y accesorios para su trabajo.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito
texts.en:
Lidia lives on Italia street in the Mercurio neighborhood of the city of El Alto. She works as administrative assistant to her husband, who is a carpenter. He has his carpentry shop, where he makes doors and windows, in their home. She will use the funds to buy lumber and other carpentry accessories. This is her first loan with Impro. The socio-economic evaluation done indicates that she qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Women Of Progress Group

texts.en:
Marion W. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Women of Progress. She is 41 years old, married, and has four children who are 1, 4, 7 and 10 years old. In addition to her children, Marion also takes care of her siblings.

For three years, Marion has been selling charcoal at the Rock Hill Diamond Creek Market. She purchases high quality charcoal, which keeps people returning.

Marion plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more charcoal. Her goal is to grow her business and to have all of her children attend school.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Marion is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, la señora Juana R. se dedica con gran esmero a su actividad de venta de frutas y verduras ofrecidas a diario en el mercado desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

Actualmente ella está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de algunos perecederos o verduras como son yuca, quequisque, papa, cebolla, entre otros. Ella está esperando que su crédito le sea aprobado para así surtir sus estantes con las verduras.
texts.en:
Juana R., with great care, sells fruits and vegetables daily from early in the morning until nightfall at Managua's Mayoreo market. She is asking for funds to buy some perishable items or vegetables, like: yucca, arum, potato, onion, etc. She is hoping that the loan will be approved so that she can stock her shelves with vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more pigs in bulk for her business.

loans.name: C2349 Umoja Group

texts.en:
Francine is 36 years old and is married with five children aged between 3 and 13 years. Her husband works as a businessman; they both work hard for their family.

Francine is the leader of this group which is called Umoja in the Swahili language; this group contains five members and all of them own the small shop which sells various products. Francine has an experience of two years in her business of selling rice, salt, bananas, juice, soda, and a traditional soft drink made from sorghum which called ubushera in the local language. 

Francine and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing their business which will allow them to get ahead. With this loan Francine hopes to change her family situation through providing all the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Paulina De

texts.es: Paulina tiene 58 años de edad y recién ha quedado viuda ya que su esposo falleció de un paro cardiorrespiratorio. No tiene hijos pequeños que dependan de ella pero el único hijo que tiene aún vive con ella en su domicilio que es propio. Paulina  tiene su negocio de tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio con muchos años de antigüedad y ofreciendo sus productos a su vecindad. Paulina no tiene una competencia cercana por lo que tiene un buen nivel de ventas ya que compra al por mayor en los mercados más importantes y de mayor afluencia de la ciudad. El crédito se invertirá en capital de trabajo para su tienda ya que por la enfermedad de su esposo no ha podido dedicarle mucho tiempo y está un poco desabastecida. Paulina trabaja con la institución desde hace bastante tiempo atrás, más específicamente desde el año 2004 y ahora está en su quinto crédito el cual lo cancela sin contratiempos. También tiene un crédito en otra institución bancaria el cual esta cancelando de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Paulina, 58, has recently become a widow due to her husband’s death by heart attack. She doesn’t have any little children depending of her any longer but the only child she still has lives with her in her own home. Paulina has had a small grocery store in her home for several years offering her products to her neighborhood. She doesn’t have any nearby competition so her sales are good because she stocks buying at wholesale from the most important and busiest markets in the city. She will use the funds to stock her store because her husband’s illness caused her to neglect her business a bit and it’s somewhat destabilized. Paulina has collaborated with the institution for quite some time now, specifically since 2004. This is her 5th loan which she will repay without any difficulty. She has an additional loan with another financial institution which she is also repaying punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir B. is a 49 year old man who sells men's and women's shoes in the central bazaar of Imishli city. Tahir is married and has four children who are the central meaning of his life. Tahir started his business ten years ago and, since that time, he has become a very successful entrepreneur. Thanks to his good taste in fashion and his constant smiling face, Tahir`s shop is always full of customers. Tahir`s dream is to build his own shoestore. For this purpose he has applied for a 1200 AZN loan. He will spend this loan to purchase more seasonal shoes.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal shoes.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan D. is from the village of Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. She is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately $144 a month from this activity.

In 2005, Susan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Susan is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 8th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es:
Martha vive en Barrio de Quinuapata, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, Martha tiene una tienda muy surtida en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, gas, leña, también prepara chupetes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos, su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, leche, leña.
Martha sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliara su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Martha lives in the Quinuapata neighborhood; she’s married and has 4 children. Martha has a well-stocked store in her house where she sells assorted groceries like vegetables, meats, gas, and firewood. She also prepares ‘chupetes’ (fruit flavored frozen treats) with help from her children. She will use the loan to buy rice, cooking oil, milk and firewood Martha’s dreams are that her children become professionals, that she can expand her store and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, milk and firewood.

loans.name: Maria Solanda

texts.es:
María Solanda, vive en Portoviejo, la capital de los manabitas, una ciudad prospera y hermosa, llena de bellos arrabales, habitada por gente honesta y trabajadora.

 Solanda se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y también compra directamente a los almacenes, en ocasiones le toca viajar a Huaquillas o Guayaquil donde están los grandes distribuidorres, también tiene  una pequeña librería en su casa,  el negocio de la ropa lo tiene hace 12 años, y la  librería 7 años, cuando sale a vender deja cerrada la librería, no le ha ido tan bien en esto, mejor le ha ido en la venta de ropa, la cual tiene que pagar al contado.

 Tiene 5 años en la fundación Espoir trabajando con los créditos,este ultimo lo va ha invertir en la compra de mercaderia.
 
El sueño de Solanda es crecer en su negocio, tener un bazar completo, así incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
María Solanda lives in Portoviejo, the capital Manabí, a prosperous and lovely city full of beautiful areas and inhabited by honest and hard-working residents. Solanda dedicates herself to selling clothing that she buys by catalog and also directly from the warehouses. On some occasions, she must travel to Huaquillas or Guayaquil where the big distributors are located. She also has a small bookstore in her house. She has had the clothing business for 12 years, and the bookstore for 7. When she goes out to sell, she closes the bookstore, a business that hasn’t gone as well as her clothing sales, which she must pay for in cash. She has been working with credit through the Fundación Espoir for 5 years. This most recent loan she will invest into the purchase of merchandise. Solanda’s dream is to grow her business and have a well-supplied store, in order to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase blouses, pants, socks, undergarments.

loans.name: Paraiso De Los Claveles Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA PARAISO DE LOS CLAVELES, ESTA UBICADO EN TEPALCINGO, ESTADO DE MORELOS, MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 4 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN Y SON VECINOS.
 LA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO VIOLETA A. A. TIENE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA EL 3º. AÑO DE LA SECUNDARIA, TIENE 2 HIJOS 1 HOMBRE Y 1 MUJER, DAVID ALEXIS TIENE 15 AÑOS, Y DIANA KAREN TIENE 11 AÑOS LOS DOS ESTAN ESTUDIANDO. ELLA TIENE UNA CARNICERIA, Y VA A UTILIZAR SU PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR CERDOS VIVOS PARA LA VENTA DE CARNE Y SUS DERIVADOS POR KILO. LOS PRODUCTOS QUE SE OFRECEN SON CARNE, BISTESES, CHICHARRON, CARNE ENCHILADA, LONGANIZA, MANTECA, CHALES. INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE 4 AÑOS PARA TENER MAS INGRESOS PARA SU FAMILIA, ELLA LE AYUDABA A SU CUÑADO Y CON LA PRACTICA FUE APRENDIENDO TODO LO RELACIONADO CON EL NEGOCIO. SU CUÑADO SE VIO EN LA NECESIDAD DE CAMBIARSE DE DOMICILIO Y DECIDIO SEGUIR CON EL NEGOCIO, SU ESPOSO LE AYUDA EN LA MATANZA Y A DESTAZAR EL CERDO, SU HIJO LE QUITA LA GRASA AL CUERO Y LAVA EL PISO. ELLA ATIENDE PERSONALMENTE A SU CLIENTELA, DE LAS GANANCIAS UNA PARTE LAS VA AHORRANDO, TAMBIEN LAS VUELVE A INVERTIR Y DE AHÍ A PODIDO COMPRAR UN MOLINO ELECTRICO POR QUE TENIA UN MOLINO DE MANO TAMBIEN LE COMPRO A SUS HIJO UNA COMPUTADORA.
EL NEGOCIO ESTA EN SU CASA EN TEPALCINGO LE GUSTA SU COMUNIDAD POR QUE LA GENTE ES MUY AMABLE, SE REALIZA UNA FERIA EL TERCER VIERNES DE CUARESMA ACUDE MUCHA GENTE DE VARIOS LUGARES A VISITAR LA IGLESIA. 
LOS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON EDITH P. M. CON SU PRESTAMO VA A COMPRA PAN, VERDURAS, MAYONESA, CARNES Y FRUTAS PARA PREPARAR SU PRODUCTOS HAMBURGUESAS Y COCKTEL DE FRUTAS.
LA SEÑORA JACINTA M. O. VA A COMPRAR COSMETICOS, PERFUMES, LABIALES, MAQUILLAJES, DELINEADORES PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO. LA SEÑORA VIOLETA A. A. VA A COMRAR CERDOS VIVOS PARA MATAR Y DESTAZARLO Y VENDERLO POR KILO.
LA SEÑORA ERNESTINA C. F. VA A COMPRAR PERFUMES, COSMETICO, LABIALES, BARNIZ ETC.
LA SEÑORA VIOLETA A. A. QUIERE DIRIGUIR ESTAS PALABRAS A KIVA Y A FUNDACION REALIDAD “ESTOY AGRADECIDA CON LA AYUDA QUE ME PROPORCIONAN"
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called “Paraiso de los Claveles” (Paradise of the Carnations), which is located in Tepalcingo, State of Morelos, Mexico. The group consists of four members who know each other and are neighbors.

One of the group members is Violeta A. A.. She is 40 years old and completed her studies through the third year of secondary school. She has two children, a son and a daughter, both of whom are students: David Alexis (age 15) and Diana Karen (age 11). Violeta operates a butcher shop and will use her loan to buy live pigs so that she can sell the meat and other derivatives by the kilo. The products that she offers include meat, steaks, pork rinds, meat enchiladas, longaniza sausage, lard, and pork wraps. She started her business four years ago because she needed to earn more money for her family. Violeta received assistance from her brother-in-law, who taught her everything she needed to know about running the business. When her brother-in-law found it necessary to move away, she decided to take over the business and continue its operation. Violeta’s husband helps with killing and butchering the pigs. Her son is responsible for removing the fat from the hides and cleaning the floor. She plans to reinvest some of her profits in the purchase of an electric meat grinder because she currently has a manual one. In addition, she would like to buy a computer for her children.

Violeta’s business is located in her house in Tepalcingo. She likes her community because the people are very friendly. A fair is held every third Friday for Lent, so she is able to see people who come from different places to visit the church.

The members of the group are as follows: • Sra. Edith P. M. will use her loan to buy bread, vegetables, mayonnaise, meats, and fruits for preparing hamburgers and fruit cocktails. • Sra. Jacinta M. O. will buy cosmetics, perfumes, lipsticks, make-up, and eye liners to restock her business. • Sra. Ernestina Castañeda F. will buy perfumes, cosmetics, lipsticks, lip gloss, and other items. • Sra. Violeta A. A. would like to express these words to Kiva and Fundación Realidad: “I am grateful for the help you have provided to me.”

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire pigs for butchering

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia P. is from the village of Poblacion, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Virginia is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business venture in the Internet services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing Internet services in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Virginia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide Internet service in her community

loans.name: Koko

texts.fr: O. koko est une jeune femme célibataire et très dynamique, pour pouvoir subvenir à ses propres besoin, elle s'est lancée il y a un an dans le commerce de bijoux. elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. son stock de bijoux s'épuise, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de bijoux de différentes qualités afin d'accroître ses recettes et satisfaire les besoins de ses clients.
texts.en:
Koko O. is a young single woman who is very dynamic. In order to provide for her needs, she started selling jewelry a year ago. She gets her supplies at the large market in Lomé. Her customer base is made up of all types of people. Since her stock of jewelry is running out, she would like to get fresh supplies and is thus requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase jewelry of varying quality in order to increase her income and satisfy her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu A. is a 44-year-old  woman with two children. She has bred cattle for the last ten years. Poverty and lack of jobs pushed her to start her own business. As Arzu had previous experience working on a farm, her business has gone well and today, she has five cows. She also has enough room and fodder for even more cattle. So she decided to take a loan of 900 AZN and purchase more cattle and sheep. She wishes to increase her current income from 250 AZN to 500 AZN and the loan will allow her to do that. With her first loan from KIVA she was able to improve her business and recommended herself as a trust-worthy client of AqroInvest.

loans.use: purchase two cattle and four sheep

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen T. has been in the trading business since 2004. He rents a stall at one of the city markets, selling shoes and sneakers. Karen has applied for this loan to purchase a stock of new shoes.

loans.use: Purchasing new stock

loans.name: Mrs. Nhav Yeang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhav Y. was born in 1962. She will be the village bank president and was selected by 14 people who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. They are located in Angk Svay Chek village in the Takeo province. 

She and her husband, Mr. Duon Nuon, are farmers who own a small piece of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. He is also a fisherman. At this time, she has some problems because her field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mrs. Nhav Y. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she will hire a plow machine to plow her field and hire farming laborers. 

She is the mother of two children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the youngest one is attending school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
la señora Maria Santos M. A. tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Jose del Carmen Aguilera Cabrera, Maria se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia que esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion, el credito lo va a utilizar para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mas surtida su pulperia.
Maria vive en la aldea el Jocote a media cuadra de la iglesia remanente de Jesus.
su anhelo es terminar su casa.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Santos M. A. is 47 years old. She is married to Señor Jose del Carmen Aguilera Cabrera. Maria sells popular consumer products. She has a little general store that is located in her home. She is going to use the loan to buy more merchandise so that her store will be better-stocked.

Maria lives in the village of Jocote, half a block from the Remanente de Jesus church. Her dream is to finish building her house. She needs the income from her store to cover household expenses and to advance her family.

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, juices, water, soap, candles, matches, sauces, pastas, beans, flour, rice, sugar, and toilet paper to stock her store

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda L. is from the village of Tangaro, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Veneranda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Veneranda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, coffee, biscuits, and breads in the local community. Veneranda has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Veneranda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veneranda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Veneranda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Veneranda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Ana Leopoldina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Jazmines  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujer y Fortaleza.

La señora Ana es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución como por ejemplo el seguro de vida. Tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación ha tenido tres hijos, ya todos son mayores de edad. Su marido es empleado público.

Ella es profesora de profesión y da clases en un colegio de la ciudad, pero  también se dedica al comercio, tiene un local en su casa donde vende bisuterías y algunas cosas de bazar, trabaja en las mañanas ya que en las tardes se dedica a su labor en el colegio donde trabaja, allí también les vende a sus compañeras de trabajo. Compra su mercadería en Guayaquil y otras a artesanas de la localidad.

Este nuevo crédito es para comprar más mercadería y surtir aun más su negocio. Sus metas son jubilarse y dedicarse de lleno a su negocio que quisiera ampliarlo y tener un gran bazar.
texts.en:
The members of the Mujer y Fortaleza [Woman and Fortitude] Village Bank meet every fifteen days in the Los Jazmines neighborhood, in Portoviejo, which the capitol of Manabí province, and has been known for many years as the city of "Los Reales Tamarindos" [a soccer stadium].  

Ana is a founding member of the village bank and she likes the added benefits she gets, like life insurance. She's sixty-years-old, married, and from her marriage has had three children, all grown.  Her husband is a public employee.

Ana is a teacher by trade and teaches at a school in the city. She also has a business in her home, where she sells jewelry and assorted goods during the mornings; in the afternoons she teaches at the school and also sells to her coworkers.  She buys some of her merchandise in Guayaquil and some from local artisans.

Her latest loan is to buy merchandise to stock up her store even more.  He plan is to retire and work full-time at the store, which she would like to expand to have a big bazaar.

loans.use: To buy jewelry and assorted goods to sell.

loans.name: Milvia Azucena

texts.es:
Milvia tiene 20 años, vive en Condega, estudia II año de Ingenieria Agropecuaria, ella decicidio estudiar esta carrera, porque su Mamá se dedican a esto. Su Mama la ayuda a pagar la universidad, una parte la paga UCATSE con una Beca.

Ella realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Cultivar Repollo.

Desea finalizar su carrera, buscar un trabajo y mas adelante formar su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Milvia is 20 years old, and she lives in Condega.  She is in her second year of higher education in agricultural engineering.  She decided to study this career because her mother has this career.  Her mother helps her pay for the university.  UCATSE (Catholic Agricultural University of Trópico Seco) pays for part of her education with a grant.

She used this loan to buy supplies for a university project of cultivating cabbage.

She wishes to finish her career studies, look for work, and later form her own company.

loans.use: For a student agricultural project of growing cabbage

loans.name: Emprendedores De Vitarte Group

texts.es: Personas empeñosas por salir adelante y progresar en la vida, a si son los integrantes de la alcancía comunal Emprendedores de Vitarte conformado por 7 socios en su mayoría mujeres. Una alcancía nueva que tiene un solo objetivo, el salir adelante y obtener triunfos económicos. Un caso en particular es el de la señora Pilar Q. de 42 años de edad casada y madre de 6 hijos de los cuales 3 aun son menores de edad. Ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de yogur natural de forma artesanal también por las mañanas se dedica a la venta de comida. Los ingresos que genera de la venta de comida y de yogur la invierte especialmente en la educación de sus hijos y ahorros para el hogar, mas adelante le gustaría implementar maquinas para la elaboración de yogur. Con el presente préstamo lo invertirá en insumos para la elaboración de yogur. Al igual que la señora Pilar Q. cada integrante de la alcancía Emprendedores de Vitarte tiene una iniciativa de negocio que con esfuerzo están dispuestos a llevarlo a cabo,  no puedo concluir sin mencionar el esfuerzo y dedicación que ponen todos los días para el bienestar de sus familias y  negocios propios.
texts.en:
People eager to get ahead and make progress in life--that describes the members of the communal bank "Emprendedores de Vitarte" [Entrepreneurs of Vitarte], made up of seven members who are mostly women. A new bank which has just one objective, to get ahead and achieve economic triumphs. 

One case in particular is that of Pilar Q., 42 years of age, married and mother of six children of whom three are minors. She works in the production and sale of natural yogurt by traditional methods. In the mornings she also works selling prepared food. She invests the income generated by the sale of prepared food and yogurt especially in the education of her children and in savings for the home. 

In the future she would like to set up machinery for making yogurt. She will invest the current loan in supplies for making yogurt. Like Pilar Q., each member of the bank "Emprendedores de Vitarte" has a business initiative which he/she is motivated to carry out. 

I cannot finish without mentioning the effort and dedication they all demonstrate on a daily basis for the wellbeing of their families and their own businesses.

loans.use: To invest in yogurt-making supplies

loans.name: Dolorita

texts.en:
Dolorita C. is from the village of Estrella in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Dolorita is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Dolorita plants, harvests, and sells a variety of vegetables. Dolorita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Dolorita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dolorita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Dolorita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be Dolorita's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Sy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sy K. (shown in the photo) is 53 years old and lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has six children: three sons and three daughters. 

Mrs. Sy K. and her husband are flower farmers. They grow their own flowers, and also buy some flowers from their fellow villagers, for resale in Phnom Penh market. The couple purchases flowers on contract, so they need to pay money to the farmers first, before the harvest season. They hope to expand their business by buying more flowers for resale. 
 
Sy is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase flowers for resale.

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKKU LIGGEYE est créé le 15 décembre 2008 lors de l'inauguration de son Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 30 femmes qui sont originaires de quartiers différents mais qui chaque mois se réunisse au tour des activités du Banc Villageois. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de HLM NDIAMBOUR. 

Ndèye Ami C. debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elles est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de 2 garçons et une fille. 

fait du petit commerce. Elle vend des parfums, des écharpes. Elle vends aussi des vêtements pour enfants. Elle pratique cette activité depuis environs 06 ans.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle pourra renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices. 

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de prendre en charge ses enfants
texts.en:
The Takku Liggeye solidarity group was created on December 15, 2008 at the creation of Banc Villageois. It is composed of 30 women from different districts who meet each month within the framework of Banc VIllageois activities. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of HLM Ndiambour.

Ndèye Amy C., standing on the far right in the photo, is the group leader. She is 35 years old. She is divorced and has two sons and one daughter. [She] has a small business retailing items such as perfumes and scarves. She also sells children’s clothing. She has been in this business for six years. With her new loan she will be able to expand her stock so as to increase her income. Her goal is to be able to support herself and provide for her children.

loans.use: Purchasing perfumes, scarves and children's clothing

loans.name: Juana Bautista

texts.es: Juana Bautista tiene 46 años, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos de limpieza. Hace más de 17 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para su familia, sus 3 hijos están a su cargo el y su esposa le brindan la educación y las comodidades necesarias.  Inicio por medio de un amiga que le enseño con el paso del tiempo a Juana le fue gustando este medio de vida con todos los ahorros que tenia de trabajar decide iniciar su propio medio de vida. Ella está contenta con este financiamiento por lo que es la primera oportunidad para salir adelante.
texts.en: Juana Bautista is 46. She sells cosmetics and cleaning products. She has had this business for more than 17 years because she is always looking for a way to generate income for her family. Her three children are under the care of her and her husband, and they give them education and the necessary comforts. She started (her business) through a friend who taught her over time, and Juana liked this lifestyle with all the savings she had. She decided to start this way of life for herself. She is happy to get this loan because it is the first opportunity to move forward.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has  five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

Harriet has a business sewing and selling clothes. She has been in this business for 15 years, and she works six days out of every week. Harriet has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of material. Her goal is to eventually build a house. Harriet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.

loans.use: more rolls of material

loans.name: Ángel Enrique

texts.es: El Sr D.  labora como ayudante de mecánica  es casado, tiene dos persona a su cargo,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece la oportunidad que le brindan esta institución con  este  desembolso, para  construir un cuarto, comprar materiales arena, bloque ,cemento, cinz, piedrín, hierro, mano de obra.
texts.en: Mr. D. works as a Mechanic’s Assistant.  He’s married and has two dependents.  This is his first CEPRODEL loan.  He is grateful for the opportunity this institution gives him with this disbursement to build a room.  He will buy materials and supplies like: sand, concrete blocks, cement, zinc metal sheeting, gravel, iron rods and will pay labor costs.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Casipher

texts.en: Casipher is 34 years old, married, with three children, living in her own house in Hioma, Uganda. She started by selling milk and from her savings she was able to start up a bar and lodging which she has operated for 8 years. Her hardship is working from rented premises and her dream is to build a hotel. Caipher needs the loan to pay rent.

loans.use: to pay rent.

loans.name: Mrs. Sao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The 16 people who make up this village bank loan have selected Mrs. Sao to be the village bank president. They will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Sao is a chicken breeder and a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband is a cripple. This couple supports four children. Two are employed in garment factories, one is a construction worker, and the other is studying in the local public school. 

Now she wants to start a new business, so she needs some money to support it. Mrs. Sao is applying for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Reyson de 15 y Jessica de 18 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad que realiza Francisca es la venta de zapatos, todos los días desde muy temprano camina por las calles en busca de clientes. Pero ella no solo se dedica a vender calzados sino que también los confecciona, es muy buena realizando su trabajo, motivo por el cual también reparte sus calzados a otras vendedoras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es confeccionar los zapatos, por lo cual le pone mucho empeño, lleva 3 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los zapatos hasta su lugar de venta, ya que tiene que visitar muchos zonas, espera con el tiempo poner una tienda muy grande donde pueda vender los zapatos que confecciona. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, ha pagado puntualmente sus anteriores créditos y éste último espera pagarlo a tiempo también, en su banco comunal es muy participativa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevos materiales para confeccionar una mayor cantidad de zapatos.
texts.en:
Francisca is 40 years old and a simple and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home with her two children Reyson, 15, and Jessica, 18, who she would like to give a better quality of life.  

Francisca works selling shoes.  Beginning very early in the morning every day, she travels the streets looking for customers.  In addition to selling shoes, she also makes them.  She is very good at her work, so she also sells her shoes to other vendors.  The thing she likes best about her work is making the shoes, and she puts a lot of effort into it.  She has done this work for three years.  She thinks the most difficult thing about her work is transporting the shoes to where they are sold, because she has to visit many different areas.  She hopes that in the future she will have a large store where she can sell all the shoes she makes.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she has paid all of her past loans on time, and she plans to pay this loan on time also.  Her community bank is very active.  With the 2000 nuevos soles she has requested, she will purchase new materials to make a larger quantity of shoes.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es: Flor tiene 44  años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa familiar en la ciudad de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Gana la vida vendiendo dulces y chifles, un tentempié popular de América del Sur hecho de plátanos fritos. Cuenta con un puesto ambulante en el centro de Lambayeque desde hace 10 años. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de dulces y chifles para vender. Por ello, ha acudido a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) para solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Con los ingresos de su negocio, Flor puede ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia. Su mayor anhelo para su negocio es algún día tener una tienda para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Flor, 44, is married and has two children.  She lives in the family home in the city of Lambayeque in the north of Perú.  She earns her living selling candy and “chifles” a popular South American snack made from fried bananas.  She has had a sales cart in downtown Lambayeque for 10 years.

She wants to expand the business buying more candy and chifles to sell.  To do so, she’s called upon Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to request a 1000 new sol loan.

Flor can use income from her business to help her husband with the economic support of the family.  Her greatest wish for her business is to have a store some day in which to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy more candy and fried banana chips to sell.

loans.name: Lidia Esther

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo, la señora Lidia se preocupa por brindarle a su familia un techo digno donde habitar y sobre todo con mucha seguridad. Ella se dedica con gran ahínco a laborar con el fin de llevar a cabo su sueño de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia por medio de la mejora de su vivienda que ha sufrido muchos daños por fenómenos naturales como fuertes lluvias y vientos por lo que merece ser reparada.

Por ello es que está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de algunos materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, hierro y otros para levantar un cuarto y darle buenas condiciones de vida a su amada familia. Según comenta, inmediatamente que tenga el crédito, comenzará la obra de mejora en su vivienda.
texts.en:
With much enthusiasm, Lidia is concerned building a decent roof for her family so that they feel more secure. She is hoping to improve her life and that of her family by improving their living conditions. Her home has suffered a number of natural disasters such as heavy rain and high winds, and as such needs to be repaired.

For this reason she is asking for a loan to invest directly in the purchase of some construction materials such as cement, sand, iron and others to build a room and improve the conditions of her home for her family. She states that immediately upon receiving the loan, she will start the project.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home.
